As [the big liner]274-the big liner hung over the tugs swarming about [her]274-the big liner in [the bay of [Algiers]1-algiers]275-the bay of algiers , [Martin Boyne]114-boyne looked down from [the promenade deck]276-the promenade deck on the troop of [first - class passengers struggling up the gangway]277-first - class passengers struggling up the gangway , [their]277-first - class passengers struggling up the gangway faces all unconsciously lifted to [his]114-boyne inspection . “ Not a soul [I]114-boyne shall want to speak to — as usual ! ”[114-boyne] [Some men]278-some men ’s luck in travelling was inconceivable . [They]278-some men had only to get into [a train]279-a train or on board [a boat]280-a boat to run across [an old friend]281-an old friend ; or , what was more exciting , make a new one . [They]278-some men were always finding [themselves]278-some men in [the same compartment]282-the same compartment , or in [the same cabin]283-the same cabin , with [some wandering celebrity]284-some wandering celebrity , with [the owner of [a famous house]286-a famous house]285-the owner of a famous house , [of a noted collection , or of an odd and amusing personality]287-of a noted collection , or of an odd and amusing personality — the latter case being , of course , the rarest as it was the most rewarding . There was , for instance , [[Martin Boyne]114-boyne ’s own Great - Uncle [Edward]115-uncle edward]288-martin boyne ’s own great - uncle edward . [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward ’s travel - adventures were famed in [the family]289-the family . At [home]290-home in [America]2-america , amid the solemn upholstery of [[his]115-uncle edward [Boston]3-boston house]291-his boston house , [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward was the model of complacent dullness ; yet whenever [he]115-uncle edward got on board [a steamer]292-a steamer , or into [a train]279-a train ( or a _ diligence _ , in [his]115-uncle edward distant youth ) , [he]115-uncle edward was singled out by fate as [the hero of some delightful encounter]294-the hero of some delightful encounter . It would be [Rachel]116-rachel during [her]116-rachel ill - starred tour of [the States]295-the states ; [Ruskin]117-ruskin on [the lake of [Geneva]4-geneva]296-the lake of geneva ; [the Dean of [Canterbury]5-canterbury]297-the dean of canterbury as [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward , with all the appropriate emotions , was gazing on [the tomb of [the Black Prince]299-the black prince]298-the tomb of the black prince ; or [the Duke of [Devonshire]6-devonshire of [his]115-uncle edward day]118-the duke of devonshire of his day , as [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward put a courteous ( but probably pointless ) question to [the housekeeper showing [him]115-uncle edward over [Chatsworth]7-chatsworth]300-the housekeeper showing him over chatsworth . And instantly [he]115-uncle edward would receive a proscenium box from [Rachel]116-rachel for [her]116-rachel legendary first night in [Boston]3-boston , or be entreated by [Ruskin]117-ruskin to join [him]115-uncle edward for a month in [Venice]8-venice ; or [the Dean]301-the dean would invite [him]115-uncle edward to stay at [the Deanery]302-the deanery , [the Duke at [Chatsworth]7-chatsworth]303-the duke at chatsworth ; and the net result of these experiences would be that [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward , if questioned , would reply with [his]115-uncle edward sweet frosty smile : “ Yes , [Rachel]116-rachel had talent but no beauty ”[115-uncle edward] ; or : “ [No one]2415-no one could be more simple and friendly than [the Duke]2416-the duke ”[115-uncle edward] ; or : “ [Ruskin]117-ruskin really had all the appearances of [a gentleman]2417-a gentleman . ”[115-uncle edward] Such were the impressions produced on [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward by [his]115-uncle edward unparalleled success in the great social scenes through which , for a period of over sixty years , [he]115-uncle edward moved with benignant blindness . Far different was the case of [[his]115-uncle edward great - nephew]304-his great - nephew . No tremor of thought or emotion would , in similar situations , have escaped [Martin Boyne]114-boyne : [he]114-boyne would have burst all the grapes against [his]114-boyne palate . But though [he]114-boyne was given to travel , and though [he]114-boyne had travelled much , and [his]114-boyne profession as [a civil engineer]305-a civil engineer had taken [him]114-boyne to [interesting and out - of - the - way parts of [the world]307-the world]306-interesting and out - of - the - way parts of the world , and though [he]114-boyne was always on the alert for agreeable encounters , it was never at such times that they came to [him]114-boyne . [He]114-boyne would have loved adventure , but adventure worthy of the name perpetually eluded [him]114-boyne ; and when it has eluded [a man]308-a man till [he]308-a man is over forty it is not likely to seek [him]308-a man out later . “ [I]114-boyne believe it ’s something about the shape of [my]114-boyne nose , ”[114-boyne] [he]114-boyne had said to [himself]114-boyne that very morning as [he]114-boyne shaved in [[his]114-boyne spacious cabin]309-his spacious cabin on [the upper deck of [the big Mediterranean cruising - steamer]311-the big mediterranean cruising - steamer]310-the upper deck of the big mediterranean cruising - steamer . The nose in question was undoubtedly not adventurous in shape ; it did not thrust itself far forward into [other people]312-other people ’s affairs ; and the eyes above , wide apart , deep - set , and narrowed for closer observation , were of a guarded twilight gray which gave the nose no encouragement whatever . “ [Nobody]2418-nobody worth bothering about—_as usual _ , ”[114-boyne] [he]114-boyne grumbled . For the day was so lovely , [the harbour of [Algiers]1-algiers]313-the harbour of algiers so glittering with light and heat , [his]114-boyne own mood so full of holiday enterprise — it was [his]114-boyne first vacation after a good many months on a hard exhausting job — that [he]114-boyne could hardly believe [he]114-boyne really looked to the rest of [the world]307-the world as [he]114-boyne had seen [himself]114-boyne that morning : [a critical cautious man of forty - six]315-a critical cautious man of forty - six , whom [nobody could possibly associate with the romantic or the unexpected]316-nobody could possibly associate with the romantic or the unexpected . “ Usual luck ; best [I]114-boyne can hope for is to keep [[my]114-boyne cabin]2419-my cabin to [myself]114-boyne for the rest of the cruise , ”[114-boyne] [he]114-boyne pondered philosophically , hugging [himself]114-boyne at the prospect of another fortnight of sea - solitude before — well , before the fateful uncertainty of what awaited [him]114-boyne just beyond the voyage .... “ And [I]114-boyne have n’t even _ seen _ [her]319-a young woman for five years ! ”[114-boyne] [he]114-boyne reflected , with that feeling of hollowness about the belt which prolonged apprehension gives . [Passengers]317-passengers were still climbing [the ship]318-the ship ’s side , and [he]114-boyne leaned and looked again , this time with contracted eyes and a slight widening of [his]114-boyne cautious nostrils . [His]114-boyne attention had been drawn to [a young woman]319-a young woman — [a slip of [a girl]321-a girl]320-a slip of a girl , rather — with [a round flushed baby on [her]319-a young woman shoulder]322-a round flushed baby on her shoulder , [a baby much too heavy for [her]319-a young woman slender frame]323-a baby much too heavy for her slender frame , but on whose sleepy countenance [her]319-a young woman own was bent with a gaze of solicitude which wrung a murmur of admiration from [Boyne]114-boyne . “ [Jove]119-jove — if [a fellow]2420-a fellow was younger ! ”[324-men of forty - six] [Men of forty - six]324-men of forty - six do not gasp as frequently at the sight of a charming face as [they]324-men of forty - six did at twenty ; but when the sight strikes [them]324-men of forty - six it hits harder . [Boyne]114-boyne had not been looking for pretty faces but for interesting ones , and it rather disturbed [him]114-boyne to be put off [his]114-boyne quest by anything so out of [his]114-boyne present way as excessive youth and a rather pathetic grace . “ [Lord]2421-lord — [the child]2422-the child ’s ever so much too heavy for [her]326-the girl . Must have been married out of [the nursery]2423-the nursery : [damned cad]2424-damned cad , not to — ”[114-boyne] The young face mounting toward [him]114-boyne continued to bend over [the baby]325-the baby , [the girl]326-the girl ’s frail shoulders to droop increasingly under [their]327-their burden , as the congestion ahead of [her]319-a young woman forced [the young lady]328-the young lady to maintain [her]328-the young lady slanting position halfway up [the liner]329-the liner ’s flank . [A nurse in correct bonnet and veil]330-a nurse in correct bonnet and veil touched [her]319-a young woman shoulder , as if offering to relieve [her]319-a young woman ; but [she]330-a nurse in correct bonnet and veil only tightened [her]330-a nurse in correct bonnet and veil arm about [the child]2422-the child . Whereupon [the nurse]332-the nurse , bending , lifted in [her]332-the nurse own arms [a carrot - headed little girl of four or five in a gaudy gipsy - like frock]333-a carrot - headed little girl of four or five in a gaudy gipsy - like frock . “ What — another ? Why , it ’s barbarous ; it ought to be against the law ! [The poor little thing]2425-the poor little thing — ”[332-the nurse] Here [Boyne]114-boyne ’s attention was distracted by the passage of [a deck - steward]334-a deck - steward asking where [he]114-boyne wished [his]114-boyne chair placed . [He]114-boyne turned to attend to this matter , and saw , on the chair next to [his]114-boyne , a tag bearing the name : “ [Mrs. Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater . ”[120-mrs. wheater] [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater — [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ! What an absurd name ... and somehow [he]114-boyne remembered to have smiled over it in the same way years before .... But , [good Lord , of _ course _]335-good lord , of _ course _ ! How long [he]114-boyne must have lived out of [the world]307-the world , on [his]114-boyne engineering jobs , first in [the Argentine]10-the argentine , then in [Australia]11-australia , and since the war in [Egypt]12-egypt — how out of step [he]114-boyne must have become with the old social dance of [New York]13-new york , not to situate [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater at once as [the big red - faced Chicagoan who was at [Harvard]14-harvard with [him]114-boyne , and who had since become one of [the showiest of [New York]13-new york millionaires]338-the showiest of new york millionaires]337-the big red - faced chicagoan who was at harvard with him , and who had since become one of the showiest of new york millionaires . [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , of course — [the kind of fellow who was spoken of , respectfully , as having “ interests ”[120-mrs. wheater] everywhere]339-the kind of fellow who was spoken of , respectfully , as having “ interests ” everywhere : [Boyne]114-boyne recalled having run across [Wheater]120-mrs. wheater “ interests ”[120-mrs. wheater] even in [the Argentine]340-the argentine . But [the man]341-the man [himself]341-the man , at any rate since [his]341-the man marriage , was reputed to be mainly interested in [Ritz Hotels]15-ritz hotels and [powerful motorcars]342-powerful motorcars . Had n’t [he]341-the man [a steam - yacht]343-a steam - yacht too ? [He]341-the man had [a wife]344-a wife , at any rate — it was all coming back to [Boyne]114-boyne : [he]341-the man had married , it must be sixteen or seventeen years ago , [that good - looking Mervin girl , of [New York]13-new york — [Joyce Mervin]121-boyne — whom [Boyne]114-boyne [himself]114-boyne had danced and flirted with through a remote winter not long after [Harvard]14-harvard]121-boyne . [Joyce Mervin]121-boyne : [she]121-boyne had written to [him]341-the man to announce [her]121-boyne engagement , had enclosed a little snap - shot of [herself]121-boyne with “ Goodbye , [Martin]114-boyne , ”[121-boyne] scrawled across it . Had [she]121-boyne rather fancied [Boyne]114-boyne — [Boyne]114-boyne wondered ? [He]114-boyne had been too poor to try to find out [....]122-.... And now [he]341-the man and [she]121-boyne were going to be [deck - neighbours]345-deck - neighbours for a fortnight on [the magic seas between [Algiers]1-algiers and [Venice]8-venice]346-the magic seas between algiers and venice ! [He]114-boyne remembered the face [he]114-boyne had contemplated that morning in [his]114-boyne shaving - glass , and thought : “ Very likely [she]121-boyne has n’t changed a bit ; [smart women]2426-smart women last so wonderfully ; but [she]121-boyne wo n’t know _ [me]114-boyne _ . ”[114-boyne] The idea was half depressing and half reassuring . After all , it would enable [him]114-boyne to take [his]114-boyne observations — and to have [his]114-boyne deck - chair moved , should the result be disappointing . [The ship]318-the ship had shaken [[her]318-the ship insect - like flock of tugs and [sailing - boats]349-sailing - boats]348-her insect - like flock of tugs and sailing - boats off [her]318-the ship quivering flanks ; and now the great blue level spread before [her]318-the ship as [she]318-the ship headed away toward the morning . [Boyne]114-boyne got a book , pulled [his]114-boyne hat over [his]114-boyne nose , and stretched out in [his]114-boyne deck - chair , awaiting [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater .... “ This will do — yes , [I]321-a girl think this will do , ”[321-a girl] said a fluty immature voice , [a girl]321-a girl ’s voice , at [his]114-boyne elbow . [Boyne]114-boyne tilted [his]114-boyne head back , and saw , a few steps off , [the slim girl who had carried [the heavy baby]352-the heavy baby up [the gangway]353-the gangway]351-the slim girl who had carried the heavy baby up the gangway . [The girl]326-the girl paused , glanced along the line of seats in [his]114-boyne direction , nodded to [a deck - steward]334-a deck - steward , and disappeared into the doorway of [a “ luxe ”[326-the girl] _ suite]356-a “ luxe ” _ suite _ farther forward . In the moment of [her]326-the girl pause [Boyne]114-boyne caught a small pale face with anxiously wrinkled brows above brown eyes of tragic width , and round red lips which , at the least provocation , might bubble with healthy laughter . It did not occur to [him]114-boyne now to ask if the face were pretty or not — there were too many things going on in it for that . As [she]326-the girl entered [[her]326-the girl cabin]357-her cabin [he]114-boyne heard [her]326-the girl say , in [her]326-the girl firm quick voice , to [some one within]358-some one within : “ [Nanny]2427-nanny , has [Chip]123-chip had [his]123-chip [Benger]124-benger ? Who ’s got [the cabin]2428-the cabin with [Terry]198-terry ? ”[326-the girl] “ What [a mother]2429-a mother ! ”[114-boyne] [Boyne]114-boyne thought , still wondering if it were not much too soon for that maternal frown to have shadowed [her]326-the girl young forehead . “ Beg pardon , [sir]2430-sir — there ’s [a new passenger booked for [[your]2430-sir cabin]2432-your cabin]2431-a new passenger booked for your cabin . ”[359-the steward] [The steward]359-the steward was passing with a couple of good - looking suit - cases and a bundle of rugs . “ Oh , damn — well , it had to happen ! ”[114-boyne] [Boyne]114-boyne , with a groan , stood up and followed [the steward]359-the steward . “ Who is it , do [you]359-the steward know ? ”[359-the steward] “ Could n’t say , [sir]2430-sir . [Wheater]198-terry — [Wheater]198-terry ’s the name . ”[359-the steward] Well , at last a coincidence ! [Mrs. Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s chair was next to [his]114-boyne own , and [[his]114-boyne old Harvard class - mate]361-his old harvard class - mate was to share [[his]114-boyne cabin]362-his cabin with [him]114-boyne . [Boyne]114-boyne , if not wholly pleased , was at least faintly excited and interested by this unexpected combination of circumstances . [He]114-boyne turned , and saw [a little boy]363-a little boy standing in the door of [the cabin]2428-the cabin , mustering [him]363-a little boy with a dispassionate eye . “ All right — this will do , ”[365-the boy] said [the boy]365-the boy quietly . [He]365-the boy spoke in a slightly high - pitched voice , neither querulous nor effeminate , but simply thin and a little tired , like [[his]365-the boy slender person]366-his slender person . [Boyne]114-boyne guessed [him]365-the boy to be about eleven years old , and too tall and reasonable for [his]365-the boy age — another evidence of the physical frailty betrayed by [his]365-the boy voice . [He]365-the boy was neatly dressed in English school - boy clothes , but [he]365-the boy did not look English , [he]365-the boy looked cosmopolitan : as if [he]365-the boy had been sharpened and worn down by contact with too many different civilizations — or perhaps merely with [too many different hotels]367-too many different hotels . [He]365-the boy continued to examine [Boyne]114-boyne , critically but amicably ; then [he]365-the boy remarked : “ [I]365-the boy ’m in [here]2434-here , [you]114-boyne know . ”[365-the boy] “ [You]114-boyne are ? [I]365-the boy thought it was to be [[your]114-boyne father]2435-your father ! ”[365-the boy] “ Oh , did [you]114-boyne ? That ’s funny . Everything that seemed at first to enlighten [him]114-boyne ended only by deepening [his]114-boyne perplexity . “ Do [you]121-boyne know that [Joyce]121-boyne , as [you]121-boyne call [her]121-boyne , used to be [a great friend of [mine]121-boyne]2482-a great friend of mine years ago ? ”[121-boyne] There could be no harm , at least , in risking that . “ Oh , was [she]121-boyne ? How jolly ! [She]121-boyne says [she]121-boyne looked exactly like [Blanca]128-blanca then . Did [she]121-boyne ? It ’s [her]121-boyne great unhappiness . ”[121-boyne] [Boyne]121-boyne laughed . “ [You]121-boyne mean [she]121-boyne has n’t any worse ones ? ”[121-boyne] “ Oh , no . Not now . [They]2483-they ’ve been on a new honeymoon since [Chip]123-chip ... have n’t [they]2483-they , [old Chippo]136-old chippo ? ”[137-joyce] “ [They]2483-they ... ? ”[121-boyne] On [a new honeymoon]456-a new honeymoon ? But [the young lady]328-the young lady ’s confidences seemed to invite [his]459-his own . Or was it just that [she]328-the young lady had the new easy way with [people]463-people ? Very likely . Still , an old fogey out of [the wilderness]464-the wilderness might be excused for taking it as something more — a sign of sympathy , almost an invitation to meet [her]328-the young lady fresh allusions with fresh questions . “ Yes ; [we]2484-we were [friends]2485-friends — really great friends for a winter .... ”[328-the young lady] ( “ That ’s long , for [Joyce]137-joyce , ”[328-the young lady] said [[his]459-his neighbour]408-his neighbour parenthetically . ) “ [... such good friends]2486-... such good friends that [I]328-the young lady should like to tell [you]2486-... such good friends [my]328-the young lady name : [Martin Boyne]114-boyne — and to ask what [your]2486-... such good friends — ”[328-the young lady] “ Oh—_oh ! ! ! _ ”[328-the young lady] [She]328-the young lady shrilled it out so precipitately that it cut [his]459-his last word in two . At first [he]459-his could not guess the cause of this new disturbance ; but in a moment [he]459-his discovered [the young Bun]466-the young bun walking with bare feet and a cat - like agility along the backs of the outer row of deck - chairs , while [[their]467-their occupants]468-their occupants ducked out of [his]459-his way and laughed [their]468-their occupants approval of [his]459-his skill . “ [She]328-the young lady was also [a tight - rope dancer]2487-a tight - rope dancer — [[his]459-his mother]2471-his mother was , ”[326-the girl] [the girl]326-the girl flung back , leaping in [Bun]135-bun ’s direction . [Having]138-having caught and cuffed [him]459-his , and cuffed [him]459-his again in answer to [his]459-his furious squeals , [she]326-the girl dragged [him]459-his away to [the firm dishevelled lady who had previously dealt with [him]459-his]470-the firm dishevelled lady who had previously dealt with him . At the first sound of the gong [[his]114-boyne neighbour]408-his neighbour was on [her]408-his neighbour feet , hardly heeding [his]114-boyne suggestion that , if [she]408-his neighbour had not already chosen [her]408-his neighbour seat , [they]472-us might meet at a table for two in [the restaurant]473-the restaurant . “ Thanks a lot ; but of course [I]114-boyne lunch with [[my]114-boyne children]2493-my children . ”[114-boyne] And [he]114-boyne remembered with regret that [[their]472-us ocean - palace]474-their ocean - palace had [a separate dining - room for [youthful passengers]476-youthful passengers]475-a separate dining - room for youthful passengers . “ Dash it — [I]114-boyne should have liked a few minutes ’ quiet talk with [her]408-his neighbour . ”[114-boyne] Instead , [he]114-boyne drifted back to [[his]114-boyne usual place at a table of waifs and strays like [himself]114-boyne]477-his usual place at a table of waifs and strays like himself : [an earnest lady in spectacles who was “ preparing ”[139-sicily] [Sicily]139-sicily]478-an earnest lady in spectacles who was “ preparing ” sicily ; That , as far as [Boyne]114-boyne could make out , could mean only [the Cliffe Wheaters]130-the wheaters , [[his]114-boyne old original Cliffe Wheaters]485-his old original cliffe wheaters , in [their]130-the wheaters before - the - letter state , as it were . In that case [the thin eager girl at [his]114-boyne side]486-the thin eager girl at his side would be [[their]487-their daughter]488-their daughter , [[their]487-their eldest daughter]489-their eldest daughter , born probably soon after a marriage which , some thirteen or fourteen years later , had produced [the sturdy and abundant Chip]490-the sturdy and abundant chip . “ Very unmodern , all that . ”[490-the sturdy and abundant chip] It gave [Boyne]114-boyne a more encouraging view of the conjugal state than [he]114-boyne had lately held , and made [him]114-boyne look forward with a lighter mind to meeting [the lady who awaited [him]114-boyne in [the Dolomites]17-the dolomites]491-the lady who awaited him in the dolomites — [the lady [he]114-boyne had not seen for five years]492-the lady he had not seen for five years . But no sooner did [he]114-boyne imagine that [he]114-boyne had solved the puzzle of [the Cliffe Wheaters]130-the wheaters than the image of [the enigmatic trio]494-the enigmatic trio , [Zinnie]133-zinnie , [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]134-beechy , disarranged [his]114-boyne neat equation . The “ steps”—who[496-they] on earth were the “ steps , ”[496-they] and how and where did they fit into [the family group]495-the family group which seemed , with [Judith]127-judith ( had n’t [they]496-they called [her]127-judith that ? ) at one end , and [Chip]123-chip at the other , to form its own unbroken circle ? [Miss Wheater]140-miss wheater , [he]114-boyne remembered , had tossed [him]114-boyne a few details about [the two brown children]497-the two brown children , [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]134-beechy . “ [They]497-the two brown children ’re foreigners ... [Italians]141-italians .... ”[120-mrs. wheater] But if so , [they]497-the two brown children belonged neither to [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater nor to [[his]114-boyne wife]498-his wife ; certainly not to [[his]114-boyne wife]498-his wife , since [Judith]127-judith had added , in speaking of [Bun]135-bun : “ [[His]114-boyne mother]2471-his mother was [a lion - tamer]2472-a lion - tamer ... ”[127-judith] not as if using the term metaphorically , but as stating a plain social fact . As for [Zinnie]133-zinnie , the little red devil , [she]133-zinnie remained wholly unaccounted for , and there was nothing in [her]133-zinnie clever impudent face , with its turned - up nose and freckled skin under the shock of orange hair , to suggest any blood - relationship to [the small Italians]141-italians . [Zinnie]133-zinnie appeared to be sharply and completely American — as American as [Beechy]134-beechy and [Bun]135-bun were Italian , and much more so than [the three elder Wheaters , who were all so rubbed down by cosmopolitan contacts]500-the three elder wheaters , who were all so rubbed down by cosmopolitan contacts . The “ steps , ”[133-zinnie] in fact , had the definiteness of what [the botanists]501-the botanists call species , whereas [Judith]127-judith , [Blanca]128-blanca and [Terry]198-terry were like exquisite garden hybrids . The harder [Boyne]114-boyne stared into the problem the more obscure it became . Even the least eventful sea - voyages lend themselves to favourable propinquities , and in the course of the afternoon [the gray - haired lady whom [the young Wheaters]130-the wheaters addressed as “ [Scopy ”]132-scopy]2503-the gray - haired lady whom the young wheaters addressed as “ scopy ”[2503-the gray - haired lady whom the young wheaters addressed as “ scopy ”] reappeared on [deck]502-deck , this time alone , and seemingly in quest of a seat . [Boyne]114-boyne instantly pointed out the one next to [his]114-boyne , and [the lady]503-the lady , saying with an austere smile : “ [I]503-the lady believe [ours]2504-ours are on the other side , but [I]503-the lady can take this while [Judith]127-judith ’s resting , ”[503-the lady] settled [herself]503-the lady at [his]114-boyne side in an attitude of angular precision . As [she]503-the lady did so [she]503-the lady gave [him]114-boyne a look of shy benevolence , and added : “ [I]503-the lady understand from [Judith]127-judith that [you]114-boyne ’re [a friend of [[her]127-judith people]2506-her people]2505-a friend of her people . ”[503-the lady] [Boyne]114-boyne eagerly acquiesced , and [she]503-the lady went on to say what a comfort it was , when [they]504-we were on one of these long treks with [the children]505-the children , to come across [anybody who was a friend of [[their]504-we parents]507-their parents , and could be appealed to in an emergency]506-anybody who was a friend of their parents , and could be appealed to in an emergency . “ Not that there ’s any particular reason at present ; but it ’s a good deal of a responsibility for [Judith]127-judith to transport [the whole party]2507-the whole party from [Biskra]19-biskra to [Venice]8-venice , and [we]504-we ’re always rather troubled about [Terry]198-terry . Even after four months at [Biskra]19-biskra [he]198-terry has n’t picked up as [we]504-we ’d hoped .... [He]198-terry does look a little drawn . ”[114-boyne] [Boyne]114-boyne hoped that if [he]114-boyne adopted an easy old - friend tone [she]503-the lady might be lured on from one confidence to another . “ Anxious ? Here [Boyne]145-boyne , submerged , had to hold up [his]145-boyne hand again . And whose , in the name of pity , was [Chipstone]142-chipstone ? Well ... [Miss Scope]147-miss scope said [she]147-miss scope understood [his]145-boyne wonder , [his]145-boyne perplexity ; it did [him]145-boyne credit , [she]147-miss scope declared , to be too high - minded to take in the whole painful truth at a glance . No ; [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]134-beechy , thank heaven , were _ not _ [[Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy ’s children]536-mrs. wheater ’s children ; [they]536-mrs. wheater ’s children were [the offspring of [the unscrupulous Prince Buondelmonte]538-the unscrupulous prince buondelmonte and [a vile woman]539-a vile woman — [a circus performer]540-a circus performer , [she]147-miss scope believed — whom [he]145-boyne had married and deserted before [poor Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy became infatuated with [him]145-boyne]537-the offspring of the unscrupulous prince buondelmonte and a vile woman — a circus performer , she believed — whom he had married and deserted before poor mrs. wheater became infatuated with him . ( “ Infatuated ”[134-beechy] was a horrid word , [she]147-miss scope knew ; but [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy used it [herself]134-beechy in speaking of that unhappy time . ) Well — [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy , in [her]134-beechy madness , had insisted on leaving [[her]134-beechy husband]411-her husband in order to marry [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte . [Mr. Wheater]126-mr. wheater , though [she]147-miss scope had behaved so badly , was very chivalrous about it , and “ put [himself]126-mr. wheater in the wrong ”[126-mr. wheater] ( [Boyne]145-boyne rejoiced at the phrase ) so that [[his]126-mr. wheater wife]498-his wife might divorce [him]126-mr. wheater ; but [he]126-mr. wheater insisted on [his]126-mr. wheater right to keep [Terry]198-terry with [him]126-mr. wheater , and on an annual visit of four months from [Judith]127-judith and [Blanca]128-blanca ; and as there was a big fight over the alimony [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy had to give in about [the children]505-the children — and that was when [Judith]127-judith ’s heart - break began . Even as a little thing , [Miss Scope]147-miss scope explained , [Judith]127-judith could n’t bear it when [[her]127-judith parents]527-her parents quarrelled . [She]127-judith had had to get used to that , alas ; but what [she]127-judith could n’t get used to was , after the divorce and [the two remarriages]545-the two remarriages , being separated from [Terry]198-terry , and bundled up every year with [Blanca]128-blanca , and sent from pillar to post , first to [one Palace Hotel]546-one palace hotel and then to another , wherever [one parent]547-one parent or [the other]548-the other happened to be .... It was that , [Miss Scope]147-miss scope thought , which had given the grown - up look to [her]127-judith eyes .... Luckily [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy ’s delusion did n’t last long ; [the Prince]549-the prince had n’t let it . Before [they]550-they ’d been married a year [he]549-the prince ’d taken care to show [her]127-judith what [he]549-the prince was . [Poor [Judith]127-judith , who was alone with [[her]127-judith mother]382-her mother during the last dreadful months]551-poor judith , who was alone with her mother during the last dreadful months , knew something of _ that _ . But [Miss Scope]147-miss scope realised that [she]147-miss scope must n’t digress , but just stick to the outline of [her]147-miss scope story till it became a little clearer to [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne .... Well — when [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy ’s eyes were opened , and the final separation from [the Prince]549-the prince took place , [she]134-beechy ( [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy ) was so sorry for [Beatrice]150-beatrice and [Astorre]151-astorre — there was really nobody kinder than [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy — that [she]134-beechy kept the poor little things with [her]134-beechy , and had gone on keeping them ever since . [[Their]554-their father]555-their father had of course been only too thankful to have them taken off [his]555-their father hands — and [[their]554-their miserable mother]556-their miserable mother too . Here [Miss Scope]147-miss scope paused for breath , and hoped that [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne was beginning to grasp — “ Yes ; beginning ; but — [Chipstone]142-chipstone ? ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne patiently insisted . “ Oh , [Chip]123-chip ; [dear Chip]123-chip ’s [a Wheater]2533-a wheater all right ! The very image of [[his]123-chip father]413-his father , do n’t [you]123-chip think ? But [I]145-boyne see that [I]145-boyne have n’t yet given [you]123-chip all the threads ; there are so many .... Where was [I]145-boyne ? Oh , about [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy ’s separation . [You]123-chip know there ’s no divorce in [Italy]20-italy , and [she]134-beechy thought [she]134-beechy was tied to [the Prince]549-the prince for life . But luckily [[her]134-beechy lawyers]2536-her lawyers found out that [he]549-the prince had been legally married — in [some Italian consulate at [the other end of the world]2538-the other end of the world]2537-some italian consulate at the other end of the world — to [the mother of [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]134-beechy]2539-the mother of bun and beechy ; and as [the woman]2540-the woman was still alive , [the Prince]549-the prince ’s marriage with [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy had been bigamous , and was immediately annulled , and [she]134-beechy became [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy again — ”[145-boyne] “ And then ? ”[147-miss scope] “ Then [she]134-beechy was dreadfully miserable about it all , and [Mr. Wheater]126-mr. wheater was miserable too , because in the meanwhile [he]126-mr. wheater ’d found out about the horror [he]126-mr. wheater ’d married , and was already suing for a divorce . And [Judith]127-judith , who was thirteen by that time , and as wise and grown up as [she]127-judith is now , begged and entreated [[her]127-judith father]2542-her father and [mother]2490-mother to meet and talk things over , and see if [they]2544-they could n’t come together again , so that [the children]505-the children would never have to be separated , and sent backward and forward like bundles — ”[447-the governess] “ [She]127-judith did that ? [That child]2546-that child ? ”[145-boyne] “ [Judith]127-judith ’s never been [a child]435-a child — there was no time . So [she]127-judith got [Mr.]2548-mr. and [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy together , and [they]2544-they were both sore and unhappy over [their]2544-they blunders , and realised what a mess [they]2544-they ’d made — and finally [they]2544-they decided to try again , and [they]2544-they were remarried about three years ago ; and then [Chip]123-chip was born , and of course that has made everything all right again — for the present . ”[147-miss scope] “ The present ? ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne gasped ; and [the governess]447-the governess smoothed back [her]447-the governess blown hair , and turned the worn integrity of [her]447-the governess face on [his]145-boyne . “ If [I]447-the governess respect the truth , how can [I]447-the governess say more than ‘ the present ’ ? Everything ’s going as smoothly as can be ; and [we]2550-we should all be perfectly happy if it were n’t for [poor Terry]198-terry , whose health never seems to be what it should .... [Mr.]2551-mr. and [Mrs. Wheater]134-beechy adore [Chip]123-chip , and are very fond of [the other children]2552-the other children ; and [Judith]127-judith is almost sure it will last this time . ”[447-the governess] [Miss Scope]147-miss scope broke off , and looked away again from [Boyne]145-boyne . [Her]147-miss scope “ almost ”[447-the governess] wrung [his]145-boyne heart , and [he]145-boyne wanted to put [his]145-boyne hand out , and clasp the large gray cotton glove clenched on [her]147-miss scope knee . But instead [he]145-boyne only said : “ If anything can make it last , [you]447-the governess and [Judith]127-judith will ”[145-boyne] ; and [the governess]447-the governess answered : “ Oh , it ’s all [Judith]127-judith . And [she]127-judith has [all [the children]505-the children behind [her]127-judith]2553-all the children behind her . [They]505-the children say [they]505-the children refuse to be separated again . And [they]505-the children all worship [Judith]127-judith . Even [the two foreigners]2558-the two foreigners do . ”[447-the governess] IV [The children]505-the children , at first , had been unanimously and immovably opposed to going to [Monreale]21-monreale . Long before [the steamer]560-the steamer headed for [Palermo]22-palermo the question was debated by [them]505-the children with a searching thoroughness . [Judith]127-judith , who had never been to [Sicily]139-sicily , had consulted [Boyne]145-boyne as to the most profitable way of employing the one day allotted to [them]505-the children , and after inclining to [Segesta]153-segesta , [Boyne]145-boyne , on finding that [everybody]561-everybody , including [Chip]123-chip , was to be of [the party]562-the party , suggested [Monreale]21-monreale as more accessible . “ And awfully beautiful too ? ”[127-judith] [Judith]127-judith was looking at [him]145-boyne with hungry ignorant eyes . “ One of the most beautiful things in [the world]307-the world . [I]127-judith ’ve seen so little — ”[127-judith] “ Why , [I]127-judith thought [you]145-boyne ’d travelled from [one end of [Europe]24-europe]2562-one end of europe to the other . ”[127-judith] “ That does n’t show [you]145-boyne anything but [sleeping - cars]2563-sleeping - cars and [Palace Hotels]2564-palace hotels , does it ? [Mother]2490-mother and [father]2441-father never even have a guide - book ; [they]505-the children just ask [the hall - porter]2567-the hall - porter where to go . [You]145-boyne must show [me]127-judith everything , everything . ”[127-judith] “ Well , [we]505-the children ’ll begin with [Monreale]21-monreale . ”[127-judith] But [the children]505-the children took a different view . [Miss Scope]147-miss scope , unluckily , had found [an old Baedeker on the steamer]564-an old baedeker on the steamer , and refreshing [her]147-miss scope mind with hazy reminiscences gleaned from [former pupils]565-former pupils , had rediscovered the name of [a wonderful ducal garden]566-a wonderful ducal garden containing ever so many acres of orange - trees always full of flowers and fruit . [[Her]147-miss scope old pupils]567-her old pupils had gone [there]2439-there , [she]147-miss scope recalled , and been allowed by [the gardeners]569-the gardeners to pick up from the ground as many oranges as [they]569-the gardeners could carry away . At this [the children]505-the children , [a close self - governing body]571-a close self - governing body , instantly voted as [one man for [the Giardino Aumale]25-the giardino aumale]572-one man for the giardino aumale . [Boyne]145-boyne had already observed that , in spite of [Judith]127-judith ’s strong influence , there were moments when [she]127-judith became helpless against [their]505-the children serried opposition , and in the present case argument and persuasion entirely failed . At length [Terry]198-terry , evidently wishing , as [the man of the party]573-the man of the party , to set the example of reasonableness , remarked that [Judith]127-judith , who had all the bother of looking after [them]505-the children , ought to go wherever [she]127-judith chose . [Bun hereupon]135-bun squared [his]198-terry mouth for a howl , and [Blanca]128-blanca observed tartly that by always pretending to give up [you]574-you generally got what [you]574-you wanted . “ Well , [you]575-his sister ’d better try then , ”[198-terry] [Terry]198-terry retorted severely , and the blood rose under [[his]198-terry sister]575-his sister ’s delicate skin as if [he]198-terry had struck [her]575-his sister . “ [Terry]198-terry ! What a beast [you]198-terry are ! [I]198-terry did n’t mean — ”[198-terry] [Meanwhile Beechy]154-beechy , melting into tears at the sight of [Bun]135-bun ’s distress , was hugging [his]198-terry tumbled head against [her]575-his sister breast with murmurs of : “ _ Zitto , zitto , [carissimo]2568-carissimo ! Cuor mio ! _ ”[198-terry] and glaring angrily at [Judith]127-judith and [Terry]198-terry . “ Well , [I]133-zinnie want to go where there ’s [zoranges to eat]2569-zoranges to eat , ”[133-zinnie] said [Zinnie]133-zinnie , in [her]133-zinnie sharp metallic American voice , with which [she]133-zinnie might almost have peeled the fruit . “ — ’ r if [I]145-boyne do n’t , [I]145-boyne want something a lot better’nstead , n ’ [I]145-boyne mean to have it ! ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne laughed , and [Judith]127-judith murmured despairingly : “ [We]2570-we ’d better go to [[their]2570-we orange - garden]2571-their orange - garden . ”[127-judith] “ Look here , ”[198-terry] [Terry]198-terry interposed , “ [the little ones]2555-the little ones are mad to hear the end of that story of the old old times , about [the two children who ’d never seen a motor]2573-the two children who ’d never seen a motor . [They]2573-the two children who ’d never seen a motor ’re all so fed up with [airships and machinery]2574-airships and machinery and X rays and wireless ; and [you]2575-you know [you]2575-you promised to go on with that story some day . [NORANGES]155-noranges ! ”[135-bun] “ Oh , very well ; [I]128-blanca knew — ”[128-blanca] [Blanca]128-blanca murmured , shooting [her]128-blanca gray glance toward [Boyne]145-boyne ; and [Judith]127-judith , lifting up [Chip]123-chip , triumphantly declared : “ [He]145-boyne says [he]145-boyne wants to go to [Monreale]21-monreale . ”[127-judith] “ That settles it , of course , ”[128-blanca] said [Blanca]128-blanca , with resigned eyelids . A wordy wrangle having arisen between [Zinnie]133-zinnie , [Beechy]154-beechy and [Bun]135-bun as to whether the fruit for which [they]577-they clamoured should be called zoranges or noranges , [Judith]127-judith and [Miss Scope]147-miss scope took advantage of the diversion to settle the details of the expedition with [Boyne]145-boyne , and the next morning , when [the steamer]560-the steamer lay to off [Palermo]22-palermo , [the little party , equipped and eager]579-the little party , equipped and eager , headed the line of [passengers]317-passengers for [the tug]581-the tug . [Boyne]145-boyne , stretched out at length on a stone bench in the sun , lay listening with half - closed eyes to [Judith]127-judith ’s eager plaintive voice . [He]145-boyne had bribed [the custodian]582-the custodian to let [them]577-they pass out of [the cloister]2578-the cloister into [the lavender - scented cathedral garden]584-the lavender - scented cathedral garden drowsing on [[its]584-the lavender - scented cathedral garden warm terrace above [the orange - orchards]586-the orange - orchards]585-its warm terrace above the orange - orchards . And [here , close by]591-here , close by , sat [Judith Wheater]127-judith in the sun , [the children]505-the children heaped at [her]127-judith knee , and [Scopy]132-scopy and [Nanny]156-nanny , at a discreet distance , knitting , and nursing the tea - basket . [Judith]127-judith ’s voice went on : “ But when [Polycarp]157-polycarp and [Lullaby]158-lullaby drove [home]290-home in [the victoria]2581-the victoria with the white horse to [[[their]505-the children mamma]2582-their mamma ’s palace]2583-their mamma ’s palace [they]505-the children found that the zebra door - mat had got up and was eating all the flowers in the drawing - room vases , and the big yellow birds on the wall - paper were all flying about , and making the most dreadful mess scattering seeds about [the rooms]2584-the rooms . But the most wonderful thing was that the cuckoo from the nursery clock was gone too , so that [the nurses]402-the nurses could n’t tell what time it was , and when [the children]505-the children ought to be put to bed and to get up again .... ”[127-judith] “ Oh , how perfectly lovely , ”[135-bun] chanted [Bun]135-bun , and [Beechy]154-beechy chorused : “ Lovelly , lovelly .... ”[154-beechy] “ Not at all , ”[127-judith] said [Judith]127-judith severely . “ It was the worst thing that had happened to [them]505-the children yet , for [the cook]2587-the cook did n’t know what time it was either , and [[nobody]2418-nobody in [the house]2590-the house]2589-nobody in the house could tell [her]2587-the cook , so there was no breakfast ready ; and [the cook]2587-the cook just went off for a ride on the zebra , because [she]2587-the cook had [no carriage of [her]2587-the cook own]2592-no carriage of her own , and [she]2587-the cook said there was nothing else to do . ”[127-judith] “ Why did n’t [they]505-the children tell [[their]505-the children father’n’mother]2593-their father’n’mother ? ”[133-zinnie] [Zinnie]133-zinnie queried in a practical tone . “ Because [they]505-the children ’d got [new ones]2594-new ones , who did n’t know about the cuckoo either , [I]135-bun guess , ”[135-bun] said [Bun]135-bun with authority . “ Then why did n’t [the children]505-the children go with [[their]505-the children old fathers]2596-their old fathers an ’ [mothers]2597-mothers ? But [I]127-judith daresay [the new father]2600-the new father and [mother]2490-mother would have been all right , ”[127-judith] [Judith]127-judith pursued , “ if only [the children]505-the children had been patient and known how to treat [them]505-the children ; only just at first [they]505-the children did n’t ; and besides , at the time [I]127-judith am telling [you]593-you about , [they]505-the children happened to be away travelling — ”[127-judith] “ Then why did n’t [the children]505-the children telephone to [them]505-the children to come back ? ”[132-scopy] “ Because there were n’t any telephones in those days . ”[127-judith] “ No telephones ? Does it say so in the hist’ry books ? ”[133-zinnie] snapped [Zinnie]133-zinnie , sceptical . “ Course it does , [you]593-you silly . Why , when [Scopy]132-scopy was little , ”[133-zinnie] [Terry]198-terry reminded [them]593-you , “ [she]132-scopy lived in [a house where there was n’t any telephone]2604-a house where there was n’t any telephone . ”[198-terry] [Beechy]154-beechy , ever tender - hearted , immediately prepared to cry at the thought of [Scopy]132-scopy ’s privation ; but [Scopy]132-scopy interpolated severely : “ Now , [Beatrice]150-beatrice , do n’t be _ foreign _ — ”[132-scopy] and [the story - teller]594-the story - teller went on : “ So there was no way whatever for [them]505-the children to get any breakfast , and — ”[132-scopy] “ Oh , [I]154-beechy know , [I]154-beechy know ! [They]505-the children starved to death , _ poverini _ ! ”[154-beechy] [Beechy]154-beechy lamented , promptly transferring [her]154-beechy grief to another object , and flinging [her]154-beechy little brown arms heavenward in an agony of participation . “ Not just yet . For [they]505-the children met on the edge of the wood — ”[132-scopy] ( “ What wood ? There was n’t any wood before , ”[133-zinnie] said [Zinnie]133-zinnie sharply . ) “ No , but there was one now ; for all the trees and flowers from the wall - papers had come off the wall , and gone out into [the garden]2605-the garden to grow , so that the big yellow birds should have a wood to build [their]2606-their nests in , and the zebras should — ”[132-scopy] “ [Zebras]160-zebras ! There was only one zebra . ”[128-blanca] This , sardonically , from [a grown - up looking , indifferent [Blanca]128-blanca]595-a grown - up looking , indifferent blanca . “ Stupid ! [He]2607-he ’d been married already and had a lot of perfectly lovely norphans and [three dear little steps like [us]2609-us]2608-three dear little steps like us , and [Mrs. Zebra]161-mrs. zebra [she]161-mrs. zebra had [a big family]2610-a big family too , no , [she]161-mrs. zebra had [two big families]2611-two big families , ”[133-zinnie] [Zinnie]133-zinnie announced , enumerating the successive groups on [her]133-zinnie small dimpled fingers . “ Oh , how lovely for the zebra ! Say [they]505-the children did — oh , [Judith]127-judith , _ say _ it ! ”[133-zinnie] [Beechy]154-beechy clamoured . “ Of course [they]505-the children did . ( [Zinnie]133-zinnie , [you]133-zinnie must n’t call [Blanca]128-blanca stupid . ) But all this time [Polycarp]157-polycarp and [Lullaby]158-lullaby were starving , because the clock had stopped and [the cook]2587-the cook had gone out on the zebra .... ”[154-beechy] “ And [they]505-the children were starving — slowly starving to death ... ”[133-zinnie] [Zinnie]133-zinnie gloated . “ Yes ; but on the edge of the wood whom did [they]505-the children meet but [a great big tall gentleman with a mot]2614-a great big tall gentleman with a mot — no , [I]133-zinnie mean [a pony - carriage]2615-a pony - carriage .... ”[133-zinnie] “ What ’s a pony ? ”[154-beechy] “ A little horse about as big as [Bun]135-bun — ”[135-bun] ( “ Oh , oh — I’m a pony ! ”[135-bun] shouted [Bun]135-bun , kicking and neighing . ) “ And [the pony - carriage]2616-the pony - carriage was full — absolutely brim full of — what do [you]145-boyne think ? ”[127-judith] [Judith]127-judith concluded , [her]127-judith question drowned in a general cry of “ Oranges ! No , noranges — zoranges ! ! ! ”[127-judith] from [the leaping scrambling group before whom , at the dramatic moment]596-the leaping scrambling group before whom , at the dramatic moment , [Boyne]145-boyne had obligingly uncorded [his]145-boyne golden bales , while [Miss Scope]147-miss scope and [Nanny]156-nanny murmured : “ Now , [children]2617-children , [children]2617-children — now — ”[156-nanny] “ And this is [our]599-our chance , ”[145-boyne] said [Boyne]145-boyne , “ to make a dash for [the cathedral]2619-the cathedral . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne slipped [his]145-boyne hand through [Judith]127-judith ’s arm , and drew [her]127-judith across [the cloister]2578-the cloister and into [the great echoing basilica]598-the great echoing basilica . At first , after [their]599-our long session on [the sun - drenched terrace]600-the sun - drenched terrace , [the place]601-the place seemed veiled in an impenetrable twilight . But gradually the tremendous walls and spandrils began to glow with their own supernatural radiance , the solid sunlight of gold and umber and flame - coloured mosaics , against which figures of [saints]602-saints , [prophets]603-prophets , [kings and sages]604-kings and sages stood out in pale solemn hues . [Boyne]145-boyne led [the girl]326-the girl toward [one of the shafts of [the nave]607-the nave]606-one of the shafts of the nave , and [they]599-our sat down on [its]606-one of the shafts of the nave projecting base . “ Now from [here]2434-here [you]326-the girl can see — ”[145-boyne] But [he]145-boyne presently perceived that [she]326-the girl could see nothing . [Her]326-the girl little profile was studiously addressed to the direction in which [he]145-boyne pointed , and [her]326-the girl head thrown back so that [her]326-the girl lips were parted , and [her]326-the girl long lashes drew an upward curve against [her]326-the girl pale skin ; but nothing was happening in the face which was usually the theatre of such varied emotions . [She]326-the girl sat thus for a long time , and [he]145-boyne did not move or speak again . Finally [she]326-the girl turned to [him]145-boyne , and said in a shy voice ( it was the first time [he]145-boyne had noticed any shyness in [her]326-the girl ): “ [I]326-the girl suppose [I]326-the girl ’m much more ignorant than [you]145-boyne could possibly have imagined . ”[326-the girl] “ [You]145-boyne mean that [you]145-boyne do n’t particularly care for all this ? ”[326-the girl] [She]326-the girl lowered [her]326-the girl voice to answer : “ [I]326-the girl believe [all those big people up there]2621-all those big people up there frighten [me]326-the girl a little . ”[326-the girl] And [she]326-the girl added : “ [I]326-the girl ’m glad [I]326-the girl did n’t bring [Chip]123-chip . ”[326-the girl] “ [Child]131-child ! ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne let [his]145-boyne hand fall on [hers]326-the girl with a faint laugh . What [a child]435-a child [she]326-the girl became as soon as [she]326-the girl was away from [the other children]2552-the other children ! “ But [I]326-the girl do want to admire it , [you]145-boyne know , ”[326-the girl] [she]326-the girl went on earnestly , “ because [you]145-boyne do , and [Scopy]132-scopy says [you]145-boyne know such a lot about everything . ”[326-the girl] “ It ’s not a question of knowing — ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne began ; and then broke off . For was n’t it , after all , exactly that ? How many thousand threads of association , strung with stored images of the eye and brain , memories of books , of pictures , of great names and deeds , ran between [him]145-boyne and those superhuman images , tracing a way from [his]145-boyne world to [theirs]610-theirs ? Yes ; it had been stupid of [him]145-boyne to expect that [a child of fifteen or sixteen , brought up in complete ignorance of the past , and with no more comprehension than a savage of the subtle and allusive symbolism of art]611-a child of fifteen or sixteen , brought up in complete ignorance of the past , and with no more comprehension than a savage of the subtle and allusive symbolism of art , should feel anything in [Monreale]21-monreale but the oppression of its awful unreality . And yet [he]145-boyne was disappointed , for [he]145-boyne was already busy at the masculine task of endowing [the woman of the moment]612-the woman of the moment with every quality which made life interesting to [himself]145-boyne . “ [Woman]2622-woman — but [she]2622-woman ’s not [a woman]2623-a woman ! [She]2622-woman ’s [a child]435-a child . ”[145-boyne] [His]145-boyne thinking of [her]612-the woman of the moment as anything else was the crowning absurdity of the whole business . Obscurely irritated with [himself]145-boyne and [her]612-the woman of the moment , [he]145-boyne stood up , turning [his]145-boyne back impatiently on the golden abyss of the apse . “ Come along ; it ’s chilly here after [our]613-our sun - bath . [Gardens]26-gardens are best , after all . ”[145-boyne] In the doorway [she]612-the woman of the moment paused a moment and sent [her]612-the woman of the moment gaze a little wistfully down the mighty perspective [they]613-our were leaving . “ Some day , [I]612-the woman of the moment know , [I]612-the woman of the moment shall want to come back here , ”[612-the woman of the moment] [she]612-the woman of the moment said . “ Oh , well , [we]613-our ’ll come back together , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne replied perfunctorily . But outside in the sunlight , with [the children]505-the children leaping about [her]612-the woman of the moment , and guiding [her]612-the woman of the moment with joyful cries toward the outspread tea - things , [she]612-the woman of the moment was [instantly woman]615-instantly woman again — gay , competent , composed , and wholly mistress of the situation .... Yes ; decidedly , the more [Boyne]145-boyne saw of [her]612-the woman of the moment the more [she]612-the woman of the moment perplexed [him]145-boyne , the more difficult [he]145-boyne found it to situate [her]612-the woman of the moment in time and space . [He]145-boyne did not even know how old [she]612-the woman of the moment was — somewhere between fifteen and seventeen , [he]145-boyne conjectured — nor had [he]145-boyne as yet made up [his]145-boyne mind if [she]612-the woman of the moment were pretty . In [the cathedral]2619-the cathedral , just now , [he]145-boyne had thought [her]612-the woman of the moment almost plain , with the dull droop of [her]612-the woman of the moment mouth , [her]612-the woman of the moment pale complexion which looked dead when unlit by gaiety , [her]612-the woman of the moment thick brown hair , just thick and just brown , without the magic which makes [some women]617-some women ’s hair as alive as [their]617-some women lips , and [her]612-the woman of the moment small impersonal nose , a nose neither perfectly drawn like [Blanca]128-blanca ’s nor impudently droll like [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s . The act of thus cataloguing [her]612-the woman of the moment seemed to reduce [her]612-the woman of the moment to a bundle of negatives ; yet here in the sunshine , [her]612-the woman of the moment hat thrown off [her]612-the woman of the moment rumpled hair , and all [the children]505-the children scrambling over [her]612-the woman of the moment , [her]612-the woman of the moment mouth became a flame , [her]612-the woman of the moment eyes fountains of laughter , [her]612-the woman of the moment thin frail body a quiver of light — [he]145-boyne did n’t know how else to put it . Whatever [she]612-the woman of the moment was , [she]612-the woman of the moment was only intermittently ; as if [her]612-the woman of the moment body were the mere vehicle of [her]612-the woman of the moment moods , the projection of successive fears , hopes , ardours , with hardly any material identity of its own . Why did [Boyne]121-boyne feel a sudden flatness in it ? Something just a trifle mincing , self - conscious — prepared ? Yes ; if [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars excelled in one special art it was undoubtedly that of preparation . [She]163-mrs. sellars led up to things — the simplest things — with the skill of [a clever rider putting a horse at a five - barred gate]626-a clever rider putting a horse at a five - barred gate . All [her]163-mrs. sellars life had been a series of adaptations , arrangements , shifting of lights , lowering of veils , pulling about of screens and curtains . [No one]2415-no one could arrange [a room]628-a room half so well ; and [she]163-mrs. sellars had arranged [herself]163-mrs. sellars and [her]163-mrs. sellars life just as skilfully . The material [she]163-mrs. sellars had had to deal with was poor enough ; in every way unworthy of [her]163-mrs. sellars ; but , as [her]163-mrs. sellars clever hands could twist a scarf into a divan - cover , and ruffle a bit of paper into a lamp - shade , so [she]163-mrs. sellars had managed , out of mediocre means , [a mediocre husband]629-a mediocre husband , [an ugly [New York]13-new york house]630-an ugly new york house , and a dull [New York]13-new york set , to make something distinguished , personal , almost exciting — so that , in [[her]163-mrs. sellars little world]631-her little world , [people]463-people were accustomed to say “ [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ”[463-people] as a synonym for cleverness and originality . Yes ; [she]163-mrs. sellars had had the art to do that , and to do it quietly , unobtrusively , by a touch here , a hint there , without ever reaching out beyond [her]163-mrs. sellars domestic and social frame - work . [Her]163-mrs. sellars originality , in the present day , lay in this consistency and continuity . In [his]633-he homeless years that sense of [her]163-mrs. sellars stability had appealed to [him]633-he peculiarly : the way , each time [he]633-he returned , [she]163-mrs. sellars had simply added a little more to [herself]163-mrs. sellars , like a rose unfurling another petal . A rose in full sun would have burst into quicker bloom ; it was part of [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s case that [she]163-mrs. sellars had always , as [Heine]164-heine put it , been like a canary in a window facing north . Not due north , however , but a few points north by west ; so that [she]163-mrs. sellars caught , not the sun ’s first glow , but its rich decline . [He]145-boyne found [his]145-boyne gaze unable to bear the too - eager questioning of [the boy]365-the boy ’s , and understood why [Miss Scope]147-miss scope looked away when [she]147-miss scope talked of [Terry]198-terry . “ Settle down ? [He]145-boyne was not certain that the appeal had not anticipated a secret yearning of [his]145-boyne own ; a yearning not so much to postpone [his]145-boyne arrival at [Cortina]34-cortina ( to that [he]145-boyne would not confess ) as to defer the parting from [[his]145-boyne new friends]669-his new friends , and especially from [Judith]127-judith . The Monreale picnic had been successfully repeated in several other scenes of classic association , and during the gay and clamorous expeditions [ashore]670-ashore , and the long blue days on [deck]502-deck , [he]145-boyne had been gradually penetrated by the warm animal life which proceeds from [a troop of [happy healthy children]673-happy healthy children]672-a troop of happy healthy children . Everything about [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters and [their]130-the wheaters “ steps ”[130-the wheaters] excited [his]145-boyne interest and sympathy , and not least the frailness of the tie uniting [them]130-the wheaters , and [their]130-the wheaters determination that it should not be broken . There was something tragic , to [Boyne]145-boyne , in the mere fact of this determination — it implied a range of experience and a power of forethought so far beyond [a child]435-a child ’s natural imagining . To [the ordinary child]675-the ordinary child , [Boyne]145-boyne ’s memories told [him]145-boyne , separation means something too vague to fret about beforehand , and too pleasantly tempered , when it comes , by the excitement of novelty , and the joy of release from routine , to be anything but a jolly adventure . [Boyne]145-boyne could not recall that [he]145-boyne had ever minded being sent from [home]290-home ( to [the seashore]677-the seashore , to [a summer camp]678-a summer camp , or to [an aunt]679-an aunt ’s , when [a new baby]680-a new baby was expected ) as long as [he]145-boyne was allowed to take [his]145-boyne mechanical toys with [him]145-boyne . Any place that had [a floor on which [you]682-you could build cranes and [bridges and railways]683-bridges and railways]681-a floor on which you could build cranes and bridges and railways was all right : if there was [a beach with sand that could be trenched and tunnelled]684-a beach with sand that could be trenched and tunnelled , and [water that could be dammed]685-water that could be dammed , then it was heaven , even if the porridge was n’t as good as it was at [home]290-home , and there was [no mother to read stories aloud after supper]687-no mother to read stories aloud after supper . [He]145-boyne could only conjecture that what [he]145-boyne called change would have seemed permanence to [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters , and that what change signified to [them]130-the wheaters was something as radical and soul - destroying as it would have been to [Boyne]145-boyne to see [his]145-boyne mechanical toys smashed , or [his]145-boyne white mice left to die of hunger . That it should imply a lasting separation from the warm cluster of [people]463-people , pets and things called [home]290-home , would have been no more thinkable to [the infant Boyne]690-the infant boyne than permanence was to [the infant Wheaters]691-the infant wheaters . [Judith]127-judith had explained that almost all [[their]692-their little friends]693-their little friends ( usually acquaintances made in the world of [Palace Hotels]32-palace hotels ) were in the same case as [themselves]692-their . As [Terry]198-terry had put it , when [you]694-you were young [you]694-you could n’t expect not to move about ; and when [Judith]127-judith proceeded to give [Boyne]145-boyne some of the reasons which had leagued [[her]127-judith little tribe]695-her little tribe against the recurrence of such moves [he]145-boyne had the sick feeling with which [a powerless looker - on]696-a powerless looker - on sees the torture of an animal . The case of [poor Doll Westway]166-doll westway , for instance , who was barely a year older than [Judith]127-judith , and whom [they]692-their had played with for a summer at [Deauville]35-deauville ; and now — ! Well , it was all a damned rotten business — that was what it was . And [Judith]127-judith ’s resolve that [[her]127-judith children]697-her children should never again be exposed to these hazards thrilled [Boyne]145-boyne like the gesture of [a Joan of Arc]698-a joan of arc . As [the character of each]699-the character of each became more definite to [him]145-boyne , as [he]145-boyne measured the distance between [Blanca]128-blanca ’s cool self - absorption , tempered only by a nervous craving for [[her]128-blanca twin brother]700-her twin brother ’s approval , and the prodigal self - abandonment of [Beechy]154-beechy , as [he]145-boyne compared [the detached and downright Zinnie]133-zinnie to [the sinuous and selfish Bun]701-the sinuous and selfish bun , and watched the interplay of all [these youthful characters]702-these youthful characters , [he]145-boyne marvelled that the bond of [Judith Wheater]127-judith ’s love for [them]702-these youthful characters should be stronger than the sum of such heredities . But so it was . [He]145-boyne had seen how [they]702-these youthful characters could hang together against [[their]702-these youthful characters sister]703-their sister when some childish whim united [them]702-these youthful characters , and now [he]145-boyne could imagine what an impenetrable front [they]702-these youthful characters would present under [her]703-their sister leadership . Of course [the Cliffe Wheaters]130-the wheaters would stay together if [[their]130-the wheaters children]704-their children were determined that [they]704-their children should ; and of course [they]130-the wheaters would give [Terry]198-terry a tutor if [he]198-terry wanted one . [VI There]167-vi there was no doubt about [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters ’ welcome . [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater laughed , with somewhat more of the old resonance , and said [she]120-mrs. wheater thought so too , and that was what [Judy]127-judith had argued — no , [Martin]114-boyne would never know how wonderful [Judy]127-judith had been during the ghastly days when [Buondelmonte]151-astorre was dragging [her]127-judith , [Joyce]121-boyne , through the mire , literally through [the mire]769-the mire ! “ Why , there were things [I]114-boyne could n’t tell even _ [you]114-boyne _ , [Martin]114-boyne — ”[114-boyne] [Martin]114-boyne felt [his]114-boyne gorge rise . “ Things [I]114-boyne hope that [Judy]127-judith was n’t told , then ? ”[114-boyne] [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s shoulder again slipped its light trammels in a careless shrug . “ Bless [you]114-boyne , [you]114-boyne do n’t have to tell [the modern child]2734-the modern child things ! It ’s [her]127-judith hobby . Why , [she]127-judith tried to be [a mother to [Zinnia Lacrosse]143-zinnia]2738-a mother to zinnia lacrosse .... But that nightmare ’s over now , and [we]2741-we ’re all together again , and there ’s only [Terry]198-terry , [poor darling]2742-poor darling , to worry about . [I]120-mrs. wheater _ do _ worry about [him]198-terry , [you]114-boyne know , [Martin]114-boyne . And is n’t it sweet of [him]198-terry to want to be properly educated ? [This tutor [I]120-mrs. wheater was speaking about]2744-this tutor i was speaking about , [Gerald Ormerod]175-gerald — [I]120-mrs. wheater wonder if [you]114-boyne ’d see [him]198-terry for [me]120-mrs. wheater to - morrow , [Martin]114-boyne ? And , [Martin]114-boyne , do n’t forget : [you]114-boyne can fix the salary as high as [you]114-boyne like . ”[120-mrs. wheater] VII Two days later [Boyne]114-boyne sat taking [his]114-boyne morning coffee with [Judith Wheater]127-judith at a rickety iron table in [the mouldy garden of the _ Pension Grimani _]770-the mouldy garden of the _ pension grimani _ . [He]114-boyne had bribed [a maid]771-a maid to carry out [their]772-their breakfast , so that [they]772-their might escape the stuffiness of the low - ceilinged dining - room , full of yesterday ’s dinner smells , of subdued groups of [old maids]2715-old maids and [giggling bands of [school - girls]775-school - girls]774-giggling bands of school - girls , and of the too - pervasive clatter of the corner table about which [Scopy]132-scopy and [Nanny]156-nanny had gathered [their]772-their flock . It was [Boyne]114-boyne ’s last day in [Venice]8-venice , and [he]114-boyne wanted a clear hour of it with [Judith]127-judith . Presently [the family]289-the family would surge up like a spring tide , [every one of [them]289-the family]777-every one of them — from [Mr.]778-mr. and [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , with [the “ Fancy Girl]2751-the “ fancy girl ”[2751-the “ fancy girl] lying idle off [San Giorgio]44-san giorgio , and a string of unemployed motors at [Fusina]45-fusina , to [Beechy]154-beechy and [Zinnie]133-zinnie squabbling over [their]772-their new necklaces from [the Merceria]46-the merceria , and [Miss Scope]147-miss scope with a fresh set of problems for the summer — all wanting [Boyne]114-boyne ’s advice or sympathy or consolation , or at least [his]114-boyne passive presence at [their]289-the family debates . All this was rather trying , and the eager proximity of [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters made privacy impossible . Yet [Boyne]114-boyne was more than ever glad that [he]114-boyne had resisted the persuasions of [[their]289-the family parents]507-their parents , and carried [his]114-boyne luggage to [the _ Pension Grimani _]2706-the _ pension grimani _ instead of to [the Palace Hotel]781-the palace hotel . The mere existence of [Palace Hotels]2564-palace hotels was an open wound to [him]114-boyne . Not that [he]114-boyne was indifferent to the material advantages [they]2564-palace hotels offered . [Nobody]2418-nobody appreciated hot baths and white tiles , electric bedlamps and prompt service , more than [he]114-boyne whose lot was usually cast in places so remote from [them]2564-palace hotels . [He]114-boyne loved [Palace Hotels]32-palace hotels ; but [he]114-boyne loathed the mere thought of [the people who frequented [them]32-palace hotels]784-the people who frequented them . [Judy]127-judith , [he]114-boyne discovered , was of the same mind . [Boyne]114-boyne had felt a little resentful of the fact that only [[the Wheaters]130-the wheaters ’ youngest - born]785-the wheaters ’ youngest - born was to share the luxury of [[their]130-the wheaters hotel]786-their hotel ; it seemed rather beastly to banish [the others]2515-the others to frowsy lodgings around the corner . At the moment [he]114-boyne had avoided [Judy]127-judith ’s eye , fearing to catch in it the reflection of [his]114-boyne thought : most of [Judy]127-judith ’s feelings were beginning to reverberate in [him]114-boyne . But now , in the leisure of [their]130-the wheaters first talk since landing , [he]114-boyne learned that no such feeling had marred the meeting of [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters with [[their]788-the little wheaters parents]507-their parents . [Blanca]128-blanca , [Judith]127-judith owned , probably had minded a little , just at first . [Silly Blanca]128-blanca — [she]128-blanca was always rather jealous of the fuss that [Joyce]121-boyne and [father]2441-father made about [Chip]123-chip . Besides , [she]128-blanca loved smartness , and picking up new ideas about clothes from [the _ chic _ women in [hotel restaurants]792-hotel restaurants]791-the _ chic _ women in hotel restaurants ; and [she]128-blanca liked to be seen about with [Joyce]121-boyne , who was so smart [herself]121-boyne , and to have [other smart ladies]793-other smart ladies say : “ Is this [[your]121-boyne dear little girl]2752-your dear little girl ? [We]2753-we should have known [her]2752-your dear little girl anywhere from the likeness . ”[121-boyne] But it was precisely because of [Blanca]128-blanca that [Judith]127-judith most disliked going to “ [Palaces]47-palaces . ”[121-boyne] “ Ever since [she]128-blanca got engaged to [the lift - boy]2754-the lift - boy at [Biarritz]29-biarritz .... ”[128-blanca] “ Engaged ? ”[121-boyne] [Boyne]121-boyne gasped . “ But , [Judy]127-judith ... but [Blanca]128-blanca ’s barely eleven .... ”[121-boyne] “ Oh , [I]121-boyne was engaged [myself]121-boyne at [Blanca]128-blanca ’s age — to a page at [a skating - rink]2755-a skating - rink . ”[121-boyne] [Judith]127-judith ’s small face , as [she]127-judith made the admission , had the wistful air of middle - age looking back on the sweet follies of youth . “ But that was different . [He]2754-the lift - boy was [a very nice little Swiss boy]2756-a very nice little swiss boy ; and [I]127-judith only gave [him]2754-the lift - boy one of [my]127-judith hair - ribbons , and [he]2754-the lift - boy gave [me]127-judith one of [his]2754-the lift - boy livery buttons ; and when [he]2754-the lift - boy went [home]290-home for [his]2754-the lift - boy holiday [he]2754-the lift - boy sent [me]127-judith dried edelweiss , and forget - [me]127-judith - nots pasted on cards . [Terry]198-terry and [I]127-judith could hardly bear it . [I]127-judith think it ’s rather jolly here , do n’t [you]795-he , [Martin]114-boyne ? ”[127-judith] [She]794-she had called [him]795-he [Martin]114-boyne , as a matter of course , since the second day out from [Algiers]1-algiers ; and [he]795-he could never hear [his]795-he name in [her]794-she fresh young trill without a stir of pleasure . Then [she]794-she asked if it was all right about [[Terry]198-terry ’s tutor]797-terry ’s tutor , and what [he]795-he thought of [the young man]798-the young man . The answer to this was more difficult . [Boyne]114-boyne was not sure what [he]114-boyne thought . [He]114-boyne had had an interview with [Mr. Ormerod]179-mr. ormerod on the previous day ; an interview somewhat halting and embarrassed on [his]114-boyne own part , perfectly firm and self - possessed on [the tutor]799-the tutor ’s . [Mr. Ormerod]179-mr. ormerod was [a good - looking young Englishman with the University stamp upon [him]179-mr. ormerod]800-a good - looking young englishman with the university stamp upon him . [He]179-mr. ormerod had very fair hair , somewhat long and rumpled , lazy ironic gray eyes , and a discontented mouth . [He]179-mr. ormerod looked clever , moody and uncertain ; but [he]179-mr. ormerod was cultivated and intelligent , and it seemed certain that [Terry]198-terry would learn more , and be more usefully occupied , in [his]179-mr. ormerod care than in [[Miss Scope]147-miss scope ’s]801-miss scope ’s . [Boyne]114-boyne ’s embarrassment proceeded not only from the sense of [his]114-boyne unfitness to choose [a tutor]2644-a tutor for [anybody]2661-anybody , but from the absurdity of having to do so with [[the pupil]804-the pupil ’s parents]805-the pupil ’s parents on the spot . [Mr. Ormerod]179-mr. ormerod , however , seemed neither surprised nor disturbed . [He]179-mr. ormerod had seen [Terry]198-terry , and was sure [he]198-terry was [an awfully good little chap]806-an awfully good little chap ; [his]179-mr. ormerod only hesitation was as to the salary . [Boyne]114-boyne , who had fixed it to the best of [his]114-boyne judgment , saw at once that , though it exceeded the usual terms , it was below [Mr. Ormerod]179-mr. ormerod ’s mark . [The young man]798-the young man explained that [the Princess Tradeschi]180-the princess tradeschi had let [him]798-the young man down rather badly , and that it was a beastly nuisance , but [he]798-the young man really could n’t give in about [his]798-the young man screw . Aloud [he]817-he remarked , in an impatient tone : “ [You]127-judith ’re very foolish not to go to [school]2671-school . ”[817-he] [She]127-judith made no reply , but simply said , with a return of [her]127-judith wistful look : “ Perhaps if [you]817-he were going to stay [here]2434-here [you]817-he ’d lend [me]127-judith some books . ”[127-judith] “ But [I]817-he ’m not going to stay [here]2434-here ; [I]817-he ’m off to - morrow morning , ”[817-he] [he]817-he answered angrily , keeping [his]817-he head turned away with an irritated sense that if [he]817-he should meet [her]127-judith eyes [he]817-he would see tears in them . [Her]127-judith own anger had dropped — [he]817-he knew it without looking at [her]127-judith , and [he]817-he had the sense that [she]127-judith was standing near [him]817-he , very small and pale . “ [Martin]114-boyne , if [you]114-boyne ’d only stay ! There are so many things left undecided .... [Father]181-father and [mother]2490-mother ca n’t make up [their]2797-they minds where to go next , and it ’s always when [they]2797-they ’ve got nothing particular to do that [they]2797-they quarrel . [They]2797-they ca n’t get [anybody]2661-anybody to go on [the yacht]2799-the yacht with [them]2797-they — not till [Cowes]182-cowes . And if [they]2797-they have to chuck the cruise [father]2441-father wants to go to [Paris]42-paris , and [mother]2490-mother wants to go motoring in [the hill - towns of [Italy]20-italy]2802-the hill - towns of italy ( where are [they]2797-they , do [you]2803-you know ? ) And if [they]2797-they get wrangling again what in [the world]307-the world is to become of [[us]2805-us children]2806-us children ? ”[821-he] [He]821-he turned back then , and put [his]821-he hand on [her]822-her arm . There was an old bench , as shaky as the table , under a sort of ragged sounding - board of oleanders . “ Sit down , [[my]821-he dear]2807-my dear . ”[821-he] [He]821-he sat beside [her]822-her , smiling a little , lighting a cigarette to prove [his]821-he ease and impartiality . “ [You]2803-you ’re taking all this much too hard , [you]2803-you know . [You]2803-you ’ve too much on [your]2803-you shoulders , and [you]2803-you ’re over - tired : that ’s all . [I]823-i ’ve been with [[your]2803-you father]2435-your father and [mother]2490-mother for two days now , and [I]823-i see no signs of anything going wrong . The only trouble with [them]2810-them is that [they]2810-them ’re too rich . That makes [them]2810-them fretful : it ’s like teething . Every time [[your]2803-you father]2435-your father hears [he]2435-your father ’s made another million it ’s like cutting a new tooth . [They]2810-them hurt to bite on when one has so many . But [he]2435-your father ’ll find [people]463-people soon to go off for a cruise with [him]2435-your father , and then [he]2435-your father ’ll have to decide about [your]2803-you summer . [[Your]2803-you people]2657-your people must see that [this place]2814-this place is not bracing enough for [Terry]198-terry ; and [they]2657-your people ’ll want [him]198-terry to settle down somewhere in [the mountains]588-the mountains , and get to work as soon as possible . ”[823-i] The tone of [his]823-i voice seemed to quiet [her]824-she , though [he]823-i suspected that at first [she]824-she was too agitated to follow what [he]823-i said . “ But what sort of [people]463-people ? ”[824-she] [she]824-she brought out at length , disconsolately . “ What sort of [people]463-people ? ”[824-she] “ To go on [the yacht]2799-the yacht .
