Did n’t [you]145-boyne see how quick [she]128-blanca was about hiding it ? ”[866-i] BOOK II IX The next day , during the journey through [the hot Veneto]52-the hot veneto and up into [the mountains]588-the mountains , [the Wheater children]873-the wheater children and [their]873-the wheater children problems were still so present to [Boyne]145-boyne that [he]145-boyne was hardly conscious of where [he]145-boyne was going , or why . [His]145-boyne last hours with [[his]145-boyne friends]874-his friends had ended on a note of happiness and security . [The new yacht]875-the new yacht , filled and animated by that troop of [irrepressible children]876-irrepressible children , whom it took all [Miss Scope]147-miss scope ’s energy and ubiquity to keep from falling overboard or clambering to the mast - head , seemed suddenly to have acquired a reason for existing . [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , in [his]145-boyne speckless yachting cap and blue serge , moved about among [[his]145-boyne family]877-his family like [a beneficent giant]878-a beneficent giant , and [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , looking younger than ever in [her]120-mrs. wheater white yachting skirt and jersey , with [her]120-mrs. wheater golden thatch tossed by the breeze , fell into the prettiest maternal poses as [her]120-mrs. wheater own progeny and the “ steps ”[120-mrs. wheater] scrambled over [her]120-mrs. wheater in the course of a rough - and - tumble game organised by [Boyne]145-boyne and [the young tutor]879-the young tutor . The excursion had not begun auspiciously . Before the start from [the _ pension _]880-the _ pension _ , [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]154-beechy , imprisoned above stairs during [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench ’s irruption , had managed to inflict condign punishment on [Zinnie]133-zinnie for not having them fetched down with [Blanca]128-blanca , and thus making [them]881-them miss an exciting visit and probable presents . [Terry]198-terry ’s indifference to the whole affair produced no effect on the irascible [Italians]141-italians ; and as [Zinnie]133-zinnie , when roused , was [a fighter]882-a fighter , and now had a gold necklace with real pearls to defend , all [Judith]127-judith ’s influence , and some cuffing into the bargain , were needed to reduce [the trio]883-the trio to order ; after which [Boyne]145-boyne had to plead that [they]883-the trio should not be deprived of [their]883-the trio holiday . But once on [the deck of the “ Fancy Girl ”]2953-the deck of the “ fancy girl ”[127-judith] all disagreements were forgotten . It was a day of wind and sparkle , with a lagoon full of racing waves which made [the yacht]2799-the yacht appear to be actually moving ; and after [Beechy]154-beechy had drenched [her]154-beechy new frock with tears of joy at being reunited to [Chipstone]142-chipstone , and [Blanca]128-blanca and [Zinnie]133-zinnie had shown [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench ’s presents to [every one]885-every one , from [the captain]886-the captain to [the youngest cook - boy]887-the youngest cook - boy , harmony once more reigned among [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters . [Mr. Ormerod]179-mr. ormerod , with whom [Terry]198-terry was already at ease , soon broke down the reserve of [the others]2515-the others . [He]179-mr. ormerod proved unexpectedly good at games which involved scampering , hiding and pouncing , especially when [Joyce]121-boyne and [Judith]127-judith took part , and could be caught and wrestled with ; and [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , parading [the deck]375-the deck with [Chip]123-chip , whom [he]179-mr. ormerod had adorned with a miniature yachting cap with “ Fancy Girl ”[179-mr. ormerod] on the ribbon , was the model of [a happy father]890-a happy father . [He]179-mr. ormerod pressed [Boyne]145-boyne to chuck [his]145-boyne other engagements and come off down [the Adriatic]53-the adriatic as far as [Corfu]54-corfu and [Athens]55-athens ; and [Boyne]145-boyne , lounging there in the bright air , [the children]505-the children ’s laughter encircling [him]145-boyne , and [Judith]127-judith perched on the arm of [his]145-boyne chair , asked [himself]145-boyne why [he]145-boyne did n’t , and what better life could have to offer . “ [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward would certainly have accepted , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne thought , while [[his]145-boyne host]892-his host , pouring [himself]892-his host another cocktail from the deck - table at [his]892-his host elbow , went on persuasively : “ [We]2954-we ’ll round up a jolly crowd for [you]2955-you , see if [we]2954-we do n’t . [Somebody]2453-somebody ’s sure to turn up who ’ll jump at the chance . [Judy]127-judith , ca n’t [we]2954-we hustle around and find [him]2453-somebody [a girl]321-a girl ? ”[892-his host] “ Here ’s [all the girl [I]145-boyne want]2958-all the girl i want , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne laughed , laying [his]145-boyne hand on [hers]893-her ; and a blush of pleasure rose to [her]893-her face . “ Oh , [Martin]114-boyne — if [you]114-boyne would — oh , ca n’t [you]114-boyne ? ”[893-her] But even that [he]145-boyne had resisted — even the ebb of [her]893-her colour when [he]145-boyne shook [his]145-boyne head . [The wandering man]894-the wandering man ’s determination to stick to [his]145-boyne decisions was strong in [him]145-boyne . Too many impulses had solicited [him]145-boyne in [too many lands]895-too many lands : it was because , despite a lively imagination , [he]145-boyne had so often managed to resist [them]896-them , that a successful professional career lay behind [him]145-boyne , and ahead — [he]145-boyne hoped — comparative leisure , and the haven [he]145-boyne wanted . [He]145-boyne had tried to find a farewell present for [Judith]127-judith — some little thing which , in quality if not costliness , should make up for [her]127-judith disappointment at being done out of [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench ’s . [Judith]127-judith ’s frank avowal of that disappointment had been a shock to [him]145-boyne ; but [he]145-boyne reflected again what [a child]435-a child [she]127-judith was , and called [himself]145-boyne [a prig]898-a prig for expecting [her]127-judith standards to be other than those of [the world]307-the world [she]127-judith lived in . After all [he]145-boyne had had no time to search for anything rare , and could only push into [her]127-judith hand , at the last moment , a commonplace trinket from [the Merceria]46-the merceria ; but [her]127-judith childish joy in it , and [her]127-judith way of showing that [she]127-judith valued it doubly because it came from [him]145-boyne , made the parting from [her]127-judith harder . And now , alone in [the dusty train]900-the dusty train , [he]145-boyne was asking [himself]145-boyne why [he]145-boyne had not stayed in [Venice]8-venice . As a matter of fact there were several reasons ; among them the old - fashioned one that , months before , [he]145-boyne had promised to meet [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars in [the Dolomites]17-the dolomites . In a world grown clockless and conscienceless , [Boyne]145-boyne was still punctual and conscientious ; and in this case [he]145-boyne had schooled [himself]145-boyne to think that what [he]145-boyne most wanted was to see [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars again . Deep within [him]145-boyne [he]145-boyne knew it was not so ; at least , not certainly so . Life had since given [him]145-boyne hints of other things [he]145-boyne might want equally , want even more ; [his]145-boyne reluctance to leave [Venice]8-venice and [[his]145-boyne newly - acquired friends]901-his newly - acquired friends showed that [his]145-boyne inclinations were divided . But [he]145-boyne belonged to a generation which could not bear to admit that naught may abide but mutability . [He]145-boyne wanted the moral support of believing that [the woman who had once seemed to fill [his]145-boyne needs]902-the woman who had once seemed to fill his needs could do so still . [She]902-the woman who had once seemed to fill his needs belonged to a world so much nearer to [his]145-boyne than [the Wheaters]707-the wheaters and [[their]707-the wheaters flock]904-their flock that [he]145-boyne could not imagine how [he]145-boyne could waver between the two . [[Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ’s world]905-rose sellars ’s world had always been the pole - star of [[his]145-boyne whirling skies]906-his whirling skies , the fixed point on which [his]145-boyne need for permanence could build . [He]145-boyne could only conclude , now , that [he]145-boyne combined with [the wanderer]907-the wanderer ’s desire for rest [the wanderer]907-the wanderer ’s dread of immobility . “ Hang it all , [you]162-rose sellars ca n’t have it both ways , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne rebuked [himself]145-boyne ; but secretly [he]145-boyne knew that that was how the heart of [man]909-man had always craved it .... Had all that happened only forty - eight hours ago ? Now , as [he]145-boyne sat on [the balcony of [the _ châlet _]911-the _ châlet _ , over against the mighty silver and crimson flanks of [the Cristallo group]912-the cristallo group]910-the balcony of the _ châlet _ , over against the mighty silver and crimson flanks of the cristallo group , the episode had grown incredibly remote , and [Boyne]145-boyne saw [his]145-boyne problems float away from [him]145-boyne like a last curl of mist swallowed up in the blue behind [the peaks]913-the peaks . Simply change of air , [he]145-boyne wondered ? The sudden rise into this pure ether that was like a shouting of silver trumpets ? Partly , perhaps — and all that had chanced to go with it , in this wonderful resurrection of a life [he]145-boyne had secretly thought dead . “ [Bethesda]191-bethesda is what [you]162-rose sellars ought to call this , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne murmured to [himself]145-boyne . It was so like [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars , the live [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars who had already replaced [his]145-boyne delicately embalmed mummy of [her]162-rose sellars , to have found this _ châlet _ on [the slope above [the big hotels]915-the big hotels]914-the slope above the big hotels , [a place so isolated and hidden that [he]145-boyne and [she]162-rose sellars were alone in [it]916-a place so isolated and hidden that he and she were alone in it with each other and the mountains with [each other]396-each other and [the mountains]588-the mountains]916-a place so isolated and hidden that he and she were alone in it with each other and the mountains . How could [he]145-boyne have so underrated [[his]145-boyne old friend]454-his old friend ’s sense of the wonder of [the place]601-the place , and of what [she]162-rose sellars owed to [it]601-the place , as to suppose that , even for two or three weeks , [she]162-rose sellars would consent to be a number in [a red - carpeted passage]921-a red - carpeted passage , and feed with the rest of the numbers in a blare of jazz and electricity ? The _ châlet _ was only just big enough for [herself]162-rose sellars and [[her]162-rose sellars maid]922-her maid , and [the cook who prepared [their]924-their rustic meals]923-the cook who prepared their rustic meals ; had there been a corner for [Boyne]145-boyne , [she]162-rose sellars assured [him]145-boyne that [he]145-boyne should have had it . But perhaps it added to the mystery and enchantment that to see [her]162-rose sellars [he]145-boyne had to climb from the dull promiscuity of [[his]145-boyne hotel]925-his hotel into [a clear green solitude alive with the tremor of water under [meadow - grasses]927-meadow - grasses , and guarded by the great wings of [the mountains]588-the mountains]926-a clear green solitude alive with the tremor of water under meadow - grasses , and guarded by the great wings of the mountains . “ [You]145-boyne do really like it ? ”[162-rose sellars] [she]162-rose sellars had asked , as [they]924-their sat , the first evening , on [the balcony smelling of fir - wood]929-the balcony smelling of fir - wood , and watched [the cliffs across [the valley]931-the valley]930-the cliffs across the valley slowly decompose from flame to ashes . “ [I]145-boyne like it most of all for being so like [you]162-rose sellars , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne answered . [She]162-rose sellars laughed , and turned an amused ironic face on [him]145-boyne — a face more than ever like one of those light three - crayon drawings of which [she]162-rose sellars had always reminded [him]145-boyne . “ Like [me]162-rose sellars ? Which — the _ châlet _ or [the Cristallo group]912-the cristallo group ? ”[162-rose sellars] “ Well , both ; that ’s the funny part of it . ”[162-rose sellars] “ It must make [me]162-rose sellars seem a trifle out of drawing . ”[162-rose sellars] “ No ; first aloof and aloft , and then again small and sunny and near . ”[162-rose sellars] [She]162-rose sellars sighed faintly , and then smiled . “ Well , [I]162-rose sellars prefer the last part of the picture . But [I]162-rose sellars enjoy looking out on [the peak]2961-the peak . ”[162-rose sellars] “ There [you]145-boyne are — that ’s what [I]162-rose sellars meant ! The silence seemed to say : “ That will do for [our]932-their first evening , ”[162-rose sellars] the laugh : “ But [I]162-rose sellars like it , [you]145-boyne know ! ”[162-rose sellars] Aloud [she]162-rose sellars remarked : “ [I]162-rose sellars ’m glad [you]145-boyne came up here after [Venice]8-venice and [the millionaires]2962-the millionaires . It ’s all to the good for [the mountains]588-the mountains — and for [me]162-rose sellars . ”[162-rose sellars] [Their]932-their first direct talk about [themselves]932-their had ended there , drifting away afterward into reminiscences , questions , allusions , the picking up of threads — a gradual leisurely reconstruction of [their]932-their five years apart . Now , on this second evening , [he]933-he felt that [he]933-he had situated [her]162-rose sellars once more in [his]933-he own life , and established [himself]933-he in [hers]162-rose sellars . So far [he]933-he had made no allusion to [his]933-he unsatisfied passion . In the past , by [her]162-rose sellars own choice , [her]162-rose sellars sternly imposed will , [their]932-their relation had been maintained in the strict limits of friendship , and for the present [he]933-he found it easier , more natural , to continue on the same lines . It was neither doubt nor pride that held [him]933-he back , nor any uncertainty as to [her]162-rose sellars feeling ; but simply [his]933-he sense of the wellbeing of things as they were . In the course of [his]933-he life so much easy love had come [his]933-he way , [he]933-he had grown so weary of nights without a morrow , that [he]933-he needed to feel there was [one woman in [the world]307-the world whom [he]933-he was half - afraid to make love to]934-one woman in the world whom he was half - afraid to make love to . [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars had chosen that [he]933-he should know [her]162-rose sellars only as [the perfect friend]936-the perfect friend ; just at first , [he]933-he thought , [he]933-he would not disturb that carefully built - up picture . If [he]933-he had suspected [a rival influence]937-a rival influence [he]933-he would not have tolerated delay ; but as [they]938-they travelled together over [her]162-rose sellars past [he]933-he grew more and more sure that it was for [him]933-he the cold empty years of [her]162-rose sellars marriage had kept [her]162-rose sellars . Manlike , [he]933-he was calmed rather than stimulated by this , though [he]933-he would have repudiated more indignantly than ever the idea that [she]162-rose sellars was less desirable because [she]162-rose sellars was to be had . As a matter of fact , [he]933-he found [her]162-rose sellars prettier and younger than when [they]938-they had parted . Every change in [her]162-rose sellars was to [her]162-rose sellars advantage , and [he]933-he had instantly discarded [his]933-he sentimental remembrance of [her]162-rose sellars — dense coils of silvery - auburn hair , and draperies falling to the ankles — in favour of [the new woman which [her]162-rose sellars hair , dressed to look short , and [her]162-rose sellars brief skirts , had made of [her]162-rose sellars]939-the new woman which her hair , dressed to look short , and her brief skirts , had made of her . Freedom of spirit and of body had mysteriously rejuvenated [her]162-rose sellars , and [he]933-he found [her]162-rose sellars far more intelligent and adaptable than [he]933-he had guessed when [their]938-they relation had been obscured by [his]933-he passion and [her]162-rose sellars resistance . Now there was no resistance — and [his]933-he passion lay with folded wings . It was perfect . Every day [they]938-they went off on an excursion . Sometimes [they]938-they hired [a motor]940-a motor , leaving it , far afield , for a long climb ; but neither could afford such luxuries often , nor did [they]938-they much care for [them]941-them . Usually [they]938-they started on foot , with stick and rucksack , getting back only as [the great cliffs]942-the great cliffs hung their last lustre above [the valley]931-the valley . [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars was [a tireless walker , proud of [her]163-mrs. sellars light foot and firm muscles]944-a tireless walker , proud of her light foot and firm muscles . [She]163-mrs. sellars loved all the delicate detail revealed only to [walkers]945-walkers : the thrust of orchis or colchicum through pine - needles , the stir of brooks , the uncurling of perfumed fronds , the whirr of wings in the path , and that continual pulsation of water and wind and grasses which is the heart - beat of [the forest]946-the forest . [Boyne]145-boyne , always alive to great landscape , had hitherto been too busy or preoccupied to note its particulars . It was years since [he]145-boyne had rambled among [mountains]947-mountains without having to look at them with an engineering eye , and calculate [their]947-mountains relation to a projected railway or [aqueduct]948-aqueduct ; and these walks opened [his]145-boyne eyes to unheeded beauties . It was like being led through the flowered borders of an illuminated missal of which [he]145-boyne had hitherto noticed only the central pictures . Better still were the evenings . When [he]145-boyne first came a full moon held [them]938-they late on [the balcony]949-the balcony , listening and musing , and sent [him]145-boyne down dizzy with beauty through the black fir - shadows to [[his]145-boyne hotel]925-his hotel . When the moon had waned , and the nights were fresh or cloudy , [they]938-they sat by the fire , and talked and talked , or turned over new books and reviews . [Boyne]145-boyne , with [his]145-boyne bones and [his]145-boyne brain so full of hard journeys and restless memories , thought [he]145-boyne would have liked to look forward to an eternity of such evenings , in just such [a hushed lamplit room]951-a hushed lamplit room , with a little sparkle of fire , reviews and papers everywhere , and that quiet silvery - auburn head with its mass of closely woven braids bending over a book across the hearth . [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ’s way of being silently occupied without seeming absorbed was deeply restful . And then [her]162-rose sellars books ! [She]162-rose sellars always managed to have just the ones [he]145-boyne wanted to get hold of — to [a homeless wandering man]952-a homeless wandering man it was not the least of [her]162-rose sellars attractions . Once , taking up a volume [they]938-they had been talking of , [Boyne]145-boyne recalled [Judith Wheater]127-judith ’s wistful : “ Perhaps [you]145-boyne might lend [me]127-judith some books . ”[127-judith] From what fold of memory had the question — and the very sound of [the girl]326-the girl ’s voice — come back to [him]145-boyne ? [He]145-boyne was abruptly reminded that it was a long time since [he]145-boyne had given a thought to [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters . There had been so many years to cover in the exchange of reminiscences that [he]145-boyne had not yet touched on [his]145-boyne encounter with [them]130-the wheaters ; and [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars seemed to have forgotten the description of the little band which had amused [her]163-mrs. sellars in [his]145-boyne letters . But now [he]145-boyne was reminded , with a pang , of the contrast between [her]162-rose sellars ordered and harmonious life ( [she]162-rose sellars always reminded [him]145-boyne of [Milton]192-milton ’s “ How charming is divine philosophy ! ”[162-rose sellars] ) and the chaotic experiences of [the poor little girl who for a moment had displaced [her]162-rose sellars image]954-the poor little girl who for a moment had displaced her image . Inconceivably vulgar and tawdry , sordid and inarticulate , under all the shouting and the tinsel , seemed that other life and [those who led it]955-those who led it . [Boyne]145-boyne would have brushed the vision away with contempt but for the voice which had called to [him]145-boyne out of the blur . With a sigh [he]145-boyne put down the book [he]145-boyne had opened . [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars [, who sat at the table writing]956-, who sat at the table writing , looked up , and [their]957-their eyes met . “ What were [you]145-boyne thinking of ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] [He]145-boyne had a start of distrust — the first since [he]145-boyne had been with [her]163-mrs. sellars . Please do nt tell [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters that [I]145-boyne ve written . ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne ’s first thought , as [he]145-boyne put the letter down , was that [he]145-boyne was glad it had come after what had happened that very evening on [the balcony]949-the balcony . There had happened , simply , that the barriers created by a long habit of reticence had fallen , and [he]145-boyne had taken [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars into [his]145-boyne arms . It was a quiet embrace , the hushed surface of something deep and still . [She]162-rose sellars had not spoken ; [he]145-boyne thanked [[his]145-boyne gods]973-his gods for that . Almost any word might have marred the moment , tied a tag to it , and fitted it with others into some dusty pigeon - hole of memory . [She]162-rose sellars had known how to be different — and that was exquisite . [Their]974-their quiet communion had silently flowered , and [she]162-rose sellars had let it . There was neither haste nor reluctance in [her]162-rose sellars , but an acquiescence so complete that what was deepest in both of [them]974-their had flowed together through [their]974-their hands and lips . “ It will be so much easier now to consult [her]162-rose sellars — [she’ll]162-rose sellars understand so much better . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne did n’t quite know why [he]145-boyne felt that ; perhaps because the merging of [their]974-their two selves seemed to include every claim that [others]820-others could have on either of [them]974-their . Only yesterday [he]145-boyne might have felt a doubt as to how [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars would view [the Wheater]133-zinnie problem , what [she]162-rose sellars could possibly have in common with any of [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters , or [[their]130-the wheaters world]976-their world ; now it was enough that [she]162-rose sellars had [him]145-boyne in common , and must share the burden because it was [his]145-boyne . [He]145-boyne went over [Judith]127-judith ’s letter again slowly , imagining how [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s beautiful eyes would deepen as [she]163-mrs. sellars read it . The very spelling was enough to wring [her]163-mrs. sellars heart . [He]145-boyne would take the letter to [her]163-mrs. sellars the next day .... But the next day was here already . [He]145-boyne pushed back [his]145-boyne window , and leaned out . In the cold colourless air a few stars were slowly whitening , while behind the blackness of [the hillside]977-the hillside facing [him]145-boyne the interstellar pallor flowed imperceptibly into morning gold . [His]145-boyne happiness , [he]145-boyne thought , was like that passing of colourless radiance into glow . It was joy enough to lean there and watch the transmutation . Was it a sign of middle - age , [he]145-boyne wondered , to take beatitude so quietly ? Well , [Rose]162-rose sellars , for all [her]162-rose sellars buoyancy , was middle - aged too . Then [he]145-boyne remembered [their]978-their kiss , and laughed the word away as the sun rushed up over [the mountains]588-the mountains . All that day there was too much to do and to say ; there were too many plans to make ; too many memories to retrace . [Boyne]145-boyne did not forget [Judith Wheater]127-judith ’s letter ; [her]127-judith problem lay like a vague oppression in the background of [his]145-boyne thoughts ; but [he]145-boyne found no way of fitting it into the new pattern of [his]145-boyne life . Just yet — It was decided that [he]145-boyne and [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars should linger on in [the mountains]588-the mountains for another month — a month of mighty rambles , long hours of summer sunlight , and nights illuminated by a waxing moon . After that , [Boyne]145-boyne ’s idea had been that [they]978-their should push on at once to [Paris]42-paris , and there be married as quickly as legal formalities allowed . It was at this hint of an immediate marriage that [he]145-boyne first noticed , in [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , the recoil of [the orderly deliberate woman whose life has been too vacant for hurry , too hopeless for impatience]981-the orderly deliberate woman whose life has been too vacant for hurry , too hopeless for impatience . Theoretically , [she]163-mrs. sellars told [him]145-boyne with a smile , [she]163-mrs. sellars hated delay and fuss as much as [he]145-boyne did — and how could [he]145-boyne question [her]163-mrs. sellars eagerness to begin [their]978-their new life ? But practically , [she]163-mrs. sellars reminded [him]145-boyne , there were difficulties , there might even be obstacles . Oh , not real ones , of course ! [She]163-mrs. sellars laughed that away , remarking with a happy blush that [she]163-mrs. sellars was of age , and [[her]163-mrs. sellars own mistress]982-her own mistress . ( “ Well , then — ? ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne interjected . ) Well , there were [people who had to be considered]983-people who had to be considered ; who might be offended by too great haste : [[[her]163-mrs. sellars husband]411-her husband ’s family]985-her husband ’s family , for instance . [She]163-mrs. sellars had never hit it off with [them]983-people who had to be considered particularly well , as [Boyne]145-boyne knew ; but that was the very reason , [she]163-mrs. sellars insisted , why [she]163-mrs. sellars must do nothing that might give [them]983-people who had to be considered cause .... [She]163-mrs. sellars excelled at saying nice things like that ( and was aware of it ) ; but [her]163-mrs. sellars doing so now was like putting kickshaws before [a hungry man]995-a hungry man . “ It ’s awfully sweet of [you]163-mrs. sellars , ”[200-mr. dobree] [he]200-mr. dobree continued ; “ but [I]200-mr. dobree shall be miserable if [you]163-mrs. sellars insist on things dragging on for another five months . All [her]163-mrs. sellars idle married years , [he]200-mr. dobree knew , had been packed with settling things , adjusting things , adapting things , disguising things . It ought , in reason , to have sent a pleasant glow through [him]997-he , for [he]997-he knew that , in spite of [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s efforts , [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had been left with unexpectedly small means , and the earnings of [his]997-he own twenty years of hard work in hard climates had been partly lost in unlucky investments . The kind of post [he]997-he meant to try for in [New York]13-new york — as [consulting engineer to [some large firm of contractors]1000-some large firm of contractors]999-consulting engineer to some large firm of contractors — was not likely to bring in as much as [his]997-he big jobs in the past ; and the appearance of [a gouty aunt with benevolent testamentary designs]1001-a gouty aunt with benevolent testamentary designs ought to have been an unmixed satisfaction . But trimming [his]997-he course to suit the whims of rich relations had never been [his]997-he way — perhaps because [he]997-he had never had any rich relations . Anyhow , [he]997-he was not going to be dictated to by [[his]997-he wife]498-his wife ’s ; and it gave [him]997-he a feeling of manliness to tell [her]498-his wife so . “ Of course , if it ’s a case of choosing between [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia and [me]997-he — ”[997-he] [he]997-he began severely . [She]498-his wife raised [her]498-his wife eyebrows with that soft mockery [he]997-he enjoyed so much when it was not turned against [himself]997-he . “ In that case , [dear]2469-dear , [I]498-his wife should almost certainly choose [you]2469-dear . ”[498-his wife] “ Well , then , pack up , and let ’s go straight off to [Paris]42-paris and get married . ”[498-his wife] “ [Martin]193-martin , [you]193-martin ought to understand . With a secret dismay [he]1003-he felt [[their]1004-their lovers]1005-their lovers ’ talk degenerating for the first time into a sort of domestic squabble ; if indeed so ungraceful a term could be applied to anything as sweetly resilient as [Rose]162-rose sellars ’s way of gaining [her]162-rose sellars end . Was marriage always like that ? Was the haven [Boyne]145-boyne had finally made to be only a stagnant backwater , like [other people]312-other people ’s ? Or was it because [he]145-boyne had been wandering and homeless for so long that the least restraint chafed [him]145-boyne , and arguments based on social considerations made [him]145-boyne fume ? [He]1003-he was certainly in no position to quarrel with [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars for wishing to better [her]163-mrs. sellars fortunes , and the discussion ended by [his]1003-he lifting [her]498-his wife hand to [his]1003-he lips and saying : “ [You]498-his wife know [I]498-his wife want only what [you]498-his wife want . ”[498-his wife] [The coward]1007-the coward ’s way out — and [he]1003-he knew it . But since [he]1003-he had parted with the substance of [his]1003-he independence , why cling to the form ? [He]1003-he felt [her]498-his wife eyes following [his]1003-he inner debate , and knew that the sweetness of [her]498-his wife smile was distilled out of satisfaction at [his]1003-he defeat . “ Damn it , ”[1003-he] [he]1003-he thought , “ what cannibals marriage makes of [people]463-people . ”[1003-he] [He]1003-he suddenly felt as if [they]1008-they were already married — as if [they]1008-they had been married a long time .... During [their]1008-they first fortnight not a cloud had shadowed [their]1008-they comradeship ; but now that love and marriage had intervened the cloud was there , no bigger than the Scriptural one , but menacing as that proverbial vapour . [She]498-his wife was kinder than ever because [she]498-his wife had gained [her]498-his wife point ; and [he]1003-he knew it was because [she]498-his wife had gained [her]498-his wife point . But was it not [his]1003-he fault if [he]1003-he had begun thus early to distinguish among [her]498-his wife different qualities as if they belonged to different vintage years , and to speculate whether the quality of [her]498-his wife friendship might not prove more exquisite than [her]498-his wife love could ever be ? [He]1003-he was willing to assume the blame , since the joy of holding [her]498-his wife fast , of plunging into [her]498-his wife enchanted eyes , and finding [his]1003-he own enchantment there , was still stronger than any disappointment . If love could n’t be friendship too , as [he]1003-he had once dreamed it might , the only thing to do was to make the most of what it was .... [Judith Wheater]127-judith ’s letter had been for over a week in [Boyne]145-boyne ’s pocket when [he]145-boyne pulled it out , crumpled and smelling of tobacco . [He]145-boyne and [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars were reclining at ease on [a high red ledge of rock]1009-a high red ledge of rock , with a view plunging down by [pine - clad precipices]1010-pine - clad precipices , pastures and forests to illimitable distances of blue Dolomite . The air sang with light , the smell of crushed herbs rose like incense , and the hearts of [the lovers]1011-the lovers were glad with sun and wind , and the glow of a long climb followed by such food as only a rucksack can provide . “ And now for a pipe , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne said , in sleepy beatitude , stretching [himself]145-boyne out on the turf at [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s elbow . [He]145-boyne fumbled for [his]145-boyne tobacco pouch , and drew out with it the forgotten letter . “ Oh , dash it — ”[145-boyne] “ What ? ”[145-boyne] “ [Poor little thing]2987-poor little thing ! [I]145-boyne forgot this ; [I]145-boyne meant to show it to [you]163-mrs. sellars days ago . ”[145-boyne] “ Who ’s [the poor little thing]2425-the poor little thing ? ”[145-boyne] For a moment [he]145-boyne wavered . [His]145-boyne old dread of [her]127-judith misunderstanding returned ; and [he]145-boyne felt [he]145-boyne could not bear to have [her]127-judith misunderstand that letter . What was the use of showing it , after all ? But [she]127-judith was holding out [her]127-judith hand , and [he]145-boyne had no alternative . [She]127-judith raised [herself]127-judith on [her]127-judith elbow , and bent [her]127-judith lustrous head above the page . From where [he]145-boyne lay [he]145-boyne watched [her]127-judith profile , and the subtle curves of the line from ear to throat . “ How lovely [she]127-judith still is , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne thought . [She]127-judith read attentively , frowning a little in the attempt to decipher [Judith]127-judith ’s spelling , and [her]127-judith mouth melting into amusement or compassion . Then [she]127-judith handed back the letter . “ [I]127-judith suppose it ’s from [the little Wheater girl [you]145-boyne wrote about]2989-the little wheater girl you wrote about ? Hang it , [I]1026-he wish [she]127-judith had n’t written , ”[1026-he] [he]1026-he concluded , relieved to find a distant object for [his]1026-he irritation . [XI]205-xi “ Of course [I]145-boyne ’ve written to [her]127-judith — [I]145-boyne wrote last night , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne assured [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars the next evening . [XII]65-xii Before mounting to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s the next morning [Boyne]145-boyne went down to [the _ Pension Rosenglüh _]3070-the _ pension rosenglüh _ to gather what farther details [he]145-boyne could of the strange flight of [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters . As [he]145-boyne reached [the _ pension _ gate]1089-the _ pension _ gate [he]145-boyne was met by [Miss Scope]147-miss scope , looking more than commonly gaunt and ravaged , but as brightly resolute as [[her]147-miss scope fellow - conspirator]1090-her fellow - conspirator . [Her]147-miss scope gray cotton glove enfolded [Boyne]145-boyne ’s hand in an unflinching grasp , and [she]147-miss scope exclaimed at once how providential it was that [they]1091-they should have caught [him]145-boyne still at [Cortina]34-cortina . [She]147-miss scope added that [she]147-miss scope had been on the look - out for [him]145-boyne , as both [Judith]127-judith and [Terry]198-terry were still asleep , and [she]147-miss scope was sure [he]145-boyne ’d agree that [they]1091-they had better not be disturbed , after all [they]1091-they ’d been through ; especially as [Terry]198-terry was still feverish . [The other children]2552-the other children , [he]145-boyne gathered , had already breakfasted , and been shepherded out by [Nanny]156-nanny and [the nursemaid]1093-the nursemaid to [the downs above [the valley]931-the valley]1094-the downs above the valley ; and meanwhile perhaps [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne would come in and have a chat . The word seemed light for the heavy news [he]145-boyne was prepared to hear ; but [he]145-boyne suspected that [Miss Scope]147-miss scope , like [the Witch of Atlas]1096-the witch of atlas , was used to racing on the platforms of the wind , and laughed to hear the fire - balls roar behind . At any rate , [her]147-miss scope sturdy composure restored [his]145-boyne own balance , and made [him]145-boyne glad of the opportunity to hear [her]147-miss scope version of the adventure before [his]145-boyne next encounter with [Judith]127-judith . [Miss Scope]147-miss scope was composed , as [she]147-miss scope always was — [he]145-boyne was soon to learn — in real emergencies . [She]147-miss scope had been through so many that they seemed to [her]147-miss scope as natural and inevitable as thunder - storms or chicken - pox — as troublesome , but no more to be fussed about . Nevertheless , [she]147-miss scope did not underrate the gravity of the situation : to do so , [he]145-boyne suspected , would have robbed [it]1097-it of its savour . There had been cataclysms before — times when [Judy]127-judith had threatened to go off and disappear with all [the children]505-the children — but till now [she]127-judith had never even attempted to put [her]127-judith threats into execution . “ And now [she]127-judith ’s carried it off with a master hand , ”[127-judith] [Miss Scope]147-miss scope declared in a tone of grim triumph . But carried it where to ? That was the question [Boyne]145-boyne could not help putting . [He]145-boyne was sure [Judith]127-judith had been masterly — but where was it all going to lead ? Had any of [them]505-the children taken that into account , [he]145-boyne asked ? Well , [Miss Scope]147-miss scope had to own that [their]505-the children departure had been too precipitate for much taking into account . It had to be then or never — [she]147-miss scope had seen that as clearly as [Judy]127-judith and [Terry]198-terry . The fact that [Terry]198-terry was with [them]505-the children showed how desperate the situation was — “ Desperate ? Really desperate ? ”[198-terry] “ Oh , [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne ! If [you]145-boyne ’d been through it twice before , as [[my]145-boyne poor children]3111-my poor children have .... ”[145-boyne] Listening to the details of [her]147-miss scope story , [he]145-boyne agreed that it must indeed have been awful , and ended by declaring that [he]145-boyne did not question [Judith]127-judith ’s reasons ; but now that the first step in the mutiny was taken , how did [Miss Scope]147-miss scope imagine that [they]505-the children were going to keep it up ? In short , what did [they]505-the children mean to do when [they]505-the children were found out ? “ [I]147-miss scope think [Judith]127-judith counts very much on [your]145-boyne intervention . That ’s the reason [she]127-judith was so anxious to find [you]145-boyne still [here]2434-here . And of course [she]127-judith hopes there ’ll be time — time to consider , to choose a course of action . The only thing [I]145-boyne ’m racking [my]145-boyne brains about is how to help [you]127-judith to get what [you]127-judith want . To keep [you]127-judith all together , as [you]127-judith are now , and yet not let [[your]127-judith father]2435-your father and [mother]2490-mother think that [I]145-boyne ’ve had anything to do with this performance . [You]127-judith ’re quite right ; [I]145-boyne do want to stay on good terms with [them]3188-them , because if [I]145-boyne do [I]145-boyne may succeed in persuading [them]3188-them that , whatever happens , [they]3188-them ’ve no right to separate [[you]127-judith children]3189-you children again . If [I]145-boyne do that [I]145-boyne shall have done [my]145-boyne best for [you]127-judith . But [I]145-boyne do n’t see [my]145-boyne way to it yet , and that ’s why [I]145-boyne want [you]127-judith to come and make [friends]2485-friends with [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars . ”[145-boyne] To [his]1132-he surprise [she]1133-she listened in an attentive silence , and , when [he]1132-he had ended , lifted to [his]1132-he the face of [an obedient child]1134-an obedient child . “ Of course [I]1133-she ’ll do what [you]127-judith want , [Martin]193-martin . But do n’t [you]127-judith think [[your]127-judith friend]2832-your friend would perhaps understand better if [I]1133-she had [Nanny]156-nanny bring up [Chip]123-chip to see [her]2832-your friend after lunch ? ”[1133-she] “ Bless [you]127-judith — of course [she]2832-your friend would , ”[1132-he] [he]1132-he agreed enthusiastically ; and [she]1133-she thereupon proposed that before [they]1135-their started [he]1132-he should come [upstairs]3110-upstairs and see [Terry]198-terry . XIII Seeing [Terry]198-terry , [Boyne]145-boyne had to admit , was the surest way of attaching one , body and soul , to the cause of [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters . Whatever [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars thought of [Judith]127-judith — a question of obvious uncertainty — there could be no doubt as to what [she]163-mrs. sellars would think of [Terry]198-terry . There had been moments during the morning when [Boyne]145-boyne did not see how any good will on either part could bridge the distance between [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s conception of life , and [Judith Wheater]127-judith ’s experience of it ; but between [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars and [Terry]198-terry there would be nothing to explain or bridge over . [Their]1135-their minds would meet as soon as [their]1135-their eyes did . “ [I]145-boyne ’ll bring [her]132-scopy down to see [him]198-terry after lunch , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne decided . There was no hope of [Terry]198-terry ’s being up that day . The excitement of the flight , and the heat and fatigue of the journey , had used up [his]198-terry small surplus of strength , and [he]198-terry could only lie staring at [Boyne]145-boyne with eager eyes , and protest that [he]198-terry knew the air of [Cortina]34-cortina would put [him]198-terry all right before long . [Scopy]132-scopy had already had [the doctor]1137-the doctor in , and administered suitable remedies , and [the patient]1138-the patient ’s temperature had dropped to nearly normal . “ If only [father]2441-father and [mother]2490-mother will let [us]3194-us stay [here]2434-here [I]145-boyne ’m sure [I]145-boyne shall be patched up this time . And [you]145-boyne ’ll be here for a bit to look after [the children]505-the children , wo n’t [you]145-boyne , [Martin]193-martin ? ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne said [he]145-boyne would stay as long as [he]145-boyne could , and at any rate not leave till [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters ’ difficulty with [[their]130-the wheaters parents]507-their parents was on the way to adjustment . [He]145-boyne pointed out that negotiations would no doubt be necessary , and [Terry]198-terry promptly rejoined : “ That ’s just why [Judy]127-judith and [I]198-terry decided to come [here]2434-here . [We]3198-we knew that if [we]3198-we could get hold of [you]145-boyne , [you]145-boyne ’d back [us]3198-we up , and help [us]3198-we to make some kind of terms with [father]2441-father and [mother]2490-mother . ”[198-terry] [His]145-boyne eyes fixed [[his]145-boyne friend]1084-his friend ’s with a passionate insistence . “ [You]145-boyne see , [Martin]193-martin , it wo n’t do , separating [us]3198-we again — it really wo n’t . [We]3198-we ’re not going to get any sort of education at this rate . And as for manners ! [The children]505-the children have all been completely demoralised since [Zinnia]197-joyce ’s visit . Now [they]505-the children ’ve heard of [Buondelmonte]151-astorre ’s marriage , and the steps have gone off [their]505-the children base too ; and as for [Blanca]128-blanca [she]128-blanca thinks of nothing but dressing - up and flirtation .... As soon as things go wrong between [father]2441-father and [mother]2490-mother [the children]505-the children seem to feel it in the air ; even before the actual fighting begins , [they]505-the children all get out of hand . [Zinnie]133-zinnie gave [Bun]135-bun a black eye the other day because [he]3205-his said [he]3205-his was going to be [a Prince]3206-a prince again , and live in [[[his]3205-his father]413-his father ’s palace in [Rome]66-rome]3208-his father ’s palace in rome , and have [his]3205-his own Rolls ... [a child who hardly knows [his]3205-his letters]3209-a child who hardly knows his letters ! ”[198-terry] [Terry]198-terry concluded with a gesture of contempt . “ [I]145-boyne know , [old man]2641-old man . It ’s all wrong , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne agreed , “ and something ’s got to be done , and done soon . Meanwhile [you]2641-old man must make the most of this respite to get a good rest . [I]145-boyne promise [I]145-boyne ’ll do what [I]145-boyne can when the time comes . ”[145-boyne] “ Oh , [you]2641-old man need n’t promise , ”[198-terry] [Terry]198-terry said , letting [his]198-terry head sink back contentedly on the pillows . On the way up [the hill]3071-the hill with [Judith]127-judith , [Boyne]145-boyne was able to gather some of the details [she]127-judith had been too tired and excited to impart the night before . [Miss Scope]147-miss scope ’s confidences were always in the nature of sombre generalizations . When it came to particulars , [she]127-judith retreated behind professional secrecy ; and [Boyne]145-boyne had not liked to force [her]127-judith defences . Besides , [he]145-boyne knew that no such scruples would hamper [Judith]127-judith , who saw life only in particulars . But , after all , there was nothing very unexpected in [Judith]127-judith ’s story . As [she]127-judith said , it was always the same old row over again . As soon as [Zinnia Lacrosse]143-zinnia had cast a covetous eye on [Gerald Ormerod]175-gerald , [Joyce]197-joyce had decided that [she]197-joyce could not live without [him]145-boyne . The thought of [his]145-boyne dining every night at [the Lido]1142-the lido with [the Wrenches]208-the wrenches and [the Duke of Mendip]2941-the duke of mendip , while [she]197-joyce and [Wheater]127-judith sat alone on the deck of the “ Fancy Girl , ”[197-joyce] or made the most of [such mediocre guests as [they]1145-they could collect]1144-such mediocre guests as they could collect , was too much for [a high - spirited woman]1146-a high - spirited woman ; and [Joyce]197-joyce had suddenly requested [[her]197-joyce husband]411-her husband to sack [the tutor]799-the tutor . [Wheater]127-judith , surprised , had protested that [Terry]198-terry liked [him]145-boyne ( and [Terry]198-terry did — [he]198-terry was very jolly , and [a good teacher]1149-a good teacher , [Judith]127-judith impartially admitted ) ; whereupon [Joyce]197-joyce had declared that if [Ormerod]175-gerald was n’t sent away at once [she]197-joyce intended to divorce [Wheater]127-judith and marry [him]145-boyne . [Wheater]127-judith , of course , was furious , and there had been , in [Judith]127-judith ’s language , an all - round circus , complicated by the fact that what [Gerald]175-gerald really wanted was to marry _ [her]127-judith _ — “ What — what ? If [you]193-martin like to call it so , [I]147-miss scope stole the money . [He]2441-father always has a lot about , because it bores [him]2441-father so to write cheques . ”[147-miss scope] “ And [you]147-miss scope helped [yourself]147-miss scope — to what [you]147-miss scope wanted ? ”[147-miss scope] “ It was awfully easy . [I]147-miss scope knew where the key was . ”[147-miss scope] [She]147-miss scope seemed anxious to disclaim any undeserved credit in the matter . “ And , anyhow , [I]145-boyne knew part of it was intended for [our]3307-our expenses in [the Engadine]38-the engadine this summer . So it really was n’t exactly like stealing — was it ? ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne sat down again , this time in a chair on the farther side of [the room]1180-the room . There seemed to be something almost maleficent in the proximity of [the small scarlet figure with rumpled hair and sleep - misted eyes]1218-the small scarlet figure with rumpled hair and sleep - misted eyes , curled up defiantly in the sofa corner . “ [You]147-miss scope told [[your]147-miss scope father]2435-your father this , [I]1218-the small scarlet figure with rumpled hair and sleep - misted eyes suppose , in the letter [you]147-miss scope left for [him]2435-your father ? ”[1218-the small scarlet figure with rumpled hair and sleep - misted eyes] “ Told [him]2435-your father [I]147-miss scope ’d taken the money ? ”[147-miss scope] [She]147-miss scope laughed . “ If [I]147-miss scope had , there would n’t have been much use in taking it — would there ? ”[147-miss scope] [He]145-boyne groaned , and sat silent , [his]145-boyne eyes fixed on the carefully scrubbed boards of the floor . For a while [he]145-boyne concentrated [his]145-boyne whole attention on one of their resinous knots ; then , with limbs of lead , [he]145-boyne slowly stood up again . “ Well , [I]145-boyne wash [my]145-boyne hands of [you]127-judith — all of [you]127-judith . ”[145-boyne] [Judith]127-judith rose also , and went quickly up to [him]145-boyne . “ [Martin]193-martin , ”[127-judith] [she]127-judith said in a frightened voice , “ what are [you]193-martin going to do ? ”[127-judith] “ Do ? Nothing . [You]127-judith ’d better answer that telegram [yourself]145-boyne , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne retorted roughly , shaking off the hand [she]127-judith had put out . [He]145-boyne walked across [the room]1180-the room , blinked unseeingly at [his]145-boyne hat and stick , which [he]145-boyne had thrown down on the table , and turned to go out of the door without remembering to pick them up . On the threshold [he]145-boyne was checked by [Judith]127-judith ’s passionate clutch on [his]145-boyne arm . [Her]127-judith lifted face was wet and frightened . “ [Martin]193-martin — why do n’t [you]193-martin say [you]193-martin think [I]145-boyne ’m [a thief]3309-a thief , and have done with it ? ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne swung round on [her]127-judith . “ [I]145-boyne think [you]193-martin ’re [an unutterable fool]3310-an unutterable fool . It does n’t matter about [anybody else]3315-anybody else .... ”[1220-he] [He]1220-he stood silent , suffering [her]1221-her clasp of desperate entreaty , as if a numbness had crept into the arm [she]1221-her held , and yet as if every nerve in it were fire . All the forces of pity — and of something closer to the soul than pity — were fighting in [him]1220-he for [her]1221-her . But opposed to [them]1222-them was the old habit of relentless unconditional probity ; [the working man]1223-the working man ’s faith in a standard to be kept up , and imposed on [others]820-others , at no matter what cost of individual suffering . “ [I]1220-he ca n’t let [her]1221-her drift , ”[1220-he] was as near as [he]1220-he could come to it .... “ [Martin]193-martin , tell [me]1221-her what [you]193-martin want [me]1221-her to do , ”[1221-her] [she]1221-her whispered , [her]1221-her lips trembling . [His]1220-he own hardened . “ Sit down at that table and write to [[your]193-martin father]2435-your father that [you]193-martin took the money — and why [you]193-martin took it . ”[1221-her] For a while [she]1221-her considered this painfully . “ If [I]1221-her do n’t , ”[1221-her] [she]1221-her finally brought out , “ shall [you]193-martin tell [Terry]198-terry ? ”[1221-her] [He]1220-he gave [her]1221-her an indignant look . “ Of course [I]1220-he sha n’t tell [Terry]198-terry ! ”[1220-he] “ Very well . Then [I]145-boyne will . ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne flushed with the suddenness of [his]1220-he triumph , and most of all at the reason for it . “ That ’s [[my]1221-her [Judy]127-judith]3317-my judy ! ”[1221-her] [She]1221-her coloured too , as if surprised , but [her]1221-her face remained drawn and joyless . “ But if [I]1221-her do , the game ’s up — isn’t it ? ”[1221-her] “ The game ’s up anyhow , [[my]1221-her dear]2807-my dear . ”[1221-her] [Her]1221-her colour faded . “ [You]1220-he mean [you]1220-he ’re really going to give [us]3319-us away ? ”[1220-he] [He]1220-he paused , and then said with deliberation : “ [I]1220-he ’m going to [Venice]8-venice at once to see [[your]1221-her father]2435-your father . ”[1220-he] “ To tell [him]2435-your father [we]3319-us ’re here ? ”[1220-he] “ Of course . ”[1221-her] [Her]1221-her hand fell from [his]1220-he arm , and [she]1221-her stood drooping before [him]1220-he , all the youth drained out of [her]1221-her face . And the money , [Martin]193-martin — [father]2441-father wo n’t find out for ever so long that it ’s gone . There was a lot more where [I]1221-her took it from . [He]2441-father always has such heaps with [him]2441-father ; and [he]2441-father never knows how much [he]2441-father ’s spent . [She]1226-she turned and left [the room]1180-the room . While [she]1226-she was gone [he]145-boyne stood gazing out of the window . Of all the world of light and freedom before [him]145-boyne , [its]1228-its spreading mountain slopes , [its]1228-its spires of granite reared into a cloud - pillared sky , and the giant blue shadows racing each other across [the valleys]1229-the valleys , [he]145-boyne saw nothing but the narrow thread of railway winding down to [Venice]8-venice and [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters . [He]145-boyne had still to make [Judith]127-judith write the letter to [[her]127-judith father]2542-her father . [XV]217-xv “ Damn — damn , damn — oh , _ damn _ ! ”[217-xv] It seemed to be the only expletive at [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s command , and [Boyne]145-boyne felt that [he]145-boyne had used it so often that it was as worn out as an old elastic band , and no longer held [his]145-boyne scattered ideas together . [He]145-boyne plunged down into an armchair of [the Lido Palace lounge]1233-the lido palace lounge — [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters had moved out to [the Lido]57-the lido — and sat there , embraced by a cluster of huge leather bolsters , [his]145-boyne good - humoured lips tinged with an uneasy purple , the veins in [his]145-boyne blond temples swollen with a helpless exasperation . “ Damn ! ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne ejaculated again . [The place]601-the place was empty . It was the hour of the afternoon sun - bath on [the sands below [the hotel]1085-the hotel]1235-the sands below the hotel , and [no one]2415-no one shared with [them]1238-them the cool twilight of [the hall]711-the hall but a knot of [white - jacketed boys]1240-white - jacketed boys languishing near [the lift]1241-the lift , and a gold - braided porter dozing behind [his]145-boyne desk . [Boyne]145-boyne sat opposite to [Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , in another vast slippery armchair to which only a continual muscular effort could anchor [his]145-boyne spare frame . [He]145-boyne sat and watched [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater with the narrow - lipped attention [he]145-boyne might have given to the last stages of a debate with [a native potentate on whom [he]145-boyne was trying to impose some big engineering scheme which would necessitate crossing [[the ruler]1243-the ruler ’s territory]1244-the ruler ’s territory]1242-a native potentate on whom he was trying to impose some big engineering scheme which would necessitate crossing the ruler ’s territory . But with [the potentate]1245-the potentate it would have been only a question of matching values ; of convincing [him]145-boyne of the material worth of what was offered . In such negotiations the language spoken , when interpreted , usually turned out to be the same . But in [his]145-boyne talk with [Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , [Boyne]145-boyne had the sense of using an idiom for which the other had no equivalents . Superficially [their]1246-their vocabularies were the same ; below the surface each lost its meaning for the other . [Wheater]120-mrs. wheater continued to toss uneasily on a sea of incomprehension . “ What in hell can [I]145-boyne do about it ? ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne demanded . It was almost unintelligible that anything should have happened to [him]145-boyne against which [his]145-boyne wealth and [his]145-boyne health could not prevail . [His]145-boyne first idea seemed to be that it must be all a mistake — or [somebody else]1247-somebody else ’s damned negligence . As if [they]1248-they had forgotten to set the burglar alarm , or to order the motor , or to pay the fire - insurance , or to choke off a bore at the telephone , or , by some other unstopped fissure in the tight armour of [his]145-boyne wellbeing , had suddenly let tribulation in on [him]145-boyne . If [he]145-boyne could get at [the offender]444-the offender — if [he]145-boyne only could ! But it was the crux of [his]145-boyne misery that apparently [he]145-boyne could n’t — “ Not that [I]145-boyne blame [the child]2422-the child , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne said suddenly , looking down with an interrogative stare at [his]145-boyne heavy blond - haired hands , with [their]1248-they glossy nails and one broad gold ring with an uncut sapphire . [He]145-boyne raised [his]145-boyne eyes and examined [Boyne]145-boyne , who instantly felt [himself]145-boyne leaping to the guard of [his]145-boyne own face . “ That business of the money — [you]127-judith understand , [Judith]127-judith did n’t in the least realise ... ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne began . “ Oh , damn the money . ”[145-boyne] That question was swept away with a brush of the hand : [Boyne]145-boyne had noticed that the poor little letter of confession [he]145-boyne had extracted from [Judith]127-judith had received hardly a glance from [[her]127-judith father]2542-her father , who had pocketed the bank - notes as carelessly as if they were a gambling debt . Evidently the Lido Palace values were different . It was the hideous inconvenience of it all that was gnawing at [Wheater]127-judith — and also , to be fair to [him]145-boyne , a vague muddled distress about [[his]145-boyne children]1251-his children . “ [I]145-boyne did n’t know [the poor little chaps]3335-the poor little chaps cared so much , ”[145-boyne] was all this emotion wrung from [him]145-boyne ; none the less , [Boyne]145-boyne felt , it was sincere . “ [They]3335-the poor little chaps care most awfully for [each other]396-each other — and very much for [you]145-boyne and [Joyce]197-joyce . What [they]3335-the poor little chaps need beyond everything is [a home]3337-a home : [a home with [you]145-boyne two at its head]3338-a home with you two at its head . ”[145-boyne] “ Oh , damn , ”[127-judith] [Wheater]127-judith groaned again . It was as if [Boyne]145-boyne had proposed to [him]145-boyne to ascend [the throne of [England]41-england]1252-the throne of england . What was the use of dealing in impossibles ? There were things which even [his]145-boyne money could n’t buy — and when [you]1253-you stripped [him]145-boyne of the sense of its omnipotence [he]145-boyne squirmed like a snail out of its shell . “ Why ca n’t there not be rows ? ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne began again , perspiring with the oppression of [his]145-boyne helplessness . “ There would n’t be , if [you]145-boyne and [Joyce]197-joyce would only come to an understanding . ”[145-boyne] [The aggrieved husband]1254-the aggrieved husband met this derisively . “ [Joyce]197-joyce — and an understanding ! ”[145-boyne] “ Well — [she]197-joyce ’s awfully fond of [the children]505-the children ; and so are [you]145-boyne . And [they]505-the children ’re devoted to both of [you]145-boyne , all of [them]505-the children . Why ca n’t [you]145-boyne and [she]197-joyce agree to bury [your]145-boyne differences , and arrange [your]145-boyne lives so that [you]145-boyne can keep [the children]505-the children together , and give [them]505-the children something that looks like [a home]3337-a home , while [you]145-boyne both ... well , do whatever [you]145-boyne like ... privately .... ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne felt [his]145-boyne lips drying as [they]1255-they framed this arid proposal . [Wheater]127-judith leaned [his]145-boyne elbows on [his]145-boyne knees and gazed at the picture presented . “ [Joyce]197-joyce does n’t care to do what [she]197-joyce likes privately , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne replied , without irony . “ But [the children]505-the children — [I’m]127-judith sure [she]197-joyce does n’t want to part with [them]505-the children . ”[145-boyne] “ No ; and no more do [I.]145-boyne And what ’s more , [I]145-boyne wo n’t ! ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne brought down a clenched fist on the leather protuberance at [his]145-boyne elbow . It sank in soggily , as if the Lido armchair had been the symbol of [Joyce]197-joyce ’s sullen opposition . “ By [God]214-god , [I]127-judith can dictate [my]127-judith terms , ”[127-judith] [Wheater]127-judith pursued , sonorously but without conviction . [Boyne]145-boyne stood up with a sense of weariness . [His]145-boyne bones felt as stiff as if [he]145-boyne had been trying to hang on to a jagged rock above a precipice ; [his]145-boyne mind participated in their ache . “ Look here , [Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater , what ’s the use of threats ? Of course [you]120-mrs. wheater ’re all - powerful . Between [you]120-mrs. wheater , [Joyce]197-joyce and [you]120-mrs. wheater can easily destroy [these children]3343-these children ’s lives .... ”[127-judith] “ Oh , see here ! ”[127-judith] [Wheater]127-judith protested . “ Destroy [their]3343-these children lives . [They]505-the children need [you]145-boyne and [Joyce]197-joyce together : that ’s what [a home]3337-a home is made of — togetherness ... the mysterious atmosphere .... ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne broke off , nervously swallowing [his]145-boyne own eloquence . [Wheater]127-judith gave [him]145-boyne a helpless look . “ Have a drink ? ”[1256-he] [he]1256-he suggested . [He]1256-he waved [his]1256-he hand to [the white - coated guardians of [the lift]1241-the lift]1257-the white - coated guardians of the lift . [Boyne]145-boyne wondered that [he]1256-he did not brandish [his]1256-he handkerchief at the end of a stick . [The two men]1262-the two men drank in a desperate silence . [Capturing Joyce]197-joyce ’s attention was less easy . It was difficult even to secure [her]1263-she presence . Not that [she]1263-she avoided [[her]1263-she husband]411-her husband — on the contrary , [she]1263-she devoted all the time [she]1263-she could spare to arguing with [him]411-her husband about [their]1262-the two men future arrangements . And [she]1263-she had flung [herself]1263-she on [Boyne]145-boyne in an agony of apprehension about [the children]505-the children . But once assured of [their]505-the children safety [she]1263-she remarked that [their]505-the children going off like that had served [Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater right , and [she]1263-she hoped it would be a lesson to [him]411-her husband ; and thereupon hurried away to a pressing engagement on [the beach]1266-the beach , promising [Boyne]145-boyne to see [him]411-her husband when [she]1263-she came up to dress for dinner — anywhere between eight and nine . [She]1263-she supposed [Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater would look after [him]411-her husband in the interval ? It was nearer nine than eight when [Boyne]145-boyne finally waylaid [her]1263-she in [an upper corridor]1267-an upper corridor , on the way back to [[her]1263-she room]1214-her room . [She]1263-she relegated [him]411-her husband to [[her]1263-she sitting - room]1269-her sitting - room while [she]1263-she got out of [her]1263-she bathing tights , and presently reappeared swathed in perfumed draperies , with vivid eyes , tossed hair as young as [Judith]127-judith ’s , and the animating glow imparted by a new love - affair . [Boyne]145-boyne remembered [Terry]198-terry ’s phrase : “ With all the new ways [the doctors]2696-the doctors have of making [parents]2650-parents young again , ”[198-terry] and reflected that this oldest one of all was still the most effective . [She]1263-she threw [herself]1263-she down on [a lounge]1270-a lounge , clasped [her]1263-she arms behind [her]1263-she head , and declared : “ It was too clever of [Judith]127-judith to give [[her]127-judith father]2542-her father that scare . Now perhaps [he]2542-her father ’ll come to [his]2542-her father senses . ”[1263-she] Yes , [Boyne]145-boyne thought — [she]1263-she was going to be more difficult to convince than [Wheater]127-judith . “ What do [you]1263-she call coming to [his]2542-her father senses ? ”[1263-she] “ Why , giving all [the children]505-the children to [me]1263-she , of course — to [me]1263-she and [Gerald]198-terry . ”[1263-she] [Her]1263-she lids closed softly on the name . [Boyne]145-boyne was frightened by a reminder of [Judith]127-judith ’s way of caressing certain thoughts and images with [her]1263-she lashes . [Boyne]145-boyne remembered [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s wail at the approach of a standardised beauty . Here it was , in all its mechanical terror — endless and meaningless as the repetitions of a nightmare . [Every one of [the women in [the vast crowded restaurant]1297-the vast crowded restaurant]1296-the women in the vast crowded restaurant]1295-every one of the women in the vast crowded restaurant seemed to be of the same age , to be dressed by [the same dress - makers]1298-the same dress - makers , loved by [the same lovers]1299-the same lovers , adorned by [the same jewellers]1300-the same jewellers , and massaged and manipulated by [the same Beauty doctors]1301-the same beauty doctors . Afterward . ”[1084-his friend] Lunch was over ; [[the Duke]2416-the duke ’s tent]1331-the duke ’s tent had been visited ; and one by one [the crowd]1332-the crowd in [restaurant]1333-restaurant and [grill - room]1334-grill - room had dispersed for bathing or bridge . “ Why not here ? ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne suggested patiently to [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater . “ Here ? ”[1084-his friend] [She]1084-his friend paused under the lifted flap of [the stately Moroccan tent]1335-the stately moroccan tent , [her]1084-his friend astonishingly youthful figure outlined against the glitter of the sands . “ Why not ? ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne persisted . “ It ’s cool and quiet , and [nobody]2418-nobody is likely to bother [us]3400-us . Oh , out there — under [Syb]221-syb lullmer ’s umbrella , of course . _ [I]1084-his friend ’m _ perfectly willing , naturally — ”[1084-his friend] “ Very well ; [I]145-boyne ’ll go and recruit [him]145-boyne . ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne threaded [his]145-boyne way between the prone groups on [the beach]1266-the beach to where [Mrs. Lullmer]222-mrs. lullmer lay , under the shadow of a huge orange - coloured umbrella , with [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater outspread beside [her]222-mrs. lullmer like a raised map of [a mountainous country]1337-a mountainous country . “ [I]129-joyce say , [Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater , [Joyce]129-joyce is waiting for [you]120-mrs. wheater in [[the Duke]2416-the duke ’s tent]1331-the duke ’s tent — for [our]1338-our talk . ”[129-joyce] [Wheater]129-joyce raised a portion of [his]145-boyne great bulk on a languid elbow . “ What talk ? ... Oh , all right . ”[145-boyne] [His]145-boyne tone implied that , at the moment , it was distinctly all wrong ; but [he]145-boyne got slowly to [his]145-boyne feet , gave [himself]145-boyne a shake , lit a cigarette , and shambled away after [Boyne]145-boyne . At the tent door [Mrs. Lullmer]222-mrs. lullmer swiftly overtook [them]1338-our . “ [I]222-mrs. lullmer suppose [you]145-boyne do n’t mind — ”[222-mrs. lullmer] [she]222-mrs. lullmer smiled at [Joyce]129-joyce ; and [Wheater]129-joyce muttered , half to [[his]145-boyne wife]498-his wife and half to [Boyne]145-boyne : “ [She]129-joyce ’s had so much experience with [children]2617-children . ”[129-joyce] “ All [I]120-mrs. wheater want is what is best for [mine]120-mrs. wheater , ”[120-mrs. wheater] said [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater coldly ; adding , as [they]1338-our re - entered [the tent]1340-the tent : “ [Martin]193-martin , [you]193-martin ’ll find [Gerald]197-joyce somewhere about . Wo n’t [you]193-martin please tell [him]3404-him to come ? ”[120-mrs. wheater] [Wheater]120-mrs. wheater gave an angry shrug , and then settled down resignedly on one of the heaps of embroidered Moroccan cushions disposed about the interior of [the tent]1340-the tent . [Boyne]145-boyne ’s first inclination was to come back empty - handed from a simulated quest for [Ormerod]175-gerald ; but , reflecting that if [he]145-boyne did so [Joyce]197-joyce would seize on this as another pretext for postponement , [he]145-boyne presently returned accompanied by [the tutor]799-the tutor , in whose wake [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench trailed [her]183-lady wrench perfumed elegance . “ See here , [folks]3405-folks , [I]183-lady wrench guess if [anybody]2661-anybody ’s got a right to be [here]2434-here [I]183-lady wrench have , ”[183-lady wrench] [she]183-lady wrench announced with a regal suavity . “ That is , if [you]3405-folks ’re proposing to make plans about [[my]183-lady wrench child]2866-my child . ”[183-lady wrench] This argument seemed — even to [Boyne]145-boyne — incontrovertible ;
