That suit [you]145-boyne ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] BOOK III XVII On the afternoon of the fourth day [Boyne]145-boyne stood again in [the sitting - room of [the _ châlet _]911-the _ châlet _ facing [the Cristallo group]912-the cristallo group]1367-the sitting - room of the _ châlet _ facing the cristallo group . [He]145-boyne had wired to [Judith Wheater]127-judith : “ All right , do n’t worry ”[145-boyne] ; but to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars [he]145-boyne had made no sign . [He]145-boyne knew [she]163-mrs. sellars did not wholly approve of [his]145-boyne journey , though [she]163-mrs. sellars had made no unfavourable comment , and had even offered of [her]163-mrs. sellars own accord to keep an eye on the _ Pension Rosenglüh _ in [his]145-boyne absence . It was not necessary for [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars to formulate objections ; they were latent everywhere in [her]163-mrs. sellars delicate person , in the movements of [her]163-mrs. sellars slim apprehensive fingers , the guarded stir of [her]163-mrs. sellars lashes . But the sense of [their]1370-their lurking there , [vigilant guardians of the threshold]1371-vigilant guardians of the threshold , gave a peculiar quality to every token of [her]163-mrs. sellars approval . [Boyne]145-boyne told [himself]145-boyne that [she]163-mrs. sellars was not [a denier]1372-a denier , but [that rarer being]1373-that rarer being , [a chooser]1374-a chooser ; and [he]145-boyne was almost certain where [her]163-mrs. sellars choice would lie when all the facts were before [her]163-mrs. sellars . [She]163-mrs. sellars was out when [he]145-boyne reached the _ châlet _ , and [his]145-boyne conviction strengthened as [he]145-boyne sat awaiting [her]163-mrs. sellars . It drew its strength from the very atmosphere of [the place]601-the place — its self - sufficing harmony . “ _ Willkommen , [suesser Daemmerschein]232-suesser daemmerschein ! _ ”[145-boyne] [His]145-boyne apostrophe took in the mighty landscape which overhung [him]145-boyne ; the sense of peace flowed in on [him]145-boyne from those great fastnesses of sun and solitude , with which [the little low - ceilinged room]1376-the little low - ceilinged room , [its]1376-the little low - ceilinged room books and flowers , the bit of needle - work in the armchair , the half - written letter on the desk , had the humble kinship of quietness and continuity . “ [I]145-boyne ’d forgotten that anything had any meaning , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne thought to [himself]145-boyne as [he]145-boyne let the spell of [the place]601-the place weave its noiseless net about [him]145-boyne . “ [Martin]193-martin — but how tired [you]193-martin look ! ”[163-mrs. sellars] [She]163-mrs. sellars was on the threshold , [their]1378-their hands and lips together . [He]145-boyne remembered that kiss afterward .... [She]163-mrs. sellars lingered close , [her]163-mrs. sellars arms on [his]145-boyne shoulders . “ [I]163-mrs. sellars did n’t even know [you]193-martin ’d got back . ”[163-mrs. sellars] There was the faintest shadow of reproach in [her]163-mrs. sellars tone . “ [I]145-boyne did n’t know till the last minute when [I]145-boyne could get away — [I]145-boyne just jumped into [the first train]3472-the first train , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne explained . [He]145-boyne was conscious of the weariness in [his]145-boyne voice . [He]145-boyne passed [his]145-boyne hand over [his]145-boyne eyes as though to see if it would brush away [her]163-mrs. sellars image , or if there were still women like [her]163-mrs. sellars in [the world]307-the world , all made of light and reason . “ [Dear]2469-dear ! ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne said , more to [himself]145-boyne than [her]163-mrs. sellars . “ [You]163-mrs. sellars ’ve failed ? ”[145-boyne] [Her]163-mrs. sellars eyes were full of an unmixed sympathy ; there was nothing in them to remind [him]145-boyne that [they]1380-they had foreseen [his]145-boyne failure . “ No , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne exclaimed , “ [I]145-boyne ’ve succeeded ! ”[145-boyne] “ Oh—. ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne fancied [he]145-boyne detected a hint of flatness in the rejoinder ; there are occasions , [he]145-boyne knew , when one has to resign [oneself]1381-oneself to the hearing of good news . But no ; [he]145-boyne was unfair . It was not that , it was only the echo of [his]145-boyne own fatigue . For , as [she]163-mrs. sellars said , [he]145-boyne was tired — thoroughly tired .... [She]163-mrs. sellars continued , with a faint smile : “ [You]145-boyne do n’t look like somebody who has succeeded . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [I]163-mrs. sellars daresay not . [I]163-mrs. sellars feel rather like one of [the fellows [they]3474-the fellows they let down into a disused well let down into [a disused well]3475-a disused well]3474-the fellows they let down into a disused well , and haul up half - asphyxiated .... ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ It was — asphyxiating ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ Some of it ; most of it . But [I]163-mrs. sellars ’m coming to . And [I]163-mrs. sellars ’ve got what [I]163-mrs. sellars wanted . ”[163-mrs. sellars] [He]145-boyne returned [her]163-mrs. sellars smile , and sat down beside [her]163-mrs. sellars . “ How wonderful ! [You]163-mrs. sellars mean to say [you]163-mrs. sellars ’ve reconciled [the Wheaters]707-the wheaters ? ”[145-boyne] “ [I]163-mrs. sellars ’ve reconciled [them]707-the wheaters to the idea of not separating [the children]505-the children — for the present , at any rate . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ Oh , [Martin]193-martin — splendid ! ”[145-boyne] [She]163-mrs. sellars was really warming to the subject now . [Her]163-mrs. sellars face glowed with a delicate appreciation . “ It will do [Terry]198-terry more good than all the Alps and [Dolomites]17-the dolomites piled on top of one another . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ Yes ; and [Judith]127-judith too , incidentally . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne had no intention of not including [Judith]127-judith in [his]145-boyne victory . “ Of course ; but [Judith]127-judith ’s [a young lady who is eminently capable of fighting [her]127-judith own battles]3478-a young lady who is eminently capable of fighting her own battles , ”[163-mrs. sellars] [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars smoothly rejoined . “ [She]127-judith ought to be — [she]127-judith ’s had to fight [everybody else]3479-everybody else ’s . ”[163-mrs. sellars] [He]145-boyne leaned [his]145-boyne head against the back of [his]145-boyne armchair , and wondered what had become of the glow with which [he]145-boyne had entered [the room]1180-the room . It had vanished instantly under the cool touch of [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s allusion to [Judith]127-judith . [He]145-boyne had succeeded , it was true : there could be no doubt that [he]145-boyne had succeeded . The mere fact of gaining time was nine tenths of the battle ; and that [he]145-boyne had already achieved . But already , too , [he]145-boyne was beginning to wonder how [he]145-boyne was to fit [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars into the picture of [his]145-boyne success . It was curious : when [they]1383-they were apart it was always [her]162-rose sellars courage and [her]162-rose sellars ardour that [he]145-boyne felt ; as soon as [they]1383-they came together again [she]162-rose sellars seemed hemmed in by little restrictions and inhibitions . “ Do tell [me]162-rose sellars just what happened , ”[162-rose sellars] [she]162-rose sellars said . “ Well — at the very last minute [they]3480-they decided to make [me]162-rose sellars , [informally]3481-informally , into [[the children]505-the children ’s guardian]3483-the children ’s guardian : a sort of trial - guardian , [you]3484-you might call it . ”[162-rose sellars] “ A trial - guardian ? ”[162-rose sellars] [Her]162-rose sellars intonation , and the laugh that followed it , lifted the term into the region of the absurd . “ What a jolly thing to be [a trial - guardian]3485-a trial - guardian ! ”[162-rose sellars] “ Well , [I]145-boyne ’m not so sure . ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne faced [her]162-rose sellars irritably . “ It ’s not a joke , [you]162-rose sellars know . ”[145-boyne] “ [I]162-rose sellars sha n’t know what it is till [you]162-rose sellars explain . ”[162-rose sellars] Explain — explain ! Yes ; [he]145-boyne knew now that the explaining was just what [he]145-boyne was dodging away from . To [Judith]127-judith and [Terry]198-terry no explanations would be necessary . [He]145-boyne would only have to say : “ It ’s all right , ”[145-boyne] and be smothered in hugs and jubilations . [Those two]1384-those two would never think of asking for reasons — life had not accustomed [them]1384-those two to expect any . But here sat [lovely Logic]233-lovely logic , [her]162-rose sellars long hands clasped attentively — “ Oh , by [Jove]119-jove ! ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne exclaimed , clapping [his]145-boyne own hands first on one pocket , then on another . “ Here ’s something [I]145-boyne got for [you]162-rose sellars in [Venice]8-venice . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne drew forth a small parcel , stringless and shapeless , as parcels generally seemed to be when [they]1385-they emerged from [his]145-boyne pockets , unwrapped the paper , and pressed the catch of a morocco box . The lid flew open , and revealed a curious crystal pendant in a network of worn enamel . “ Oh , the lovely thing ! For [me]145-boyne ? ”[145-boyne] “ Oh , no ; not that , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne stammered . [He]145-boyne jerked the trinket back , wrapped the box up , and pushed it into [his]145-boyne pocket with the exasperated sense of blushing like [a boy]1386-a boy over [his]145-boyne blunder . “ But , [Martin]193-martin — ”[145-boyne] “ Here—. ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne delved deeper , pulled out another parcel , in wrappings equally untidy , and took up one of the long hands lying on [her]162-rose sellars knee . “ This is for [you]162-rose sellars . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne slipped on [her]162-rose sellars fourth finger a sapphire set in diamonds . [She]162-rose sellars lowered [her]162-rose sellars lids on it in gentle admiration . “ It ’s much too beautiful , ”[162-rose sellars] [her]162-rose sellars lips protested . Then [her]162-rose sellars mockery sparkled up at [him]145-boyne . “ Only , [you]145-boyne ’ve put it on the wrong hand — at least , if it ’s meant for [our]3486-our engagement . ”[162-rose sellars] “ Looks as if it were , does n’t it ? ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne bantered back ; but inwardly [he]145-boyne was thinking : “ Yes , that ’s just the trouble — it looks like the engagement ring [any other fellow]3487-any other fellow would have given to [any other woman]3488-any other woman . Nothing in [the world]307-the world to do with [her]3488-any other woman and [me]145-boyne . ”[145-boyne] Aloud [he]145-boyne said : “ [I]145-boyne had n’t time to find what [I]145-boyne wanted — ”[145-boyne] and then realised that this was hardly a way of bettering [his]145-boyne case . “ [I]145-boyne wanted something so awfully different for [you]162-rose sellars , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne blundered on . “ Well , [your]145-boyne wanting that makes it different — to [me]162-rose sellars , ”[162-rose sellars] [she]162-rose sellars said ; and added , more tepidly : “ Besides , it ’s lovely . ”[162-rose sellars] [She]162-rose sellars held out [her]162-rose sellars left hand , and [he]145-boyne slipped the jewel on the proper finger . “ It ’s rotten , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne grumbled . The ring had cost [him]145-boyne more than [he]145-boyne could afford , it had failed to please [her]162-rose sellars , [he]145-boyne saw [himself]145-boyne that it was utterly commonplace — and saw also that [she]162-rose sellars would never forgive [him]145-boyne for pocketing the trinket [he]145-boyne had first produced , which was nothing in itself , but had struck [her]162-rose sellars fancy as soon as [she]162-rose sellars knew it was not meant for [her]162-rose sellars . Should [he]145-boyne pull it out again , and ask [her]162-rose sellars to accept it ? No ; after what had passed that was impossible . [Judith Wheater]127-judith , if [he]145-boyne had been trying an engagement ring on [her]162-rose sellars finger ( preposterous fancy ! ) would have blurted out at once that [she]162-rose sellars preferred the trinket [he]145-boyne had shoved back into [his]145-boyne pocket . But such tactlessness was unthinkable in [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars . Not for [the world]307-the world , [he]145-boyne knew , would [she]162-rose sellars have let [him]145-boyne guess that [she]162-rose sellars had given the other ornament a thought . [She]162-rose sellars sat turning [her]162-rose sellars hand from side to side and diligently admiring the ring . “ And now — do tell [me]162-rose sellars just what happened . ”[162-rose sellars] “ Well — first , of course , a lot of talk . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne settled [himself]145-boyne in [his]145-boyne chair , and tried to take up the narrative . But wherever [he]145-boyne grasped it , the awkward thing seemed to tumble out of [his]145-boyne hold , as if , in that respect too , [he]145-boyne were always taking the wrong parcel out of [his]145-boyne pocket . To begin with , it was so difficult to explain to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars that , after [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters had been reassured as to the safety and wellbeing of [the children]505-the children , the negotiations had been carried on piecemeal , desultorily , parenthetically , between swims and sun - baths , cocktails and foxtrots , poker and baccara — and , as a rule , in the presence of all the conflicting interests . To make [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars understand that [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench , [[her]183-lady wrench husband]411-her husband and [Gerald Ormerod]175-gerald had assisted at the debates as a matter of course was in itself a laborious business ; to convey to [her]162-rose sellars that [Mrs. Lullmer]222-mrs. lullmer — still notorious as [the former Mrs. Westway]218-charlie westway — had likewise been called upon to participate , as [[Joyce]129-joyce ’s possible successor]1390-joyce ’s possible successor , was to place too heavy a strain on [her]162-rose sellars imagination . [Her]162-rose sellars exquisite aloofness had kept [her]162-rose sellars in genuine ignorance of the compromises and promiscuities of modern life , and left on [her]162-rose sellars hands the picture of a vanished world wherein [you]1391-you did n’t speak to [people who were discredited , or admit [rivals]1393-rivals or [enemies]1394-enemies to [your]1391-you confidence]1392-people who were discredited , or admit rivals or enemies to your confidence ; and [she]162-rose sellars punctuated [Boyne]145-boyne ’s narrative with murmurs of dismay and incredulity . “ But in [that crowd]3490-that crowd , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne explained , “ [no man]3491-no man is [[another man]3492-another man ’s enemy]3493-another man ’s enemy for more than a few minutes , and [no woman]3494-no woman is [[any other woman]3488-any other woman ’s rival]3496-any other woman ’s rival . Either [they]3497-they forget [they]3497-they ’ve quarrelled , or some social necessity — usually a party that none of [them]3497-they can bear to miss — forces [them]3497-they together , and makes it easier to bury [their]3497-they differences . But generally it ’s a simple case of forgetting . [Their]3497-they memories are as short as a savage ’s , and the feuds that [savages]3498-savages remember have dropped out . [They]3497-they recall only the other primitive needs — food , finery , dancing . [I]145-boyne suppose [we]1396-they _ are _ relapsing into a kind of bloodless savagery , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne concluded . Besides , [he]145-boyne went on , in [the Wheater]1395-the wheater set [they]1396-they could deal with things only collectively ; alone , [they]1396-they became helpless and inarticulate . [They]1396-they lived so perpetually in the lime - light that [they]1396-they required [an audience]1397-an audience — [an audience made up of [their]1396-they own kind]1398-an audience made up of their own kind . Before [each other]396-each other [they]1396-they shouted and struck attitudes ; again like [savages]3498-savages . But the chief point was that [nobody]2418-nobody could stay angry — not however much [they]1396-they tried . It was too much trouble , and might involve too many inconveniences , interfere with too many social arrangements . When all was said and done , all [they]1396-they asked was not to be bothered — and it was by gambling on that requirement that [he]145-boyne had finally gained [his]145-boyne point . “ And [your]145-boyne point is , exactly — ”[145-boyne] Well , as [he]145-boyne got closer to it , [Boyne]145-boyne was not even sure that it could be defined as a point . It was too shapeless and undecided ; but [he]145-boyne hoped it would serve for a time — and time was everything ; especially for [Terry]198-terry .... “ [They]1396-they ’ve agreed to leave [the children]505-the children together , and to leave [them]505-the children [here]2434-here , for the next three or four months . The longest to bring round was [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench . [[Her]183-lady wrench husband]411-her husband has taken a fancy to [Zinnie]133-zinnie , and [he]411-her husband ’s so mortally bored by life in general that [[his]411-her husband wife]498-his wife clutches at anything that may amuse [him]411-her husband . Luckily , according to the terms of the divorce — ”[198-terry] “ Which divorce ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars interpolated , as though genuinely anxious to keep [her]163-mrs. sellars hand on all the clues . “ [Wheater]133-zinnie _ versus _ [Zinnia Lacrosse]143-zinnia . But of course [my]163-mrs. sellars battle royal was over [Chipstone]142-chipstone ; if [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters had insisted on keeping [Chipstone]142-chipstone till [their]130-the wheaters own affairs were settled in court the whole combination would have been broken up . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ And how did [you]163-mrs. sellars contrive to rescue [Chipstone]142-chipstone ? ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne sank down more deeply into [his]145-boyne armchair , and looked up at the low ceiling . That ’s [my]145-boyne trial - guardianship . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne gave a slight laugh , which [she]163-mrs. sellars failed to echo . “ [Martin]193-martin ! ”[145-boyne] [His]145-boyne eyes continued to challenge [hers]163-mrs. sellars . “ Well — ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] [She]163-mrs. sellars turned the sapphire hesitatingly on [her]163-mrs. sellars finger . “ But [these children]3343-these children — [you’d]145-boyne never even heard of [them]3343-these children till [you]145-boyne met [them]3343-these children on board [[your]145-boyne steamer]3508-your steamer a few weeks ago .... ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ No ; that ’s true . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [You]145-boyne ’ve taken over a pretty big responsibility . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [I]163-mrs. sellars like responsibilities . ”[163-mrs. sellars] [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars was still brooding over [her]163-mrs. sellars newly imprisoned finger . “ It ’s very generous of [you]145-boyne to assume [this one]3006-this one in such a hurry . Usually one does n’t have to go out of one ’s way to find rather more of [them]3343-these children than [one]2514-one can manage . But in this case , [I]163-mrs. sellars wonder — ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [You]163-mrs. sellars wonder ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ Well , [I]163-mrs. sellars had understood from [Terry]198-terry — and also from [[your]145-boyne friend]2832-your friend [Judith]127-judith — that what all [the children]505-the children really want is to go to [America]2-america : to [[Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s mother]3513-mrs. wheater ’s mother , is n’t it ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ Yes ; that ’s it ; and [I]163-mrs. sellars hope [they]505-the children ’ll pull it off by - and - by . But of course it ’s merely provisional . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ Happily , ”[163-mrs. sellars] [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars smiled ; and added , as if to correct the slight acerbity of the comment : “ For [you]163-mrs. sellars must see , [dear]2469-dear , that [you]163-mrs. sellars ’re taking a considerable risk for the future — ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ What future ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ Why — suppose anything goes wrong during these next few months ? With [seven children]2948-seven children — and [one of [them]2948-seven children already grown up]3520-one of them already grown up ! ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne frowned , and stirred uneasily in [his]145-boyne chair . “ If [you]163-mrs. sellars mean [Judith]127-judith , in some ways [she]127-judith ’s as much of [a child]435-a child as [the youngest of [them]2948-seven children]3522-the youngest of them . ”[145-boyne] [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars smiled confidentially at [her]163-mrs. sellars ring . “ So [a man]308-a man would think , [I]163-mrs. sellars suppose . [She]127-judith ’s [a young lady with very definite views]3524-a young lady with very definite views . ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [I]163-mrs. sellars should hope so ! ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [I]145-boyne agree with [you]163-mrs. sellars that it makes [her]127-judith more interesting — but conceivably it might lead to complications . ”[145-boyne] “ What sort of complications ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [You]163-mrs. sellars ought to know better than [I]163-mrs. sellars do — since [you]163-mrs. sellars tell [me]163-mrs. sellars [you]163-mrs. sellars ’ve been frequenting the late [Mrs. Westway]218-charlie westway at [the Lido]57-the lido . [Judith]127-judith does n’t pretend to hide the fact that [she]127-judith lived for a summer in the bosom of [that edifying family]3525-that edifying family .... ”[163-mrs. sellars] “ [She]127-judith does n’t know it ’s anything to hide . That ’s what ’s so touching — ”[145-boyne] “ And so terrifying . But [I]1402-she wo n’t sit here preaching prudence ; [you]163-mrs. sellars ’d only hate [me]1402-she for it . And all this time [those poor infants]3526-those poor infants are waiting . ”[1402-she] [She]1402-she stood up with one of [her]1402-she sudden changes of look and tone ; as if a cloud had parted , shedding a ray of [her]1402-she lost youth on [her]1402-she . [He]1403-you noticed for the first time that [she]1402-she was all in white , a rose on [her]1402-she breast , and a shady hat hanging from [her]1402-she arm . “ Do go down and see [them]3526-those poor infants at once , [dear]2469-dear . It ’s getting late . [I]1403-you ’ll walk with [you]1403-you to [the foot of [the hill]3071-the hill]3528-the foot of the hill ; then [I]1403-you must come back and write some letters .... ”[1403-you] [He]1403-you smiled at the familiar formula , and [she]1402-she took up [his]1403-you smile . “ Yes ; really important letters — one of them to [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia , ”[1402-she] [she]1402-she bantered back . “ And besides , [the children]505-the children will want to have [you]1403-you all to [themselves]505-the children . ”[1402-she] Magnanimously [she]1402-she added : “ [I]1402-she must say [they]505-the children all behaved beautifully while [you]1403-you were away . [They]505-the children seemed to feel that [they]505-the children must do [you]1403-you credit . And as for [Terry]198-terry — [I]1402-she wish [he]198-terry were [mine]1402-she ! When the break up comes , as of course it will , why should n’t [you]1403-you and [I]1402-she adopt [him]198-terry ? ”[1402-she] [She]1402-she put on [her]1402-she hat , and linked [her]1402-she arm in [Boyne]145-boyne ’s for the walk down [the hill]3071-the hill ; but at the fringe of [the wood]1405-the wood , where the path dipped to [the high road]1406-the high road , [she]1402-she left [him]145-boyne . “ [You]145-boyne ’ll come back and dine ? [I]1402-she ’ve got some news for [you]145-boyne too , ”[1402-she] [she]1402-she said as [he]145-boyne turned down to [the village]1081-the village . XVIII Recent memories of [Armistice Day]234-armistice day — remote ones of [Mafeking]77-mafeking Night , which [he]145-boyne had chanced to experience in [London]78-london — paled for [Boyne]145-boyne in the uproar raised by [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters when , entering [[their]788-the little wheaters pension dining - room]1409-their pension dining - room , [he]145-boyne told [them]788-the little wheaters that everything was all right . [He]145-boyne had not imagined that seven could be so many . The miracle of the loaves and fishes seemed as nothing to the sudden multiplication of arms , legs and lungs about that rural supper - table . At one end of the expanse of coarse linen and stout crockery , [Miss Scope]147-miss scope , rigid and spectacled , sat dispensing jam without fear or favour ; at the other [Judith]127-judith was cutting bread and butter in complete unawareness of [her]127-judith immortal model . Between the two surged a sea of small heads , dusky , ruddy , silver - pale , all tossing and mixing about the golden crest of [Chipstone]142-chipstone , throned in [his]145-boyne umpire ’s chair . For a moment , as usual , [Bun]135-bun and [Zinnie]133-zinnie dominated the scene ; then [Terry]198-terry , still pale , but with new life in [his]198-terry eyes , caught [his]198-terry cap from the rack with a call for three cheers to which [the others]2515-the others improvised a piercing echo . ( “ Luckily [we]1414-their ’re [the only boarders]3531-the only boarders just now , ”[147-miss scope] [Miss Scope]147-miss scope remarked to [Boyne]145-boyne as [he]145-boyne pressed [her]147-miss scope hand . ) In [this wonderful world]1411-this wonderful world [nobody]2418-nobody asked any questions ; [nobody]2418-nobody seemed to care for any particulars ; [their]1414-their one thought was to bestow on [[their]1414-their ambassador]1415-their ambassador the readiest token of [their]1414-their gratitude , from [Blanca]128-blanca ’s cool kiss to the damp and strangulating endearments of [Beechy]154-beechy . To [Boyne]145-boyne it was literally like a dip into [a quick sea]1416-a quick sea , with waves that burnt [his]145-boyne eyes , choked [his]145-boyne throat and ears , but stung [him]145-boyne , body and brain , to fresh activity . “ And now let ’s kiss [him]1415-their ambassador all over again — and it ’s [my]133-zinnie turn first ! ”[133-zinnie] [Zinnie]133-zinnie rapturously proposed ; and as [he]145-boyne abandoned [himself]145-boyne once more to the battering of the breakers [he]145-boyne caught a small voice piping : “ [We]3532-we suppose [you]145-boyne ’ve brought some presents for [us]3532-we , [Martin]193-martin . ”[1419-persons of their own age and experience] The law which makes [men]2842-men progressively repeople [the world]307-the world with [persons of [their]2842-men own age and experience]1419-persons of their own age and experience had led [Boyne]145-boyne , as [he]145-boyne grew older , to regard human relations as more and more ruled by reason ; but whenever [he]145-boyne dipped into the universe of [the infant Wheaters , where all perspective ceased]1420-the infant wheaters , where all perspective ceased , and it was far more urgent to know what presents [he]145-boyne had brought than what fate had been meted out to [them]1421-them by [[their]1421-them respective parents]1422-their respective parents , [he]145-boyne felt the joy of plunging back into reality . The presents were there , and [nobody]2418-nobody had been forgotten , as the rapid unpacking of a small suit - case showed — [nobody]2418-nobody , that is , but [Judith]127-judith , who stood slightly apart , affecting an air of grown - up amusement , while [Blanca]128-blanca and [the little girls]1425-the little girls were hung with trinkets , and [Bun]135-bun made jubilant by an electric lamp . Even [Miss Scope]147-miss scope had an appropriate reticule , [Nanny]156-nanny a lavishly garnished needle - case ; and the bottom of the box was crammed with books for [Terry]198-terry . The distributing took so long , and the ensuing disputes and counter - claims were so difficult of adjustment , that twilight was slipping down [the valley]931-the valley when [Boyne]145-boyne said to [Judith]127-judith : “ Come and take a turn , and [I]145-boyne ’ll tell [you]127-judith all about it . ”[145-boyne] [They]1427-we walked along [the road]1077-the road to a path which led up [the hillside opposite to [the hotels]3173-the hotels]1429-the hillside opposite to the hotels , and from there began to mount slowly toward the receding sunlight . [Judith]127-judith , unasked , had slipped [her]127-judith arm through [Boyne]145-boyne ’s , and the nearness of [her]127-judith light young body was like wings to [him]145-boyne . “ What a pity it ’s getting dark — [I]145-boyne believe [I]145-boyne could climb to one of [those ruby peaks]3533-those ruby peaks ! ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne said , throwing [his]145-boyne head back with a deep breath ; and [she]127-judith instantly rejoined : “ Let ’s run back and get [Bun]135-bun ’s lamp ; then [we]1427-we could . ”[127-judith] [Boyne]145-boyne laughed , and went on , in a voice of leisurely satisfaction : “ Oh , [Bun]135-bun would n’t part with that lamp — not yet . Besides , [we]1427-we ’re very well as [we]1427-we are ; and there ’ll be lots of other opportunities . ”[145-boyne] “ There will ? Oh , [Martin]193-martin — [they’re]3534-they’re really going to let [us]1427-we stay ? ”[127-judith] [Her]127-judith strong young hands imprisoned [him]145-boyne in a passionate grasp . “ Well , for a time . [I]127-judith made [them]3534-they’re see it was [Terry]198-terry ’s best chance . ”[127-judith] “ Of course it is ! And , [Martin]193-martin — they’ll leave [us]1427-we all together ? [Chip]123-chip and all ? ”[145-boyne] “ [Every man of [you]193-martin]3535-every man of you — for the summer , at any rate . ”[1431-you] [They]1431-you had stopped in the fern - fringed path , and [he]145-boyne stood above [her]127-judith , smiling down into [her]127-judith blissful incredulous eyes . “ There ’s one condition , though — ”[145-boyne] [Her]127-judith gaze darkened , and [he]145-boyne added : “ [You]1431-you ’re all to be accountable to [me]145-boyne . [I]145-boyne ’ve promised [[your]1431-you people]2657-your people to keep an eye on [you]1431-you . ”[145-boyne] “ [You]145-boyne mean [you]145-boyne ’re going to stay here with [us]1432-us ? ”[127-judith] [Her]127-judith lips trembled with the tears [she]127-judith was struggling to keep back , and [he]145-boyne thought to [himself]145-boyne : “ It ’s too much for [a child]435-a child ’s face to express—. ”[145-boyne] Aloud [he]145-boyne said : “ Let ’s sit down and watch the sunset . This tree - trunk is a pretty good proscenium box . ”[145-boyne] [They]1432-us sat down , and [he]145-boyne set forth at length the history of [his]145-boyne negotiations . Complicated as the narrative was , it was easier to relate to [[his]145-boyne present hearer]1433-his present hearer than to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , not only because fewer elucidations were necessary , but because none of the details [he]145-boyne gave shocked or astonished [Judith]127-judith . The tale [he]145-boyne told evidently seemed to [her]127-judith a mere bald statement of a matter - of - course affair , and [she]127-judith was too much occupied with its practical results to give a thought to its remoter bearings . [She]127-judith listened attentively to [Boyne]145-boyne ’s report of the final agreement , and when [he]145-boyne had ended , said only : “ [I]145-boyne suppose [father]2441-father ’s made some arrangement about paying [our]1432-us bills ? ”[145-boyne] “ [[Your]127-judith father]2435-your father ’s opened an account for [me]127-judith : [Miss Scope]147-miss scope and [I]127-judith are to be [[your]127-judith ministers of finance]3540-your ministers of finance . ”[127-judith] [She]127-judith received this in silence ; for the first time since [his]145-boyne return [he]145-boyne felt that the news [he]145-boyne brought was still overshadowed for [her]127-judith . At last [she]127-judith asked : “ Was [father]2441-father awfully angry ... [you]145-boyne know ... about that money ? ”[127-judith] The question roused [Boyne]145-boyne with a start . [He]145-boyne perceived that in [his]145-boyne struggle to adjust conflicting interests [he]145-boyne too had lost sight of the moral issue . And how confess to [Judith]127-judith that , as for [[her]127-judith father]2542-her father , [he]145-boyne had hardly been aware of it ? [He]145-boyne felt that it was a moment for prevarication . “ Of course [[your]145-boyne father]2435-your father was angry — thoroughly angry — about the whole thing . [Anybody]2661-anybody would have been . ”[127-judith] [She]127-judith lowered [her]127-judith voice to insist : “ But [I]127-judith mean about [my]127-judith taking [his]2435-your father money ? ”[127-judith] “ Well , [he]2435-your father ’s forgiven [you]145-boyne for that , at any rate . ”[127-judith] “ Has [he]2435-your father — really and truly ? ”[127-judith] [Her]127-judith voice lifted again joyfully . “ [Terry]198-terry was sure [he]2435-your father never would . ”[127-judith] [Boyne]145-boyne turned about on [her]127-judith in surprise . “ [Terry]198-terry — then [you]145-boyne told [him]2435-your father after all ? ”[127-judith] [She]127-judith made a mute sign of assent . “ [I]127-judith had to . ”[127-judith] “ Well , [I]145-boyne understand that . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne gave [her]127-judith hand a little squeeze . “ [I]145-boyne ’m glad [you]145-boyne did . ”[145-boyne] “ [He]2435-your father was frightfully upset , [you]145-boyne know . And furious with [me]127-judith . [I]127-judith was afraid [I]127-judith ’d made [him]2435-your father more ill . [He]2435-your father would n’t believe [me]127-judith at first . [He]2435-your father said if [I]127-judith had no more moral sense than that , the first thing [I]127-judith knew [I]127-judith ’d land in [prison]3544-prison . ”[127-judith] “ Oh—. ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne could not restrain a faint laugh . “ That did n’t worry [me]127-judith very much , though , ”[127-judith] [Judith]127-judith confessed in a more cheerful tone , “ because [I]127-judith ’ve seen a good deal more of life than [Terry]198-terry , and [I]127-judith ’ve known [other girls who ’ve done what [I]127-judith did]3545-other girls who ’ve done what i did , and none of [them]3545-other girls who ’ve done what i did ever went to [prison]3544-prison . ”[127-judith] This did not seem as reassuring to [Boyne]145-boyne as it did to [the speaker]1435-the speaker ; but the hour for severity was over , the words of rebuke died on [his]145-boyne lips . At last [he]145-boyne said : “ The worst of it was hurting [Terry]198-terry , was n’t it ? ”[145-boyne] and [she]127-judith nodded : “ Yes . ”[127-judith] For a while after that [they]1436-they sat without speaking , till [she]127-judith asked [him]145-boyne if [he]145-boyne thought [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters had already started divorce proceedings . To this [he]145-boyne could only answer that it looked so , but [he]145-boyne still hoped [they]1436-they might calm down and think better of it . [She]127-judith received this with a gesture of incredulity , and merely remarked : “ There might have been a chance if [Syb Lullmer]221-syb lullmer had n’t been mixed up in it . ”[127-judith] “ [I]145-boyne do wish [you]127-judith would n’t call [that woman]3547-that woman by [her]3547-that woman Christian name , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne interrupted . [Judith]127-judith looked at [him]145-boyne with a gentle wonder . “ [She]3547-that woman would n’t mind . [Everybody else]3479-everybody else does . ”[127-judith] [She]127-judith clearly assumed that [he]145-boyne was reproving [her]127-judith for failing in respect to [Mrs. Lullmer]222-mrs. lullmer . “ That ’s not what [I]145-boyne meant . But [she]3547-that woman ’s such a beast . ”[145-boyne] “ Oh , well—. ”[127-judith] [Judith]127-judith ’s shrug implied that the epithet was too familiar to [her]127-judith to have kept more than a tinge of obloquy . “ [I]127-judith rather hope [she]3547-that woman wo n’t marry [father]2441-father , though . ”[127-judith] “ [I]127-judith hope to [God]214-god [she]3547-that woman wo n’t . What [I]127-judith ’m gambling on is that [he]2441-father and [[your]127-judith mother]2712-your mother will get so homesick for [[you]127-judith children]3189-you children that [they]3189-you children ’ll patch things up on [your]127-judith account . ”[127-judith] [Her]127-judith smile kept its soft incredulity . “ [They]3189-you children do n’t often , [you]127-judith know ; [parents]2650-parents do n’t . ”[127-judith] “ Well , anyhow , [you]127-judith ’ve got a reprieve , and [you]127-judith must make the most of it . ”[127-judith] “ [I]127-judith wish [you]127-judith ’d say ‘ [we]3553-we , ’ not ‘ [you]127-judith , ’ [Martin]193-martin . ”[127-judith] “ Why of course it ’s ‘ [we]3553-we , ’ [[my]1437-my dear]2807-my dear — that is , as long as [you]1437-my all behave [yourselves]1437-my . ”[1437-my] [They]1437-my both laughed at this , and then fell silent , facing the sunset , and immersed , in [their]1437-my different ways , in the overwhelming glory of the spectacle . [Judith]127-judith , [Boyne]145-boyne knew , did not feel sunsets as [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars did — they appealed to a different order of associations , and [she]127-judith would probably have been put to it to distinguish the quality of their splendour from that of fireworks at [the Lido]1142-the lido , or a brilliant _ finale _ at [the Russian ballet]1439-the russian ballet . But something of the celestial radiance seemed to reach [her]127-judith , remote yet enfolding as a guardian wing . “ It ’s lovely here , ”[127-judith] [she]127-judith breathed , [her]127-judith hand in [Boyne]145-boyne ’s . [He]145-boyne remembered , at a similar moment , [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ’s quoting : _ [All the peaks]1440-all the peaks soar , but one the rest excels ; [Clouds]79-clouds overcome it ; No , yonder sparkle is [[the citadel]1441-the citadel ’s Circling [its]1441-the citadel summit]1442-the citadel ’s circling its summit — _ and [he]145-boyne murmured the words half aloud . [Judith]127-judith ’s pressure tightened ardently on [his]145-boyne hand . “ Oh , [Martin]193-martin , how beautifully [you]193-martin do describe things ! The words [you]193-martin find are not like [anybody else]3315-anybody else ’s . [Terry]198-terry says [you]193-martin ought to be [a writer]3556-a writer . ”[127-judith] “ Well , in this case , unluckily , [somebody]2453-somebody found the words before [me]127-judith . ”[127-judith] “ Oh—. ”[127-judith] [Her]127-judith enthusiasm flagged . [She]127-judith hazarded : “ [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ? ”[127-judith] [He]145-boyne gave a little chuckle at [her]127-judith sharpness . “ In a way , yes — but , as a matter of fact , [Robert Browning]235-robert browning got ahead of both of [us]3558-us . ”[145-boyne] This seemed to give [her]127-judith a certain satisfaction . “ Then [she]235-robert browning just cribbed it from [him]145-boyne ? Is [he]145-boyne [another friend of [hers]235-robert browning]3559-another friend of hers ? ”[145-boyne] “ Yes ; and will be of [yours]127-judith some day , [I]145-boyne hope . [He]145-boyne died long before [you]127-judith were born ; but [you]127-judith ’ll find some of the best of [him]145-boyne in one of the books [I]145-boyne brought to [Terry]198-terry . ”[145-boyne] “ Oh , [he]145-boyne ’s just [an author]3560-an author , [you]1443-you mean , ”[127-judith] [she]127-judith murmured , as if the state were a strictly posthumous one . [Her]127-judith attention always had a tendency to wander at the mention of books , and [he]1443-you thought [she]127-judith was probably a little vexed at having been betrayed into a conversational slip ; but presently , with a return of [her]127-judith habitual buoyancy : “ [I]127-judith ’d rather hear [you]1443-you talk than [anybody who ’s dead]3561-anybody who ’s dead , ”[127-judith] [she]127-judith declared . “ All right ; [I]1443-you ’ll make it a rule to give [you]127-judith only [my]1443-you own vintage , ”[1443-you] [he]1443-you agreed , gazing out past [her]127-judith into the light . [They]1444-them continued to sit there in silence , the sea of night creeping softly up to [them]1444-them , till at length [they]1444-them were caught in its chill touch . [Boyne]145-boyne got reluctantly to [his]145-boyne feet . “ Come along , [child]2459-child . Time to go down , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne said . “ Oh , not down yet — up , up , up ! ”[145-boyne] [She]127-judith caught [his]145-boyne arm again , pulling [him]145-boyne with all [her]127-judith young strength along [the pine - scented steep]1445-the pine - scented steep to where the mystery of [the forest]946-the forest drew down to meet [them]1444-them . “ [I]127-judith want to climb and climb — don’t [you]145-boyne ? [I]127-judith want to stay up all night , as if [we]1444-them were coming [home]290-home at sunrise from a ball . It ’s like [a great ballroom]3564-a great ballroom over there , is n’t it , ”[127-judith] [she]127-judith cried , pointing to the west , “ with the lights pouring out of a million windows ? ”[127-judith] [Boyne]145-boyne laughed , and suffered [himself]145-boyne to be led onward . The air on [that height]1447-that height was as fresh as youth , and all about [them]1444-them were the secret scents that dew and twilight waken into life . [He]145-boyne knew that [he]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith ought to be turning [homeward]1448-homeward ; but , even if [she]127-judith had released [his]145-boyne captive arm , it was growing too dark to consult [his]145-boyne watch . Besides , [the wandering man in [him]145-boyne]1449-the wandering man in him , [the man used to mountains]1450-the man used to mountains , to long lonely tramps , to the hush and mystery of nights in the open , felt [himself]145-boyne in the toils of the old magic . It was no longer [Judith]127-judith drawing [him]145-boyne on , but the night itself beckoning [him]145-boyne to [fresh heights]1451-fresh heights . [The child at [his]145-boyne side]1452-the child at his side had travelled with [him]145-boyne into the beauty as far as [she]127-judith could go , and now [he]145-boyne needed nothing from [her]127-judith but the warmth of [her]127-judith nearness . [His]145-boyne highest moments had always been solitary .... [She]127-judith seemed to guess that there was nothing else to say , and [they]1453-they continued to mount [the hill]3071-the hill in silence . As [they]1453-they rose the air turned colder , the fires faded , and above [them]1453-they arched a steel - blue heaven starred with ruddy points which grew keen and white as darkness deepened . It was not till [they]1453-they passed out of [the fringes of [the forest]946-the forest]1455-the fringes of the forest to [an open crag above [the valley]931-the valley]1457-an open crag above the valley , and saw the village lights sprinkling [the black fields far below]1459-the black fields far below , that [Boyne]145-boyne unwillingly woke to the sense of time and place . “ Oh , by [Jove]119-jove — [you]127-judith must come ! ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne exclaimed , swinging round to guide [[his]145-boyne companion]1460-his companion down the ledge . [She]127-judith made no answer , but turned and followed [him]145-boyne along [the descending path]1461-the descending path . [He]145-boyne could feel that [she]127-judith was too tired and peaceful for reluctance . [She]127-judith moved beside [him]145-boyne like [a sleepy child bringing back an apronful of flowers from a happy holiday]1462-a sleepy child bringing back an apronful of flowers from a happy holiday ; and the fact of having reassured [her]127-judith so quickly awed [Boyne]145-boyne a little , as if [he]145-boyne had meddled with destiny . But it was pleasant , for once , to play [the god]1463-the god , and [he]145-boyne let [himself]145-boyne drift away into visions of a vague millennium where all [the grown people]1464-the grown people knew what [they]1464-the grown people wanted , and if ever it happened that [they]1464-the grown people did n’t , [the children]505-the children had the casting vote . By the time [they]1466-they reached [the _ pension _]880-the _ pension _ , and [Judith]127-judith had loosed [her]127-judith hold of [Boyne]145-boyne ’s arm , [he]145-boyne was afraid to look at [his]145-boyne watch , but pushed [her]127-judith through the gate with a quick goodnight — and then , a moment later , called to [her]127-judith in an imperious whisper . “ [Judith]127-judith ! ”[127-judith] [She]127-judith hurried back to the summons . “ Did [you]127-judith really think [I]127-judith had n’t brought [you]127-judith any present ? ”[127-judith] [She]127-judith gave an excited little laugh . “ N — no ; [I]127-judith really thought perhaps [you]127-judith had ; only — ”[127-judith] “ Only what ? ”[145-boyne] “ [I]145-boyne thought [you]127-judith ’d forgotten [some one else]3565-some one else ’s , and had imagined [I]145-boyne should n’t much mind [your]127-judith taking [mine]145-boyne , because [I]145-boyne ’m so much older than the others .... ”[145-boyne] “ Well , of course [I]145-boyne should have imagined that ; but here it is . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne pulled out the parcel [he]145-boyne had inadvertently produced in [[Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s sitting - room]1468-mrs. sellars ’s sitting - room , and [Judith]127-judith caught it to [her]127-judith with a gasp of pleasure . “ Oh , [Martin]193-martin — ”[127-judith] “ There ; own up that [you]127-judith ’d have been fearfully sold if [I]127-judith ’d forgotten [you]127-judith . ”[127-judith] [She]127-judith answered solemnly : “ If [you]127-judith ’d forgotten [me]127-judith [I]127-judith should have died of it . ”[127-judith] “ Well — run off with [you]127-judith ; [we]3566-we ’re hours late , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne admonished [her]127-judith . “ May n’t [I]145-boyne look at it before [you]127-judith go ? ”[145-boyne] “ [[You]127-judith baby]3567-you baby , how could [you]127-judith see in the dark ? Besides , [I]145-boyne tell [you]127-judith there ’s no time . ”[145-boyne] “ Not even time to kiss [you]145-boyne for it , [Martin]193-martin ? ”[145-boyne] “ No , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne cried , slamming the gate shut , and starting up [the hill]3071-the hill toward [[his]145-boyne hotel]925-his hotel at a run . When [they]1471-their started on [their]1471-their walk nothing had been farther from [Boyne]145-boyne ’s mind than this disposal of the crystal pendant , though it was for [Judith]127-judith that the trinket had been chosen . Since [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , owing to [his]145-boyne blunder , had seen and coveted it , [he]145-boyne felt a certain awkwardness about letting it appear on [Judith]127-judith ’s neck , and decided that [[his]145-boyne little friend]1472-his little friend must again be left out in the general distribution of presents . But during [their]1471-their walk in [the mountain]1033-the mountain dusk , while [she]127-judith hung on [his]145-boyne arm , pressed close by the intruding fir - branches , [he]145-boyne needed more and more to think of [her]127-judith as [a child]435-a child , and , thinking thus , to treat [her]127-judith as [one]2514-one . [He]145-boyne knew how [the child]2422-the child in [her]127-judith must have ached at being left out when [he]145-boyne unpacked [his]145-boyne gifts ; and when the time came to say goodnight it was irresistible to heal that ache . There was no way of doing it but to take the pendant from [his]145-boyne pocket — the pendant which [he]145-boyne had meant for [her]127-judith , and which it had taken so long to unearth at [the Venetian antiquary ’s]1477-the venetian antiquary ’s that there was no time for much thought of [Mrs. Sellars’s]236-mrs. sellars’s — the pendant which was [Judith]127-judith ’s by right because , like [her]127-judith , it was odd and exquisite and unaccountable . “ If only [she]127-judith does n’t parade it up at the _ châlet _ ! ”[1478-the coward in him] [the coward in [him]145-boyne]1478-the coward in him thought , as [he]145-boyne climbed [the hill]3071-the hill . But all the while [he]145-boyne knew it was exactly what [she]127-judith would do . “ Oh , well , damn — after all , [I]145-boyne chose it for [her]127-judith , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne grumbled , as if that justified [them]1480-them both . In [the _ châlet _ sitting - room]1481-the _ châlet _ sitting - room [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , in [her]163-mrs. sellars cool evening dress , looked up from the table at which [she]163-mrs. sellars sat , not writing a letter but reading one . [She]163-mrs. sellars laid it down thoughtfully as [he]145-boyne entered . “ [I]145-boyne ’m afraid it ’s awfully late — [I]145-boyne had n’t time to go to [the hotel]1085-the hotel and brush up ; [you]163-mrs. sellars do n’t mind ? ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne said , blinking a little in the lamplight , and passing [his]145-boyne hand through [his]145-boyne rumpled hair . As [he]145-boyne bent to kiss [her]163-mrs. sellars [his]145-boyne glance fell on the admonishing needles of the little travelling clock at [her]163-mrs. sellars elbow . “ [You]163-mrs. sellars do n’t mean to say it ’s after nine ? ”[145-boyne] “ What does it matter ? As a matter of fact , it ’s after half - past . [I]145-boyne was only afraid something had gone wrong about [the children]505-the children . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne tossed [his]145-boyne hat down with a laugh . “ Bless [you]163-mrs. sellars , no ! Everything ’s as right as right . But [I]145-boyne had to get the Lido out of [my]145-boyne lungs ; and a long tramp was the only way . ”[145-boyne] [Her]163-mrs. sellars smile told [him]145-boyne how much [she]163-mrs. sellars loved [him]145-boyne for hating [the Lido]57-the lido . “ And what do [you]145-boyne think [my]163-mrs. sellars news is ? [You]145-boyne know [I]163-mrs. sellars said [I]163-mrs. sellars had something to tell [you]145-boyne . [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree is coming here to see [me]163-mrs. sellars — [he]200-mr. dobree arrives next week . ”[163-mrs. sellars] [She]163-mrs. sellars announced the fact as if it were not only important , but even exciting . “ Oh , damn [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ! ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne rejoined with a careless benevolence . The door had opened on the candlelight of [their]1482-their little dinner - table , on [its]1483-its sparkle of white wine and smell of wild strawberries and village bread . “ Well , this is good enough for [me]145-boyne , ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne said , as [he]145-boyne dropped into the seat opposite [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars with a sense of proprietorship which made [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s movements seem wholly negligible . XIX The next day there occurred , with a fatal punctuality , exactly what [Boyne]145-boyne had foreseen . [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had invited [Judith]127-judith , [Terry]198-terry and [Blanca]128-blanca to lunch ; and when [they]1484-they appeared [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s eye instantly lit on the crystal pendant , [Judith]127-judith ’s on the sapphire ring . The mutual reconnaissance was swift and silent as the crossing of search - lights in a night sky . [Judith]127-judith said nothing ; but [Blanca]128-blanca , as [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars bent to kiss [her]127-judith , raised [[her]128-blanca hostess]1151-her hostess ’s hand with an admiring exclamation . “ A new ring ! What a beauty ! [I]128-blanca never saw [you]1151-her hostess wear it before . ”[128-blanca] [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars smiled , and tapped [Blanca]128-blanca ’s cheek with [her]163-mrs. sellars free hand . “ What sharp eyes ! But [everybody]561-everybody seems to have had a present from [Venice]8-venice — so why should n’t [I]163-mrs. sellars ? ”[163-mrs. sellars] [Blanca]128-blanca returned the smile , lifting [her]128-blanca own wrist to display a hoop of pink crystal . “ Is n’t mine sweet ? [Nobody]2418-nobody finds presents like [Martin]193-martin . ”[128-blanca] “ So [I]163-mrs. sellars thought when [he]3572-he showed [me]163-mrs. sellars [Judith]127-judith ’s last night . ”[163-mrs. sellars] [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars turned to [the older girl]1486-the older girl , but not to kiss [her]1486-the older girl . [She]163-mrs. sellars reserved [her]163-mrs. sellars endearments for [the younger children]1114-the younger children , and merely laid a friendly touch on [Judith]127-judith ’s shoulder . “ Such a wonder , that pendant — [I]163-mrs. sellars never saw one like it . Decidedly , not Venetian ; seventeenth century Spanish , perhaps ? It ’s a puzzle . [You]1486-the older girl ’re lucky , [[my]163-mrs. sellars dear]2807-my dear , to have a _ connaisseur _ to choose [your]1486-the older girl presents . ”[163-mrs. sellars] That was all — and then a jolly lunch , simple , easy , full of chaff and laughter , [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , always [a perfect hostess]1488-a perfect hostess , was at [her]163-mrs. sellars best with [Terry]198-terry and [Blanca]128-blanca . [The boy]365-the boy touched and interested [her]163-mrs. sellars , [the little girl]371-the little girl ( [Boyne]145-boyne divined ) subtly flattered [her]163-mrs. sellars by a wide - eyed but tactful admiration . [Boyne]145-boyne wondered if [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had noticed how [Blanca]128-blanca ’s clear gray eyes darkened with envy at the praise of the crystal pendant . What [a fool]1491-a fool [he]145-boyne had been not to give the crystal to [Blanca]128-blanca , and the tuppenny bracelet to [Judith]127-judith , who would have liked it best because it came from [him]145-boyne ! Decidedly , [he]145-boyne was doomed to blunder in [his]145-boyne dealings with [women]1046-women , even when [they]1046-women were no more than [little girls]1493-little girls . Meanwhile [Terry]198-terry was telling [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars about the books [Boyne]145-boyne had brought [him]198-terry , and how [he]198-terry and [Judith]127-judith had already hunted down [Boyne]145-boyne ’s quotation from “ [The Grammarian]237-the grammarian ’s Funeral”—“You[145-boyne] know , that splendid one [he]145-boyne told [Judith]127-judith yesterday , about ‘ [all the peaks soar]1494-all the peaks soar ’ ; [she]127-judith came [home]290-home last night saying it over and over for fear [she]127-judith ’d forget it , and woke [me]0-i up to hunt for it before [she]127-judith went to bed . ” “[127-judith] It was so splendid , hearing it up there on [the mountain]1033-the mountain , in the dark , with the stars coming out , ” [Judith]127-judith glowed , taking up the tale , while [Blanca]128-blanca ingenuously added : “[127-judith] It was so late when [Judy]127-judith got [home]290-home that [we]1498-we were all asleep , and [Scopy]132-scopy had to go down and let [her]127-judith in . Did [you]145-boyne see [Scopy]132-scopy in [her]127-judith crimping - pins , [Martin]193-martin ; or had [you]145-boyne gone when [she]127-judith opened the door ? ” “[145-boyne] Yes — the coming of twilight up on [the heights]1499-the heights is something to remember , ” [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars intervened , letting [her]163-mrs. sellars eyes rest attentively on [Boyne]145-boyne ’s before [she]163-mrs. sellars turned them again to [Terry]198-terry . “[145-boyne] But there are better things than that in [Browning]80-browning , [you]145-boyne know . Bring [me]0-i [your]145-boyne book to - morrow , and [I]0-i ’ll show [you]145-boyne .... ” It all went off perfectly — and [Boyne]145-boyne , when [he]145-boyne started [the children]505-the children homeward after lunch , was wondering whether tact were as soothing as a summer breeze , or as terrible as an army with banners . [He]145-boyne was to drop [the young Wheaters]130-the wheaters at [their]130-the wheaters _ pension _ , and afterward meet [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars at [the post - office]3575-the post - office for a climb in [the direction of [Misurina]81-misurina]3576-the direction of misurina . At the corner of the highroad descending to [Cortina]34-cortina [he]145-boyne signalled [the hotel omnibus]3577-the hotel omnibus , packed in [the twins]3578-the twins , and walked on with [Judith]127-judith . At the moment [he]145-boyne would rather have escaped from [the whole party]2507-the whole party ; but [Judith]127-judith had declared [her]127-judith intention of walking , and [he]145-boyne could not do otherwise than go with [her]127-judith . [They]3580-their waited under the trees for [the omnibus]3581-the omnibus to sweep on with its load of dust and [passengers]317-passengers , and almost at once [Judith]127-judith said : “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [you]1500-you ’re engaged to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , are n’t [you]1500-you , [Martin]193-martin ? ” The suddenness of the question struck [him]145-boyne like a blow , and [he]145-boyne realised for the first time that [he]145-boyne had never spoken to [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars about making [their]3580-their engagement known . [He]145-boyne had never even asked [her]162-rose sellars if [she]162-rose sellars had broken the news to [[her]162-rose sellars formidable aunt]3583-her formidable aunt , or to the galaxy of [minor relatives with whom [she]162-rose sellars maintained [her]162-rose sellars incessant exchange of letters]3584-minor relatives with whom she maintained her incessant exchange of letters . [Her]162-rose sellars insistence that [their]3580-their marriage should be put off for nearly half a year seemed to make the whole question too remote for immediate decisions . “[1500-you] [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought to have asked [her]163-mrs. sellars if [she]163-mrs. sellars wanted it announced , ” [he]145-boyne thought , reflecting remorsefully that [his]145-boyne long exile had made [him]145-boyne too careless of the social observances . [He]145-boyne turned an irritated eye on [Judith]127-judith . “[163-mrs. sellars] What in [the world]307-the world put such an idea into [your]163-mrs. sellars head ? ” “[163-mrs. sellars] Why , [your]163-mrs. sellars bringing [her]163-mrs. sellars a ring from [Venice]8-venice , and [her]163-mrs. sellars putting it on the finger where engagement rings are worn , ” [Judith]127-judith replied with a smiling promptness . “[163-mrs. sellars] Oh , that ’s the finger , is it ? ” [Boyne]145-boyne said , temporising ; and then , with an abrupt clutch at simplification ; “[163-mrs. sellars] Yes ; [I]0-i am engaged to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars . But [I]0-i do n’t think [she]163-mrs. sellars wants it spoken of at present . ” [He]145-boyne turned [his]145-boyne gaze away to [the long white road]3585-the long white road glinting through the trees under which [he]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith were withdrawn . Things happened so suddenly and overwhelmingly in [Judith]127-judith ’s face that [he]145-boyne did not feel equal to what might be going on there till [he]145-boyne had steadied [his]145-boyne gaze by a protracted study of [the landscape]3586-the landscape . When [he]145-boyne looked at [her]127-judith again [he]145-boyne received the shock of smiling lips and eyes , and two arms thrown filially about [him]145-boyne . “[163-mrs. sellars] [You]0-i darling old [Martin]193-martin , [I]0-i ’m so glad ! At least [I]0-i am if [you]0-i are — really and truly ? ” [Her]127-judith hug was almost as suffocating as [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s , and given — [he]145-boyne divined it instantly — with the same wholehearted candour . “[0-i] So [Blanca]128-blanca was right after all ! How lovely it must be to be in love ! For [I]0-i suppose that ’s the reason why [you]0-i ’re marrying ? [I]0-i know [you]0-i ’re awfully romantic , though [you]0-i sometimes put on such a gruff manner ; [I]0-i ’m sure [you]0-i would n’t marry just for position , or for money , or to regularise an old _ liaison _ ; would [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] An old _ liaison _ ? ” [Boyne]145-boyne laughed , but with a touch of vexation . “[0-i] The ideas [you]0-i ’ve picked up — and the lingo ! [[You]0-i absurd [child]2459-child]1502-you absurd child — why , ‘ regularise ’ is n’t even English .... And ca n’t [you]0-i see , ca n’t [you]0-i imagine , that [a man]308-a man ’s first need is to — to respect [the woman [he]308-a man hopes to marry]1505-the woman he hopes to marry ? ” [Judith]127-judith received this with a puzzled frown . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i can see it ; [I]0-i have , often — in books , and at the movies . But [I]0-i ca n’t imagine it , exactly . [I]0-i should have thought wanting to give [her]1505-the woman he hopes to marry a good hug came before anything . ” [Boyne]145-boyne shrugged impatiently . Things that seemed funny , and utterly guileless , when [she]1505-the woman he hopes to marry said them to [others]820-others , shocked [him]145-boyne when [she]1505-the woman he hopes to marry commented on [his]145-boyne private concerns in the vocabulary of [[her]1505-the woman he hopes to marry tribe]3588-her tribe . “[0-i] What ’s the use ? [You]0-i ’re only [a baby]2462-a baby , and [you]0-i repeat things like a parrot , as [all children]1507-all children do . [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars is the most perfect , the most exquisite ... ” [He]145-boyne broke off , feeling that such asseverations led nowhere in particular , and continued at a tangent : “[0-i] [I]0-i can tell [you]0-i one thing — [I]0-i should never have dared to take on the job of looking after [[you]0-i children]3189-you children if [she]163-mrs. sellars had n’t been here — ” [Judith]127-judith ’s face fell . “[163-mrs. sellars] Oh , is [she]163-mrs. sellars going to stay all summer , then ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i devoutly hope so ! Being with [somebody like [her]163-mrs. sellars]1509-somebody like her is so exactly what ... ” This , again , seemed to land [him]145-boyne in a sort of rhetorical blind alley , and [he]145-boyne stepped down from it into the dust of [the highroad]3589-the highroad . “[163-mrs. sellars] Come along ; [we]1510-we must n’t dawdle . [I]0-i ’m due at [the post - office]3575-the post - office . ” [He]145-boyne was aware that a settled anger was possessing [him]145-boyne , [he]145-boyne hardly knew why . Hardly — yet just under the surface of [his]145-boyne mind there stirred the uneasy sense that [he]145-boyne was perhaps disappointed by [Judith]127-judith ’s prompt congratulations . Half an hour earlier , [he]145-boyne would have said that [her]127-judith approval would add the final touch to [his]145-boyne happiness ; that there was nothing [he]145-boyne wanted more than to have [her]127-judith show [herself]127-judith in fact [the child [he]145-boyne was perpetually calling [her]127-judith]3590-the child he was perpetually calling her . “[3522-the youngest of them] [The youngest of [them]1513-them]3522-the youngest of them all”—that was how [he]145-boyne had described [her]127-judith to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars . Was it possible [he]145-boyne had not meant what [he]145-boyne said ? [I]0-i do really want anything [you]0-i want .... ” “[127-judith] That ’s [a good]1514-a good [Judy]127-judith ... and what rot , [dear]2469-dear , thinking [I]0-i ’m cross . Only , remember , it ’s [your]0-i secret and [mine]0-i , and not another soul ’s . ” After all , [he]145-boyne tried to tell [himself]145-boyne , [Judith]127-judith ’s knowing of [his]145-boyne engagement was already a relief . It would do away with no end of hedging and prevaricating . And [he]145-boyne was sure [he]145-boyne could trust to [Judith]127-judith ’s discretion ; sure of it without [her]127-judith added pressure on [his]145-boyne arm , and the solemn : “[0-i] On [Scopy]132-scopy ’s book ! ” which had become the tribal oath of [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters . [Boyne]145-boyne had sometimes winced at [Judith]127-judith ’s precocious discretion , as another proof of what [she]127-judith had been exposed to ; now [he]145-boyne hailed in it a guaranty of peace . “[0-i] Perhaps there ’s something to be said for not keeping [children]2617-children in cotton wool — for [she]1517-she _ is _ only [a child]435-a child ! ” [he]145-boyne repeated to [himself]145-boyne , insistently . That very evening , while [he]145-boyne and [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars were talking over the likelihood of picking up some kind of a tutor for [Terry]198-terry , [she]163-mrs. sellars asked irrelevantly : “[505-the children] By the way , do [the children]505-the children know of [our]1520-our engagement ? ” Contradictory answers rose to [Boyne]145-boyne ’s lips , and [he]145-boyne gulped them down to mumble : “[505-the children] [I]0-i did n’t suppose [I]0-i was authorized to tell [anybody]2661-anybody . ” “[0-i] But has n’t [anybody]2661-anybody guessed ? ” “[2661-anybody] Well — as a matter of fact , [Judith]127-judith has . Today . [I]0-i ca n’t imagine — ” [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars smiled . “[0-i] [My]0-i ring , of course . [Trust Blanca]128-blanca , too ! It was stupid of [me]0-i not to think of it . But perhaps it ’s better — ” “[0-i] Much better . ” [She]0-i pondered . “[0-i] Only [I]0-i ’d rather [no one else]1523-no one else knew — at least for the present . Out of regard for [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia — till [I]0-i ’ve heard from [her]203-aunt julia . ” [Boyne]145-boyne , relieved , expressed [his]145-boyne complete agreement . “[203-aunt julia] Besides , ” [she]0-i continued , “[0-i] [I]0-i like it ’s being [our]1524-our secret , do n’t [you]0-i ? [We]1524-our wo n’t even tell [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree . ” “[200-mr. dobree] Oh , particularly not [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , ” [Boyne]145-boyne replied emphatically . Two days later [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree arrived ; and [Boyne]145-boyne learned that an event which seems negligible before it happens may fill the picture when it becomes a fact . The prospect of [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s arrival had now become the fact of [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s presence ; and [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , though still spare and nimble for [a man approaching sixty]3591-a man approaching sixty ( [he]200-mr. dobree was ready , and glad , to tell [you]3592-you to what exercises [he]200-mr. dobree owed it ) , took up a surprising amount of room . [He]200-mr. dobree was like somebody who travels with a lot of unwieldy luggage — [his]200-mr. dobree luggage being , as it were , the very absence of it , being [his]200-mr. dobree tact , [his]200-mr. dobree self - effacingness , [his]200-mr. dobree general neatness and compactness . Wherever [you]3592-you turned , [you]3592-you were in the aura of [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s retractility , [his]200-mr. dobree earnest and insistent dodging out of [your]3592-you way , which seemed to leave behind it a presence more oppressive than any mere physical bulk — so that [a dull fat man]3593-a dull fat man rooted in [your]3592-you best armchair might have been less in the way than [the slim and disappearing Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree . [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s tact seemed to [Boyne]145-boyne like a parody of [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s ; like one of those monstrous blooms into which hybridizers transform a delicate flower . It was a “[200-mr. dobree] show ” tact , a huge , unique , disbudded tact grown under glass , and destined to be labelled , exhibited , given a prize and a name , and a page to itself in [the florists]3594-the florists ’ catalogues . Such at least was [Boyne]145-boyne ’s distorted vision of [the new guest at the _ châlet _]3595-the new guest at the _ châlet _ . [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ( as became [a man with such impedimenta )]3596-a man with such impedimenta ) was lodged , not at [[Boyne]145-boyne ’s inn]3597-boyne ’s inn , but at [the “[200-mr. dobree] Palace ” where [Boyne]145-boyne and [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had once dined]3598-the “ palace ” where boyne and mrs. sellars had once dined . From there a brisk five minutes carried [him]200-mr. dobree to [the _ châlet _]911-the _ châlet _ ; except when [his]200-mr. dobree urgent hospitality drew [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars and [Boyne]145-boyne to [the big hotel]3600-the big hotel . The prompt returning of invitations was a fundamental part of [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s code . [He]200-mr. dobree seemed to think that hospitality was something [a gentleman]2417-a gentleman might borrow , like money , but never , in any circumstances , receive as a gift ; and this obliged [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars to accept [his]200-mr. dobree repeated invitations , before , in the battle of [their]3602-their tacts , [hers]163-mrs. sellars came off victorious , and [she]163-mrs. sellars made [him]200-mr. dobree see that it may be more blessed to receive than to be invited out . The sapphire had vanished from [her]163-mrs. sellars finger before [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s arrival ; and this precaution , for which [Boyne]145-boyne blessed [her]163-mrs. sellars , made [him]200-mr. dobree , for [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , simply [an old friend]281-an old friend , [a guest of [the Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s]3604-a guest of the sellars ’s in [New York]13-new york days , whom [one]2514-one could be suitably pleased to meet again . [Boyne]145-boyne was less pleased to meet [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree . [His]200-mr. dobree coming was natural enough ; and so was [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s pleasure at seeing [him]200-mr. dobree , since [he]200-mr. dobree brought not only the latest news of [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia but papers which settled satisfactorily the matter of [Mr. Sellars]239-mr. sellars ’s will . [Boyne]145-boyne had resented what promised to be a tiresome interruption of pleasant habits ; but before long [he]145-boyne discovered that [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s presence left [him]145-boyne free to spend much more time with [[his]145-boyne young friends of the _ Pension Rosenglüh _]3606-his young friends of the _ pension rosenglüh _ . This made [him]145-boyne aware that during the last weeks [he]145-boyne had forfeited a certain amount of [his]145-boyne liberty , and [he]145-boyne found [himself]145-boyne perilously pleased to recover it . [He]145-boyne assured [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars that it would look very odd to [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , who had come to discuss family matters with [[his]145-boyne client]3607-his client , if [a third person]3608-a third person were present at these discussions ; and armed with this argument [he]145-boyne proceeded to dispose of [his]145-boyne time as [he]145-boyne pleased . [His]145-boyne liberation gave a new savour to the hours spent with [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters ; and as for [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ( with whom [the children]505-the children had had only one brief and awe - inspiring encounter ) , [he]200-mr. dobree came in very handily as the theme of the games [they]505-the children were always calling on [Boyne]145-boyne to invent . To ascertain [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s Christian name ( [Boyne]145-boyne told [them]505-the children ) had long been [his]145-boyne secret ambition ; but hitherto [he]145-boyne had not even been able to learn its first letter . A chance glimpse of [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s glossy suit - cases showed [his]200-mr. dobree initials to be A.D. , and the letter A was one calculated , as [Boyne]145-boyne said , to give [them]505-the children a good gallop . Indeed , [he]145-boyne found the puzzle so absorbing that one day , when [Judith]127-judith remarked on [his]145-boyne unusual absent - mindedness , [he]145-boyne had to own that [he]145-boyne had not been listening to what [she]127-judith said because all [his]145-boyne faculties were still absorbed in the task of guessing [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s Christian name . “[163-mrs. sellars] But [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars must know — why do n’t [you]1525-you ask [her]163-mrs. sellars ? ” “[163-mrs. sellars] Must know ? Do [you]1525-you think so ? [I]0-i doubt it . ” “[1525-you] But [she]163-mrs. sellars talks of [him]1526-him as [an old friend]281-an old friend — as old as [you]1525-you . ” “[163-mrs. sellars] Even that does n’t convince [me]0-i . [I]0-i doubt if [anybody]2661-anybody knows [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s Christian name . How should [they]2661-anybody ? Can [you]1525-you imagine [anybody]2661-anybody ’s ever having called [him]1526-him by it , or dared to ask [him]1526-him what it was ? ” “[2661-anybody] Well , [you]1525-you might ask [her]163-mrs. sellars , ” suggested [Judith]127-judith , from whose make - up a taste for abstract speculation was absent . “[163-mrs. sellars] Ask [her]163-mrs. sellars ? Not for [the world]307-the world ! Suppose [she]163-mrs. sellars did know ? All [our]1531-our fun would be over . ” “[163-mrs. sellars] Of course it would , ” cried [Terry]198-terry , plunging into the sport . “[163-mrs. sellars] If [she]163-mrs. sellars knows , [she]163-mrs. sellars must n’t be asked till [we]1531-our ’ve exhausted every other possibility ; must [she]163-mrs. sellars , [Martin]193-martin ? ” “[163-mrs. sellars] Certainly not . [I]0-i see [you]1525-you grasp the rules of the game . And now let ’s proceed by elimination . [Abel]240-abel — [Abel]240-abel ’s the first name in A , is n’t it , [Terry]198-terry ? ” “[198-terry] No ! Let ’s begin with [Aage]242-aage . Do any of [you]1525-you _ see [_ Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree as [Aage]242-aage ? ” This was dismissed with a general shout of incredulity . “[242-aage] Well , then : as [Abel]240-abel — [Abel Dobree]240-abel ? Do n’t be in a hurry : try to deal with this thing in a mood of deliberateness and impartiality . ” “[240-abel] No , no , no — not [Abel]240-abel ! ” [the assistance]3611-the assistance chorused . “[240-abel] Oh , [I]0-i ’m going to sleep , ” [Judith]127-judith grumbled , stretching out at full length on [the sunburnt grass - bank on which [the party]562-the party were encamped]3612-the sunburnt grass - bank on which the party were encamped . “[1533-her] Let [her]1533-her — for all the use [she]1533-her is ! ” [Boyne]145-boyne jeered . “[243-adam] Now then — [Adam]243-adam ? ” “[243-adam] [Adam]243-adam ’s a Polish name , is n’t it ? [XX Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s social discipline was too perfect to permit [her]0-i , even in emergencies , to neglect one obligation for another ; and after [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree had been for a week at [Cortina]34-cortina [she]0-i said one day to [Boyne]145-boyne : “[3206-a prince] But [I]0-i ’ve seen nothing lately of [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters . [You]0-i see , [he]200-mr. dobree was one of [the lawyers in the Westway divorce]1555-the lawyers in the westway divorce . ” [Boyne]145-boyne gave [her]0-i a quick look , in which [he]145-boyne was conscious that [his]145-boyne resentment flamed . “[200-mr. dobree] [I]0-i ’m hanged if [I]0-i see what there can be in [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s mind to make [him]200-mr. dobree connect the [Westway]82-westway divorce with [the Wheater children]873-the wheater children . ” “[200-mr. dobree] Why , simply [his]200-mr. dobree knowledge of [Judith]127-judith ’s intimacy with that wretched drug - soaked [Doll Westway]166-doll westway , and [his]200-mr. dobree familiarity with the horrible details that led up to [the girl]326-the girl ’s suicide . [She]127-judith and [Judith]127-judith were together at [Deauville]35-deauville the very summer that [she]127-judith killed [herself]127-judith . [[Both]1558-both [their]1558-both mothers]1559-both their mothers had gone off heaven knows where . [Judith]127-judith proclaims the fact to [every one]885-every one , as [you]1561-you know . ” [Boyne]145-boyne had removed [his]145-boyne eyes from [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s face , and was staring out at the familiar outline of [the great crimson mountains beyond the balcony]3622-the great crimson mountains beyond the balcony . A phrase of [Stevenson]247-stevenson ’s about “[127-judith] the lovely and detested scene ” ( from “[127-judith] The Ebb - tide , ” [he]145-boyne thought ? ) strayed through [his]145-boyne mind as [he]145-boyne gazed .
