First , [the Wheater tribe]3768-the wheater tribe transplanted ( [he]145-boyne did n’t yet see how ) to [the safe shelter of [Grandma Mervin]216-grandma mervin ’s wing]3769-the safe shelter of grandma mervin ’s wing ; then [his]145-boyne own marriage ; then — flight ! [He]145-boyne worked [himself]145-boyne into a glow of eloquence , as [he]145-boyne always did in these one - sided talks , which never failed to end in convincing [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars because [he]145-boyne unconsciously eliminated from [them]3770-them all the objections [she]163-mrs. sellars might possibly have raised .... [He]145-boyne went to bed with a sense of fresh air in [his]145-boyne soul , as if the mere vision of escape had freed [him]145-boyne .... [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had not said at what hour [she]163-mrs. sellars expected [him]145-boyne the next day ; so [he]145-boyne decided to wait till lunch , and drop in on [her]163-mrs. sellars then , as [his]145-boyne habit was when [they]3771-they had no particular expedition in view . In the morning [he]145-boyne usually strolled down to see how [the _ Rosenglüh _ refugees]3772-the _ rosenglüh _ refugees were getting on ; but on this occasion [he]145-boyne left [them]3772-the _ rosenglüh _ refugees to [themselves]3772-the _ rosenglüh _ refugees , and did not go out till [he]145-boyne made for [the _ châlet _]911-the _ châlet _ . As [he]145-boyne approached it [he]145-boyne was startled by a queer sense of something impending . Oh , not another “[0-i] scene ” ; [Rose]162-rose sellars was much too intelligent for that . What [he]145-boyne felt was just an uneasy qualm , as if the new air in [his]145-boyne soul ’s lungs were being gradually pumped out of [them]3772-the _ rosenglüh _ refugees again . [He]145-boyne glanced up at [the balcony]949-the balcony , lifting [his]145-boyne hand to signal to [her]162-rose sellars ; but [she]162-rose sellars was not there . [He]145-boyne pushed open the hall door and ran up [the short flight of stairs]3775-the short flight of stairs . [The little sitting - room]1130-the little sitting - room was empty : [it]1130-the little sitting - room looked speckless and orderly as [a tomb]3777-a tomb . [He]145-boyne noticed at once that the littered writing - table was swept and garnished , and that no scent of viands greeted [him]145-boyne through [the dining - room]1178-the dining - room door . [She]162-rose sellars had gone — [he]145-boyne became suddenly sure that [she]162-rose sellars had gone . But why ? But when ? Above all , why without a word ? It was so unlike [her]162-rose sellars to do anything abrupt and unaccountable that [his]145-boyne vague sense of apprehension returned . [He]145-boyne sat down in the armchair [he]145-boyne always occupied , as if the familiar act must re - evoke [her]162-rose sellars , call [her]162-rose sellars back into the seat opposite , in the spirit if not in the flesh . But [the room]1180-the room remained disconcertingly , remained even spiritually empty . [He]145-boyne had the sense that [she]162-rose sellars had gone indeed , and had taken [her]162-rose sellars soul with [her]162-rose sellars ; and the discovery made a queer unexpected void in [him]145-boyne . “[1712-his] This is — absurd ! ” [he]145-boyne heard [himself]145-boyne exclaiming . “[162-rose sellars] [Rose]162-rose sellars ! ” [he]145-boyne called out ; there was no answer . [He]145-boyne stood up , and [his]145-boyne wandering eye travelled from the table to the mantelpiece . On its shelf [he]145-boyne saw a letter addressed to [himself]145-boyne . [He]145-boyne seized it and tore it open ; and all at once the accents of [the writer]3780-the writer ’s reasonableness floated out into the jangled air of [the little room]3733-the little room . “[162-rose sellars] Dearest — After [you]162-rose sellars left yesterday [I]0-i had a radio from [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia , asking [me]0-i to get to [Paris]42-paris as soon as [I]0-i could , so [I]0-i decided to motor over to [Padua]63-padua this morning , and catch the Orient Express . And [I]0-i mean to slip off like this , without seeing [you]162-rose sellars , or even letting [you]162-rose sellars know that [I]0-i ’m going , because , on second thoughts , [I]0-i believe [my]0-i little plan ( [you]162-rose sellars know [I]0-i promised [you]162-rose sellars one ) will be all the better for a day or two more of quiet thought ; so [I]0-i ’ll simply write it to [you]162-rose sellars from [Paris]42-paris instead of talking it to [you]162-rose sellars hurriedly this morning . “ Besides ( [I]1713-he ’ll confess ) [I]1713-he want to keep the picture of [our]3782-our happiness [here]2434-here intact , not frayed and rubbed by more discussion , even the friendliest . [You]162-rose sellars ’ll understand , [I]1713-he know . This being together has been something so complete , so exquisite , that [I]1713-he want to carry it away with [me]1713-he in its perfection .... [I]1713-he ’ll write in a few days . Till then , if [you]162-rose sellars can , think of [me]1713-he as [I]1713-he think of [you]162-rose sellars . No heart could ask more of another . [Rose]162-rose sellars . ”[1713-he] [He]1713-he sat down again , and read the letter over two or three times . It was sweet and reasonable — but it was also desperately sad . Yes ; [she]1714-her had understood that for a time it was best for both that [they]1715-they should be apart . And this was [her]1714-her way of putting it to [him]1713-he . [His]1713-he eyes filled , and [he]1713-he wondered how [he]1713-he could have thought , the night before , that if [he]1713-he suddenly heard [she]1714-her was leaving it would be a relief .... But presently [he]1713-he began to visualise what the day would have been if [he]1713-he had found [her]1714-her [there]2439-there , and [they]1715-they had now been sitting over the lunch - table , “ fraying and rubbing ”[1714-her] [their]1715-they happiness , as [she]1714-her had put it , by more discussion — useless discussion . How intelligent of [her]1714-her to go — how merciful ! Yes ; [he]1713-he would think of [her]1714-her as [she]1714-her thought of [him]1713-he ; [he]1713-he could now , without a shadow of reserve . [He]1713-he would bless [her]1714-her in all honesty for this respite .... [He]1713-he took a fading mountain - pink from one of the vases on the mantelpiece , put it in [his]1713-he pocket - book with [her]1714-her letter , and started to walk down to [the village]1081-the village to send [her]1714-her a telegram . As [he]1713-he walked , [he]1713-he composed it , affectionately , lingeringly . [He]1713-he moved fast through the brisk air , and by the time [he]1713-he had reached [the foot of [the hill]3071-the hill]3528-the foot of the hill a pang of wholesome hunger reminded [him]1713-he that [he]1713-he had not lunched . Straight ahead , the _ Pension Rosenglüh _ lay in [his]1713-he path , and [he]1713-he knew that , even if [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters had finished [their]788-the little wheaters midday meal , [Miss Scope]147-miss scope would persuade [the cook]2587-the cook to conjure up an omelette for [him]1713-he .... Instantly [he]1713-he felt a sort of boyish excitement at the idea of surprising [the party]562-the party ; and finding the front door unlatched , [he]1713-he crossed [the hall]711-the hall and entered [the private dining - room which had been assigned to [them]788-the little wheaters]1724-the private dining - room which had been assigned to them since the arrival of [adult boarders less partial than [himself]1713-he to what [Judith]127-judith called [the children]505-the children ’s “ dinner - roar]3784-adult boarders less partial than himself to what judith called the children ’s “ dinner - roar . [”]3785-”[1713-he] [His]1713-he appearance was welcomed with a vocal vigour which must have made the crockery dance even in the grown - up _ Speise - saal _ across [the hall]711-the hall . “ Have the wild animals left a morsel for [me]1713-he ? ”[1713-he] [he]1713-he asked , and gaily wedged [himself]1713-he in between [Judith]127-judith and [Blanca]128-blanca . XXIV Uninterrupted communion with [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters always gave [Boyne]145-boyne the same feeling of liberation . It was like getting back from a constrained bodily position into a natural one . This sense of being [himself]1713-he , being simply and utterly at [his]1713-he ease , which [the children]505-the children ’s companionship had given [him]1713-he during the Mediterranean voyage , but which [he]1713-he had enjoyed only in uncertain snatches since [their]788-the little wheaters arrival at [Cortina]34-cortina , came back to [him]1713-he as soon as [he]1713-he had slipped [his]1713-he chair between [Judith]127-judith ’s and [Blanca]128-blanca ’s at the lunch - table . [He]1713-he would not ascribe it to [her]127-judith having gone , but preferred to think it was because [her]127-judith going left [him]1713-he free to dispose of [himself]1713-he as [he]1713-he chose . And what [he]1713-he chose was , on the spot , to resume [his]1713-he half - fatherly attitude toward [the group]848-the group , and devote every moment of [his]1713-he time to [them]848-the group . Being with [them]848-the group again was like getting [home]290-home after a long and precarious journey during which [he]1713-he had been without news of [the people [he]1713-he loved]1730-the people he loved . A great many things must have happened in the interval , and not a moment must be lost in gathering up the threads . There were , in fact , many threads to be gathered . [He]1713-he got a general outline of the situation that very evening from [Miss Scope]147-miss scope — learned that [Terry]198-terry ’s health was steadily improving , that [the young Swiss tutor whom [Boyne]145-boyne had unearthed at [Botzen]89-botzen]1731-the young swiss tutor whom boyne had unearthed at botzen was conscientious and kind , and got on well with [Terry]198-terry , but found [Bun]135-bun hopelessly unmanageable ( “ And nothing new in that , ”[147-miss scope] [Miss Scope]147-miss scope commented ) ; that on the whole [the three little girls]1732-the three little girls , [Blanca]128-blanca , [Zinnie]133-zinnie and [Beechy]154-beechy , though trying at times , were behaving better than could have been hoped , considering the unusual length of [their]1732-the three little girls holiday ; and lastly that [Chipstone]142-chipstone , even in the process of cutting a new tooth , retained [his]142-chipstone rosy serenity , and had added a pound or more to [his]142-chipstone weight . All this was as absorbing to [Boyne]145-boyne as if [every one concerned]1733-every one concerned had been of the highest interest and consequence . [He]145-boyne had a long talk with [the tutor]799-the tutor , went carefully into the question of [Terry]198-terry ’s studies , suggested a few changes , and encouraged and counselled [the young man]798-the young man . As to luring or coercing [Bun]135-bun up the steep way of knowledge , a stronger hand would be needed ; and while [Bun]135-bun ranged unchecked there was not much to be done with [the little girls]1425-the little girls . Even [Blanca]128-blanca , though [she]128-blanca felt [herself]128-blanca so superior in age and culture , found the company of [[her]128-blanca juniors]1737-her juniors tolerable , and [their]1737-her juniors bad example irresistible , when there was nothing better going . But , as against these drawbacks , there was the happy fact that the high air , which had done [all the children]3133-all the children good , had transformed [Terry]198-terry from [a partial invalid]1739-a partial invalid into [a joyous active boy who laughed at temperatures and clamoured for second helpings]1740-a joyous active boy who laughed at temperatures and clamoured for second helpings . And so far [the Lido]57-the lido had refrained from interfering . On the whole , therefore , as the weeks passed , [Boyne]145-boyne had more and more reason to be satisfied with [his]145-boyne achievement . To give [the children]505-the children a couple of months of security , with the growing hope of keeping [them]505-the children all together under [old Mrs. Mervin]254-mrs. mervin ’s roof , had assuredly been worth trying for . The evening after [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s departure [he]145-boyne wrote a long letter to [Grandma Mervin]216-grandma mervin . [Boyne]145-boyne , once more alone with [the children]505-the children , found that [his]145-boyne confused feeling about [Judith]127-judith had given way to the frank elder - brotherly affection [he]145-boyne had felt for [her]127-judith on the cruise . Perhaps because [she]127-judith [herself]127-judith had become natural and simple , now that there were [no older people]1743-no older people to put [her]127-judith on the defensive , [she]127-judith seemed again [the buoyant child who had first captivated [him]145-boyne]1744-the buoyant child who had first captivated him . Or perhaps [his]145-boyne thinking so was just a part of [his]145-boyne satisfaction at being with [[his]145-boyne flock]1745-his flock again , unobserved and uncriticised by [the grown up]436-the grown up . [He]145-boyne and [they]505-the children understood [each other]396-each other ; [he]145-boyne suspected that , even had [their]505-the children plight not roused [his]145-boyne pity , [his]145-boyne own restlessness and impulsiveness would have fraternized with [theirs]505-the children . “ The fact is , [we]505-the children ’re none of [us]505-the children grown up , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne reflected , hugging [himself]145-boyne for being on [the children]505-the children ’s side of the eternal barrier . [His]145-boyne talks with [Judith]127-judith turned , as usual , on the future of [the children]505-the children . [He]145-boyne sometimes tried to draw from [her]127-judith the expression of a personal preference ; but [she]127-judith seemed to want nothing for [herself]127-judith ; [she]127-judith could not detach [herself]127-judith , even in imagination , from [the others]2515-the others . For [them]505-the children [she]127-judith had fabulous dreams and ambitions . If only [they]505-the children could keep together till [they]505-the children were grown up ! [She]127-judith had a quaint vision of [their]505-the children all living in [a house somewhere in [the country]3426-the country]1751-a house somewhere in the country ( perhaps [[her]127-judith father]2542-her father would buy [them]505-the children one when [she]127-judith came of age ) ; [a house which should be always full of pets and birds ; and leading there a life in which the amusements of [the nursery]2423-the nursery were delightfully combined with grown up pursuits]1754-a house which should be always full of pets and birds ; and leading there a life in which the amusements of the nursery were delightfully combined with grown up pursuits . And for [each of [the children]505-the children]1756-each of the children [she]127-judith had thought out a definite career . [Blanca]128-blanca , of course , was to be “ lovely ”[128-blanca] : to [Judith]127-judith loveliness was a vocation . [Terry]198-terry was to be [a great scholar]1758-a great scholar , [the guide and counsellor of [the others]2515-the others]1759-the guide and counsellor of the others — [she]127-judith had a savage reverence for the wisdom and authority to be acquired from books . [Bun]135-bun was manifestly meant to drive [racing - motors]2743-racing - motors , and carry off championships in games and athletics ; [Beechy]154-beechy would marry and have heaps of [children]2617-children , yet somehow be always able to look after [Bun]135-bun ; and [Zinnie]133-zinnie — well , [Zinnie]133-zinnie was undoubtedly predestined to be “ clever ”[133-zinnie] ; a fate of dubious import . But [Judith]127-judith hoped it would not be with the sharp cunning of [little Pixie Lullmer]226-pixie , who seemed so childish and simple , and was really an abyss of precocious knowledge , initiated into all the secrets of hotel life ; [a toad of [a child]435-a child]1763-a toad of a child , [Judith]127-judith summed it up , whereas [[her]127-judith poor half - sister]1765-her poor half - sister , [Doll Westway]166-doll westway , had hated it all so much that [she]1765-her poor half - sister had taken the shortest way out by shooting [herself]1765-her poor half - sister .... Ah — and [Chipstone]142-chipstone ! Well , there was no hurry about [Chipstone]142-chipstone , was there ? But [he]142-chipstone was so large and calm , and so certain to get what [he]142-chipstone wanted , that [Judith]127-judith thought perhaps [he]142-chipstone would be [a banker]1766-a banker — and own [a big yacht]1767-a big yacht , and take [them]1768-them all on wonderful cruises . And [Nanny]156-nanny and [Susan]212-susan would of course always stay with [them]1768-them , to look after [[Beechy]154-beechy ’s children]1769-beechy ’s children .... [Boyne]145-boyne had decided to write to [old Mrs. Mervin]254-mrs. mervin without mentioning the fact to [Judith]127-judith . [He]145-boyne had meant to consult [her]254-mrs. mervin , had even intended to have a talk with [her]254-mrs. mervin on the day when [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s abrupt departure had momentarily unsettled [his]145-boyne plans ; but when the idea recurred to [him]145-boyne [Judith]127-judith was already re - established in [his]145-boyne mind as the blithe creature of [their]1770-their first encounter , and [he]145-boyne had a superstitious dread of doing anything to change the harmony of [their]1770-their relation . After all , [he]145-boyne could plead [the children]505-the children ’s cause with [[their]505-the children grandmother]1772-their grandmother as well as [Judith]127-judith could ; and if [his]145-boyne appeal were doomed to failure [she]127-judith need never know it had been made . [He]145-boyne found [himself]145-boyne insisting rather elaborately , in [his]145-boyne own mind , on the childishness [he]145-boyne was fond of ascribing to [her]127-judith when [he]145-boyne talked of [her]127-judith to [others]820-others ; and now [he]145-boyne feared lest anything should break through that necessary illusion . In [his]145-boyne letter to [Mrs. Mervin]254-mrs. mervin [he]145-boyne tried to combine the maximum of conciseness and of eloquence , and ended by reminding [her]254-mrs. mervin that [the various parents]1774-the various parents might intervene at any moment , and begging [her]254-mrs. mervin to cable at once if , as [he]145-boyne earnestly hoped , [she]254-mrs. mervin could give [her]254-mrs. mervin assent to the plan . The sending off of the letter was like handing in an essay at [school]2671-school ; with its completion [he]145-boyne seemed entering with [the children]505-the children on a new holiday . “ Two or three weeks ’ respite , anyhow ; and then , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne thought , “ who knows ? [I]145-boyne may be able to carry [them]505-the children all back to [New York]13-new york with [me]145-boyne . ”[145-boyne] Incredible as it was , [he]145-boyne clung to the hope with a faith as childish as [Judith]127-judith ’s . [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had said that [she]163-mrs. sellars would write in a few days . Instead , [she]163-mrs. sellars telegraphed to announce [her]163-mrs. sellars arrival in [Paris]42-paris , and again , a little later , to inform [Boyne]145-boyne of [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia ’s . To each message [she]163-mrs. sellars added a few words of tender greeting ; but ten days or more elapsed before the telegrams were followed by a letter . [Boyne]145-boyne found it one evening , on [his]145-boyne return from a long expedition with [the children]505-the children . [He]145-boyne had ceased , after a day or two , to speculate on [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s silence , had gradually , as the days passed , become unconscious of [their]1778-their flight , and was almost surprised , when [he]145-boyne saw [her]163-mrs. sellars handwriting , that a letter from [Paris]42-paris should have reached [Cortina]34-cortina so quickly . [He]145-boyne waited till after dinner to read it , secretly wishing to keep the flavour of the present on [his]145-boyne lips . Then , when the task could no longer be postponed , [he]145-boyne withdrew to [the melancholy lounge]1779-the melancholy lounge , and settled [himself]145-boyne in the same slippery chair in which [he]145-boyne had sat when [he]145-boyne read the letter of [the engineers]1780-the engineers asking if [he]145-boyne could trace the whereabouts of [the young man to whom [they]1780-the engineers wanted to offer a job]1781-the young man to whom they wanted to offer a job . “ It ’s to say [she]203-aunt julia ’s coming back , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne muttered to [himself]145-boyne as [he]145-boyne broke the seal . But [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars did not say that . The letter was one of [her]163-mrs. sellars best — tender , gay and amusing . The description of [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia ’s arrival was a little masterpiece . [The writer]3780-the writer dwelt at length on the arts [she]3780-the writer had exercised — was still exercising — to persuade [the family]289-the family tyrant that [he]145-boyne , [Boyne]145-boyne , was justified in wishing for an immediate marriage , and [she]3780-the writer added , on a note of modest triumph , that success was already in sight . “ But even if it were not , [dear]2469-dear , ”[3780-the writer] the letter pursued , “ [I]3780-the writer should n’t allow that to alter [my]3780-the writer plans — [our]3787-we plans — and [I]3780-the writer ’m prepared to have [you]2469-dear carry [me]3780-the writer off under [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia ’s nose ( formidable though that feature is ) , if [she]203-aunt julia should refuse [her]203-aunt julia sanction . But [she]203-aunt julia wo n’t ; and the important question is what [we]3787-we intend to do , and not what [she]203-aunt julia may think about it . ”[3780-the writer] At this stage [Boyne]145-boyne laid the letter aside , took out a cigar , cut it , and put it down without remembering to light it . [He]145-boyne took up the letter again . “ But it ’s more important still that [we]3787-we should come to a clear understanding about [our]3787-we future — isn’t it , [dearest]3025-dearest ? [I]145-boyne feel that [I]145-boyne made such an understanding impossible the other day by [my]145-boyne unreasonableness , [my]145-boyne impatience , [my]145-boyne apparent inability to see [your]2469-dear point of view . But [I]145-boyne did see it , even then ; and [I]145-boyne see it much more clearly now that [I]145-boyne have studied the question at a sufficient distance to focus it properly . Of course [we]3787-we both know that , whatever decision [we]3787-we reach , [some of the numerous papas and mammas of [[your]2469-dear little friends]3790-your little friends]3789-some of the numerous papas and mammas of your little friends may upset it at a moment ’s notice ; but meanwhile [I]145-boyne have a plan to propose . What [you]2469-dear want — isn’t it?—is to guard [these poor children]3791-these poor children as long as possible from the unsettling and demoralising influence of continual change . [I]145-boyne quite see [your]2469-dear idea ; and it seems to [me]145-boyne that [those most exposed to such risks]3792-those most exposed to such risks are the ones [we]3787-we ought to try to help . By [your]2469-dear own showing , [Mr. Wheater]126-mr. wheater will never give up [Chipstone]142-chipstone for long ; [Zinnie]133-zinnie , and [[Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte ’s funny little pair]3793-prince buondelmonte ’s funny little pair , are bound to be claimed by [[their]3793-prince buondelmonte ’s funny little pair respective parents]1422-their respective parents now that [they]3793-prince buondelmonte ’s funny little pair have settled down to wealth and domesticity . As for the enchanting [Judith]127-judith , though [you]2469-dear persist in not seeing it , [she]127-judith will be grown up and married in a year or two ; and meanwhile , if [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters do divorce , [she]127-judith will probably choose to remain with [[her]127-judith mother]382-her mother , as [she]127-judith did before . [The twins]3578-the twins , in fact , seem to [me]145-boyne [the chief victims]3797-the chief victims . [They]3578-the twins are old enough to understand what is going on , and not old enough to make [themselves]3578-the twins lives of [their]3578-the twins own ; and above all [they]3578-the twins are at an age when disintegrating influences are likely to do the most harm . [You]2469-dear have often told [me]145-boyne that poor [Terry]198-terry ’s health has been an obstacle between [him]198-terry and [[his]198-terry father]413-his father ( what a horrible idea that it should be so ! ) , and that [the bouncing Chip]123-chip has cut [him]198-terry out . [Terry]198-terry needs care and sympathy more than any of [them]3578-the twins ; and [I]145-boyne am sure [you]2469-dear will feel , as [I]145-boyne do , that it would be unthinkable to separate [dear little Blanca]128-blanca from [the brother [she]128-blanca adores]3799-the brother she adores . What [I]145-boyne propose , then , is that [you]2469-dear should ask [Mr.]3800-mr. and [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater to give up [the twins]3578-the twins — regarding [us]3802-us in any capacity [you]2469-dear like , either as [[their]3578-the twins friends]3803-their friends , or as [[their]3578-the twins legal guardians]3804-their legal guardians , if that is better — till [they]3578-the twins come of age . [I]145-boyne will gladly take a share in looking after [them]3578-the twins , and [I]145-boyne believe that between [us]3802-us [we]3802-us can turn [them]3578-the twins into [happy useful members of society]3805-happy useful members of society . If [you]2469-dear agree , [I]145-boyne am ready to — ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne stopped reading , folded up the letter and thrust it into [his]145-boyne pocket . There rushed over [him]145-boyne a wave of disappointment and disgust . “ [Dear little Blanca]128-blanca indeed ! ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne muttered furiously . “ [Useful members of society]3806-useful members of society ! ”[145-boyne] That [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars should calmly propose to separate [the children]505-the children was bad enough ; but that , of the lot , [she]163-mrs. sellars should choose to foist on [him]145-boyne the only one [he]145-boyne could feel no affection for , and hardly any interest in — that to [the woman [he]145-boyne was going to marry [Blanca]128-blanca]1785-the woman he was going to marry blanca should alone seem worthy of compassion among [the four little girls who had been cast upon [his]145-boyne mercy]1786-the four little girls who had been cast upon his mercy , this was to [Boyne]145-boyne hatefully significant of the side of [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s character to which , from the moment of [their]1787-their reunion , [he]145-boyne had been trying to close [his]145-boyne eyes . “ [She]163-mrs. sellars chooses [her]163-mrs. sellars because [she]163-mrs. sellars knows [she]163-mrs. sellars need never be jealous of [her]163-mrs. sellars , ”[145-boyne] was [his]145-boyne inmost thought . Well , and supposing it were so — how womanly , how human , after all ! Loving [Boyne]145-boyne as [she]163-mrs. sellars did , was it not natural that [she]163-mrs. sellars should prefer to have under [her]163-mrs. sellars roof [the two children]1788-the two children least likely to come between [herself]163-mrs. sellars and [him]145-boyne , to interfere in any way with [their]1787-their happiness ? Yes — but was that loving [him]145-boyne at all ? If [she]163-mrs. sellars had really loved [him]145-boyne would [she]163-mrs. sellars not have entered into [his]145-boyne feeling about [the little group]1789-the little group , and recognised the cruelty of separating [them]1789-the little group ? [He]145-boyne paused a moment over this , and tried conscientiously to imagine what , in a similar case , [his]145-boyne love for [her]163-mrs. sellars would have inspired [him]145-boyne to do . Would it , for instance , ever induce [him]145-boyne to live with [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia as [a dependent nephew - in - law]1790-a dependent nephew - in - law ? A million times no ! But why propound such useless riddles ? [No one]2415-no one could pretend that the cases were similar . [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars would simply be asking [him]145-boyne to gratify a whim ; what [he]145-boyne was asking of [her]162-rose sellars was vital , inevitable . [She]162-rose sellars knew that it lay with [him]145-boyne , and with [no one else]1523-no one else , to save [these children]3343-these children ; [she]162-rose sellars knew that , little by little , [his]145-boyne whole heart had gone into the task . Yet coolly , deliberately , with that infernal air [she]162-rose sellars had of thinking away whatever it was inconvenient to admit , [she]162-rose sellars had affected to sympathise with [his]145-boyne purpose while in reality [her]162-rose sellars proposal ignored it . Send back [the younger children]1114-the younger children to [[their]1114-the younger children parents]507-their parents — to [such parents as [Zinnia Lacrosse]143-zinnia and [Buondelmonte!—return Judith]127-judith to [[her]127-judith mother]382-her mother]1796-such parents as zinnia lacrosse and buondelmonte!—return judith to her mother , to [a mother about to marry [Gerald Ormerod]175-gerald , who , by [Judith]127-judith ’s own showing]1798-a mother about to marry gerald ormerod , who , by judith ’s own showing , would have preferred [herself]1798-a mother about to marry gerald ormerod , who , by judith ’s own showing ? [Boyne]145-boyne recoiled from the thought as from the sight of some physical cruelty [he]145-boyne could not prevent . [He]145-boyne got up , threw away [his]145-boyne cigar , and went out hatless , indignant , into the night . The air was warm , the sky full of clouds tunnelled by shifting vistas of a remote blue sprinkled with stars . [Boyne]145-boyne groped [his]145-boyne way down [the obscure wood - path]1799-the obscure wood - path from [[his]145-boyne hotel]925-his hotel , and walked across [the fields]1801-the fields to [the slopes which [Judith]127-judith and [he]145-boyne had climbed on the day of [his]145-boyne return from [the Lido]57-the lido]1802-the slopes which judith and he had climbed on the day of his return from the lido . It was from that day — [he]145-boyne recalled it now — that [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ’s jealousy of [Judith]127-judith had dated ; [he]145-boyne had seen it flash across [her]162-rose sellars fixed attentive face when , the next morning , [Judith]127-judith had blurted out an allusion to [their]1803-their ramble . [Boyne]145-boyne — [he]145-boyne also remembered — had given [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars to understand that on that occasion [he]145-boyne had gone off for a walk by [himself]145-boyne , “ to get the Lido out of [his]145-boyne lungs ”[145-boyne] ; very likely [his]145-boyne prevarication had first excited [her]163-mrs. sellars suspicion . For why should [he]145-boyne dissemble the fact that [he]145-boyne had been with [Judith]127-judith , if [Judith]127-judith was only [a child]435-a child to [him]145-boyne , as [he]145-boyne said ? Why indeed ? It seemed as though , in concealing so significant a fact , [he]145-boyne had simply , unconsciously , been on [his]145-boyne guard against this long - suspected jealousy ; as if [he]145-boyne had always guessed that the most passionate and irrational of sentiments lurked under [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s calm and reasonable exterior . If it were so , it certainly made [her]127-judith more interesting — but also less easy to deal with . For jealousy , to excite sympathy , must be felt by [some one who also inspires it]1805-some one who also inspires it . Shared , it was a part of love ; unshared , it made love impossible . And [Boyne]145-boyne , in [his]145-boyne fatuous security , could not imagine feeling jealous of [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars . “ Though of course [I]163-mrs. sellars should hate it like anything , [I]163-mrs. sellars suppose .... ”[163-mrs. sellars] But the problem was one that [he]145-boyne could only apprehend intellectually . [He]145-boyne tramped on through the summer night , [his]145-boyne mind full of tormented thoughts ; and as [he]145-boyne groped upward among the pines [he]145-boyne remembered that other night , not many weeks since , when [he]145-boyne had climbed the same path , and [his]145-boyne feet had seemed winged , and the air elixir , because [a girl]321-a girl ’s shoulder brushed [his]145-boyne own , and [he]145-boyne listened to unpremeditated laughter . It was so late when [he]145-boyne got back to [the hotel]1085-the hotel that [the porter]3050-the porter , unwillingly roused , looked at [him]145-boyne with a sulky astonishment . “ There was [a lady]2848-a lady here — [she]2848-a lady left a parcel for [you]145-boyne . ”[3050-the porter] “ [A lady]2848-a lady ? Where ’s the parcel ? ”[3050-the porter] “ Up in [[your]145-boyne room]3809-your room . [I]3050-the porter had to help [her]2848-a lady to carry it up . It was awkward getting it round the turn of the stairs . [She]2848-a lady left a letter for [you]145-boyne too . ”[3050-the porter] Awkward round the turn of the stairs ? What on earth could the object be , and who [the lady]503-the lady ? [Boyne]145-boyne , without farther questions , sprang up to [[his]145-boyne room]1810-his room . [Rose]162-rose sellars had come back — there could be no doubt of it . [She]162-rose sellars had decided , adroitly enough , to follow up [her]162-rose sellars letter by the persuasion of [her]162-rose sellars presence . At the thought [he]145-boyne felt flurried , unsettled , as if [she]162-rose sellars had come too soon , before [he]145-boyne had set [his]145-boyne mind in order to receive [her]162-rose sellars . And what could [she]162-rose sellars possibly have brought [him]145-boyne that had to be manœuvred up [the hotel stairs]1811-the hotel stairs ? Whatever it was , [he]145-boyne could not , try as [he]145-boyne would , figure [her]162-rose sellars labouring up to [[his]145-boyne room]1810-his room with it , even with the assistance of [the porter]3050-the porter . Why , [she]162-rose sellars had never even been to [[his]145-boyne room]1810-his room , [the room with every chair and table of which [Judith]127-judith and [the other children]2552-the other children were so carelessly familiar]1815-the room with every chair and table of which judith and the other children were so carelessly familiar ! It was utterly unlike [Rose]162-rose sellars — and yet [Rose]162-rose sellars of course it must be .... [He]145-boyne flung open [his]145-boyne door , and saw a large shrouded object in the middle of the floor ; an object of odd uncertain shape , imperfectly wrapped in torn newspapers tied with string . The wrappings yielded to a pull , and an ancient walnut cradle with primitive carven ornaments revealed itself to [his]145-boyne petrified gaze . [A cradle]1817-a cradle ! [He]145-boyne threw [himself]145-boyne into a chair and stared at it incredulously , as if [he]145-boyne knew it must be an hallucination . At length [he]145-boyne remembered [the porter]3050-the porter ’s having mentioned a letter , and [his]145-boyne glance strayed to [his]145-boyne chest of drawers . There , perched on the pincushion , was an envelope addressed in a precise familiar hand — the hand of [Terry Wheater]198-terry , always [the scribe of [the other children]2552-the other children]1819-the scribe of the other children when [their]2552-the other children letters were to be subjected to grown up criticism . [Boyne]145-boyne tore the envelope open and read : “ [Darling Martin]193-martin , “[145-boyne] [We]1821-we are all of [us]1821-we sending [you]145-boyne this lovely cradle for [your]145-boyne wedding present because [we]1821-we suppose [you]145-boyne are going to be married very soon , as [we]1821-we think [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars has gone to [Paris]42-paris to order [her]163-mrs. sellars trousseau . And because [you]145-boyne have been like [a father]1822-a father to [us]1821-we [we]1821-we hope and pray [you]145-boyne will soon be [a real father]1823-a real father to [a lot of [lovely little children of [your]145-boyne own]1825-lovely little children of your own]1824-a lot of lovely little children of your own , and [they]1824-a lot of lovely little children of your own will all sleep in this cradle , and then [you]145-boyne will think of [Your]145-boyne loving [Judith]127-judith , [Terry]198-terry , [Blanca]128-blanca — ” Under the last of the rudimentary signatures , [Chipstone]142-chipstone had scrawled [his]142-chipstone mark ; and below it was a scribbled postscript from [Judith]127-judith : “[128-blanca] [Darling]193-martin , [I]0-i open this while [Terry]198-terry ’s not looking to say [he]198-terry said [we]1821-we oughternt to call the craidle lovely , but it is lovely and [we]1821-we wanted [you]193-martin to know it was . [Judith]127-judith . ” In the midnight silence [Boyne]145-boyne sat and laughed and laughed until [a nervous spinster in the next room]3810-a nervous spinster in the next room banged on the wall and called out venomously : “[127-judith] [I]0-i can hear every word [you]193-martin ’re both saying . ” BOOK IV XXV [Boyne]145-boyne had been wrong in imagining that [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars might come back unannounced to assure [herself]163-mrs. sellars of the effect of [her]163-mrs. sellars letter . [She]163-mrs. sellars did not do so ; and after two days [he]145-boyne decided that [he]145-boyne could no longer put off sending some kind of answer . Only , what could [he]145-boyne say ? Being with [the children]505-the children all day and every day , sharing [their]505-the children meals , [their]505-the children games and scrambles , had gradually detached [his]145-boyne thoughts from [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , reducing [her]163-mrs. sellars once more to the lovely shadow [she]163-mrs. sellars had so long been ; with the difference that [she]163-mrs. sellars was now a shadow irrevocably , whereas before [he]145-boyne had always believed [she]163-mrs. sellars might become substantial . Finally [he]145-boyne girt [himself]145-boyne to the task ; and at once [his]145-boyne irritation , [his]145-boyne impatience , seemed to materialise [her]163-mrs. sellars again , as if [she]163-mrs. sellars were fated to grow real only when [she]163-mrs. sellars thwarted or opposed [him]145-boyne . [He]145-boyne wondered if that were another of the peculiarities of being in love . “[127-judith] [People]463-people get too close to [each other]396-each other — [they]463-people ca n’t see [each other]396-each other for the nearness , [I]0-i suppose , ” [he]145-boyne reflected , not altogether satisfied with this explanation . [He]145-boyne wrote : “[0-i] And as to what [you]1829-he propose about [the children]505-the children , do please believe that [I]0-i do n’t mean to be unreasonable — but , unless [I]0-i ’m a little mad , [your]1829-he suggestion apparently amounts to this : that [I]0-i should shove [them]505-the children straight back into the hell [I]0-i ’ve temporarily got [them]505-the children out of . For [them]505-the children that hell , at least the worst of it , is being separated from [each other]396-each other ; and [you]1829-he ask [me]0-i to separate [them]505-the children , when to keep [them]505-the children together is the one thing that [they]505-the children and [I]0-i have been fighting for . [I]0-i make no comment on [your]1829-he proposal to hand over [the younger ones]3359-the younger ones to [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench and [Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte ; [women like [you]1829-he]1833-women like you are what [they]1833-women like you are at the price of not being able even to picture [such people]2991-such people as [those two]1384-those two . But [I]0-i know what [they]505-the children are , and never , as long as [I]0-i can help it , will [I]0-i be a party to giving back into such hands [these children who have trusted [me]0-i]1836-these children who have trusted me . And when [you]1829-he say that [Judith]127-judith , thanks to whom [the younger ones]3359-the younger ones have developed a sense of solidarity and mutual trust in a world which is the very negation of such feelings — that [Judith]127-judith should be asked to see [her]127-judith work deliberately wrecked , and all the feelings [she]127-judith has cultivated in [the others]2515-the others trampled on — ” [He]1829-he broke off , flung down the pen , and sat hopelessly staring at what [he]1829-he had written . “[0-i] Oh , hell — that ’s no use , ” [he]1829-he groaned . The truth was that , even in [his]1829-he most rebellious moments , [he]1829-he could not trick [himself]1829-he into the idea that [he]1829-he had a grievance against [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars . In reality it was the other way round . When [he]1829-he had gone to [Venice]8-venice to negotiate with [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters about the future of [[their]130-the wheaters mutinous family]3812-their mutinous family [he]1829-he had gone as [an affianced man]3813-an affianced man . In pledging [himself]1829-he to [his]1829-he strange guardianship [he]1829-he had virtually pledged [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars also , and without even making [his]1829-he promise depend on [her]163-mrs. sellars consent . [He]1829-he had simply assumed that because [she]163-mrs. sellars loved [him]1829-he [she]163-mrs. sellars would approve of whatever [he]1829-he did , would accept any situation [he]1829-he chose to put [her]163-mrs. sellars in . [He]1829-he had behaved , in short , like [a romantic boy betrothed to [a dreamer of [his]1829-he own age]3815-a dreamer of his own age]3814-a romantic boy betrothed to a dreamer of his own age . All this was true , and it was true also that [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had never reproached [him]1829-he with it . The sense of [her]163-mrs. sellars magnanimity deprived [his]1829-he argument of all its force , and benumbed [his]1829-he angry pen . [He]1829-he pushed away the letter , pulled out another sheet , and scrawled on it : “[0-i] Awfully sorry but can not undo what [I]0-i have done do try to understand [me]0-i dearest . ” Yes , a telegram was better : easier to write , at any rate .... [He]1829-he tore up the letter , put on [his]1829-he hat , and walked down to [the post - office]3575-the post - office with [his]1829-he message . For [its]0-i answer [he]1829-he had only twenty - four hours to wait ; and when [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s telegram came it merely said : “[0-i] [I]0-i do understand [you]0-i letter follows .... ” Well , that was not unsatisfactory , as far as it went ; but when two days more had elapsed , it was not a letter but a small registered packet which [the postman]3817-the postman put into [Boyne]145-boyne ’s hands . Even in the act of signing the receipt , at [his]1829-he very first glance , [he]1829-he had guessed what the packet contained . [He]1829-he went up to [[his]1829-he room]1810-his room , a little dizzy with the abruptness of the event , and angrily ripped off seal and string , revealing the morocco box [he]1829-he had expected to find there . For a minute or two [he]1829-he sat looking at the box , almost as unconscious of what [he]1829-he was feeling as [a man]308-a man in the first minute or two after being stabbed or shot . “[0-i] So that ’s that , ” [he]1829-he said aloud . But what “[0-i] that ” was going to be [he]1829-he had as yet no notion . It was a wound , of course — but was it mortal ? [He]1829-he did n’t know . Suddenly , with a mumbled curse at [his]1829-he own plight , [he]1829-he snapped the box open and saw a thin slip of paper twisted about the sapphire ring . On the paper [he]1829-he read : “[0-i] [I]0-i shall always remember ; [I]0-i shall never resent ; and that is why [I]0-i want [you]1839-you to give this to [some woman who can make [you]1839-you as happy as [you]1839-you have made [me]0-i]1840-some woman who can make you as happy as you have made me . ” [He]1829-he pitched the box and the paper aside , and hid [his]1829-he face in [his]1829-he hands . After all [he]1829-he must have loved [her]1840-some woman who can make you as happy as you have made me , [he]1829-he supposed — or at least the vision of [her]1840-some woman who can make you as happy as you have made me which [their]3820-their long separation had created .... [He]1829-he was roused by a knock , and looking up with dazed eyes saw [Judith Wheater]127-judith standing doubtfully on the threshold . “[1840-some woman who can make you as happy as you have made me] Oh , [Martin]193-martin dear — were [you]193-martin asleep , or have [you]193-martin got one of those beastly headaches ? ” [She]0-i came in and closed the door without waiting for [his]1829-he answer . “[193-martin] Have [I]0-i disturbed [you]193-martin most awfully ? ” [she]0-i questioned , passing [her]0-i cool hand softly over [his]1829-he hair . “[0-i] Yes — no . ” [He]1829-he wondered whether [her]0-i sharp eyes had already detected the open ring - box , and the paper signed with [Rose]162-rose sellars ’s name . But to try to conceal them would only attract [her]0-i attention . [He]1829-he put up [his]1829-he hand and pressed [hers]0-i . “[0-i] Yes — [I]0-i believe [I]0-i have got a beastly headache , ” [he]1829-he said . “[0-i] Then [I]0-i ’d better be off , perhaps ? ” [she]0-i interrupted reluctantly . [She]0-i was bending over [him]1829-he with the look [she]0-i had when one of [the children]505-the children fell and scraped a knee , and [Boyne]145-boyne could not help smiling up into [her]0-i anxious eyes . “[0-i] That depends on what [you]0-i came for . What ’s up ? Anything wrong at _ Rosenglüh _ ? ” “[0-i] Not particularly . But , [you]0-i know , [dear]2469-dear , [we]1842-we have n’t seen [you]0-i for two whole days .... ” “[0-i] [You]0-i have n’t ? ” In the struggle which had been going on in [his]1829-he mind since [he]1829-he had received [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ’s letter [he]1829-he had completely forgotten the passage of time . “[0-i] No more [you]0-i have , ” [he]1829-he exclaimed . “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t realise [I]0-i ’d neglected [you]0-i all so shamefully . Fact is , [I]0-i ’ve been tied up to a boring piece of business that [I]0-i had to get off [my]0-i chest . Sit down and have a cigarette . ” [He]1829-he fumbled for a box , and shoved it across the table to [Judith]127-judith , who had settled down comfortably into [his]1829-he only armchair . “[0-i] Oh , [Martin]193-martin , how lovely to be here all alone with [you]0-i ! ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i do n’t believe [you]0-i ’ll find [me]0-i particularly good company , ” [he]1829-he rejoined , suddenly conscious of the ears of [the acrimonious spinster next door]3822-the acrimonious spinster next door , and wondering if [he]1829-he ought not to propose to [Judith]127-judith to finish [her]127-judith visit in [the garden]2605-the garden . “[0-i] Oh , yes , [I]0-i shall , if [you]193-martin ’ll let [me]0-i talk to [you]193-martin , ” [she]0-i declared with [her]0-i rich candour ; and [Boyne]145-boyne laughed in spite of [himself]145-boyne . “[193-martin] [I]0-i ’ve never been able to prevent [your]0-i talking when [you]0-i wanted to , ” [he]145-boyne remarked , lighting a cigarette ; and [Judith]127-judith thrust [her]127-judith thin shoulder - blades into the chair back , crossed [her]127-judith legs , and sighed contentedly : “[0-i] Few can . ” “[0-i] Well , then — what ’s [your]193-martin news ? ” “[2490-mother] A letter from [mother]2490-mother , this morning . ” The laugh died on [Boyne]145-boyne ’s lips . The expected menace — here it was ! [He]145-boyne knew [Joyce]129-joyce never wrote unless [she]129-joyce had news of overwhelming importance , and usually of a disagreeable nature , to impart . “[2490-mother] What does [she]2490-mother say ? ” [he]145-boyne asked apprehensively . “[2490-mother] Not much . [I]0-i ca n’t quite make out . [She]2490-mother just says [she]2490-mother ’s given up [Gerald]175-gerald , and that [she]2490-mother realises for the first time what a rotten rubbishy life [she]2490-mother ’s been leading , and wants [us]1844-us all to forgive [her]2490-mother for it . ” “[2490-mother] [She]2490-mother _ does _ ? But then — ? ” [Judith]127-judith shrugged away [his]2435-your father anticipations with a faint smile . “[2490-mother] Oh , that ’s not particularly new . [Mother]195-mother always realises about the rottenness of [her]195-mother life when [she]195-mother ’s going to make a change . ” “[195-mother] A change ? That was as far as [his]145-boyne hopes dared venture . But [he]145-boyne met [Judith]127-judith ’s eyes , and was surprised at [their]3825-their untroubled serenity . “[2712-your mother] Are n’t [you]1854-you afraid — ? ” [he]145-boyne began ; and [she]127-judith rejoined immediately : “[1854-you] With [you]2441-father here ? It was as if saying “[0-i] Yes ” to [her]0-i question might be the magic formula of freedom . After all , there lay the ring ; [he]2459-child _ was _ free , technically — had only to utter the words to make them true . But [he]2459-child thrust [his]2459-child hands into [his]2459-child pockets and stood sullenly planted before the corner of the table on which [he]2459-child had tossed the open ring - box . “[0-i] Not in this way , ” [he]2459-child thought . XXVI To [Boyne]145-boyne the calm of the next day brought no reassurance . Too many uncertainties hung close . After a night of pondering [he]2459-child had sent back the ring to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars , with a brief line saying that [she]163-mrs. sellars was of course free if [she]163-mrs. sellars chose to be , but that [he]2459-child could not so regard [himself]2459-child till [they]3837-they had had a talk , and [she]163-mrs. sellars had convinced [him]2459-child that [she]163-mrs. sellars would be happier if [their]3837-they engagement ended . [He]2459-child knew that [he]2459-child was merely using an old formula , the accepted one in such cases , and [he]2459-child longed to get away from it , to be spontaneous , honest , [himself]2459-child . But as [he]2459-child wrote it became clear to [him]2459-child that [he]2459-child was terribly sorry for [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars , terribly sorry for having disappointed [her]163-mrs. sellars ; and that such phrases — the kind [he]2459-child had been brought up on — were the devices of [decent people who hated to give pain , and were even capable of self - sacrifice to avoid it]3838-decent people who hated to give pain , and were even capable of self - sacrifice to avoid it . “[1891-cheerio] After all , [they]1895-they were a lot better than [we]1896-we are , ” [he]2459-child thought ; and the thought softened the close of [his]2459-child letter , and impelled [him]2459-child to add : “[1891-cheerio] Do be patient with [me]0-i , [dear]2469-dear . As soon as [I]0-i can get away [I]0-i ’ll come . ” This done , the whole problem vanished to the background of [his]2459-child mind . [He]2459-child was hardly aware that [he]2459-child was no longer thinking of it . [His]2459-child life of practical activities and swift decisions had given [him]2459-child the habit of easily dismissing matters once dealt with . [He]2459-child flattered [himself]2459-child that [he]2459-child could thus dispose of sentimental cares as easily as of professional problems ; and to a certain extent it was true . Behind the close - knit foreground of [his]2459-child daily life there had hung for years the mirage of [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ; but that mirage was now the phantom of a phantom , and [he]2459-child averted [his]2459-child eyes lest [he]2459-child should find that it had faded into nothing . After [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s letter to [Judith]127-judith there came no more alarms to the _ Pension Rosenglüh _ ; and the days slipped by in a security which seemed satisfying to [Judith]127-judith , and even to [Miss Scope]147-miss scope . But summer was waning in [the high valleys of [the Dolomites]17-the dolomites]3839-the high valleys of the dolomites ; [tourists]3840-tourists were scattering , [the big hotels]915-the big hotels preparing to close . By - and - by a cold sparkle began to fill the air in the early mornings , and at night the temperature fell to freezing . On the lower slopes the larches were turning to pale gold , and [the bare cliffs]3842-the bare cliffs burned with an intenser fire against a sky as hard as metal . The very magic of the hastening days warned [Boyne]145-boyne that they could not last , and that the change in the landscape symbolized another , as imminent , in the fortunes of [[his]145-boyne party]3843-his party . [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had written again — sweetly and reasonably — saying that [she]163-mrs. sellars intended to remain for the present with [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia , who was settled in [Paris]42-paris for two or three months . If [Boyne]145-boyne really wished for another talk , [she]163-mrs. sellars added , [she]163-mrs. sellars hoped [he]145-boyne would be able to come before long ; but in any case [he]145-boyne could count on [her]163-mrs. sellars affectionate understanding . [She]163-mrs. sellars closed [her]163-mrs. sellars letter with a friendly message to [the children]505-the children . [Boyne]145-boyne had been afraid that [Judith]127-judith would revert again to the subject of [his]145-boyne private anxieties ; but [she]127-judith contrived , by a visible effort which made [him]145-boyne feel for the first time that [she]127-judith was really growing up , to keep off the forbidden topic . [His]145-boyne own return to a more equable mood no doubt helped [her]127-judith ; and so did the presence of [the younger children]1114-the younger children and [[their]1114-the younger children preceptors]3846-their preceptors . [Boyne]145-boyne half unconsciously avoided being alone with [Judith]127-judith ; and the shortening days and freshening temperature curtailed [their]1114-the younger children expeditions , and gave more time for games and romps around the cheerful stove in [[the children]505-the children ’s dining - room]3848-the children ’s dining - room . It was there that , one rainy afternoon , [he]145-boyne found [himself]145-boyne sitting with [the younger children]1114-the younger children . [Judith]127-judith had gone with [Miss Scope]147-miss scope and [Nanny]156-nanny to [Toblach]83-toblach , to fit out [the family with autumn underclothes]3850-the family with autumn underclothes , [Terry]198-terry was [upstairs]3110-upstairs , working with [[his]198-terry tutor]2893-his tutor , [Chip]123-chip asleep in [Susan]212-susan ’s care ; and [Blanca]128-blanca , in the corner nearest the stove , was brooding over a torn copy of “[0-i] The Tatler ” with the passionate frown [she]128-blanca always bent on the study of fashion - plates . “[0-i] Skirts _ are _ going to be fuller , ” [she]128-blanca said . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve been telling [Judy]127-judith so for a month .... ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie lifted [her]133-zinnie head from the rapt contemplation of an electric engine which [Bun]135-bun was putting together under [Boyne]145-boyne ’s directions . “[0-i] [The lady that was [here]2434-here today]1898-the lady that was here today had [her]1898-the lady that was here today skirt longer ; a lot longer than [Judy]127-judith ’s , ” [she]133-zinnie remarked . [Beechy]154-beechy , whose attention was also riveted on the motions of [Bun]135-bun ’s agile fingers , interrupted indignantly : “[1898-the lady that was here today] [She]1898-the lady that was here today was n’t pretty like [[our]1900-our [Judy]127-judith]1901-our judy . ” “[503-the lady] [The lady]503-the lady ? [What lady]1903-what lady ? ” [Boyne]145-boyne interposed , vaguely apprehensive . “[1903-what lady] Have [you]1904-you got [a new lodger]1905-a new lodger [here]2434-here ? ” [Blanca]128-blanca re - entered the conversation with a sniff . “[1904-you] [You]1904-you would n’t have taken [her]1898-the lady that was here today for one if [you]1904-you ’d seen [her]1898-the lady that was here today . [She]1898-the lady that was here today ’s not the _ Rosenglüh _ kind . [She]1898-the lady that was here today would certainly have been at [the ‘ Palace ’]1907-the ‘ palace ’ if it had n’t been closed . Not exactly smart , [you]1904-you know — smartness has been so overdone , has n’t it ? [She]1898-the lady that was here today was — what ’s that funny old word that [Scopy]132-scopy loves?—distinguished . At least , [I]0-i _ think _ that ’s what distinguished means ... the way [that lady]400-that lady looked . [Her]1898-the lady that was here today clothes awfully plain ; but not the least ‘ sports . ’ Rather governessy , really ... like Scopy young , if [Chanel]256-chanel could have dressed [her]1898-the lady that was here today .... ” [Blanca]128-blanca paused , reduced to silence by the hopelessness of the attempt to fit [her]128-blanca words to [her]128-blanca meaning . [Boyne]145-boyne looked up from the engine . “[256-chanel] Perhaps when [you]1904-you ’ve finished with [her]1898-the lady that was here today clothes [you]1904-you ’ll tell [me]0-i what [she]1898-the lady that was here today came for . ” “[1904-you] To see [you]1904-you — [you—_you]1904-you _ ! ” cried [Zinnie]133-zinnie , executing a double handspring [she]133-zinnie had lately learned from [Bun]135-bun , to the despair of [Beechy]154-beechy , who was so fat that [she]154-beechy invariably collapsed midway of the same attempt . “[1904-you] [I]0-i could have told [you]1904-you that , ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie added , “[0-i] for [I]0-i spoke to [her]1898-the lady that was here today . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i did ? What impertinence ! ” cried [Blanca]128-blanca , bounding from [her]128-blanca seat . [Bun]135-bun , flat on [his]3853-his stomach , [his]3853-his legs in the air , [his]3853-his curls mixed with the engine , chanted over [his]3853-his shoulder : “[1909-girls] [Girls]1909-girls are always butting in — butting in .... ” “[1909-girls] [Nasty rotters]1910-nasty rotters , [girls]1909-girls are ! ” sympathised [Beechy]154-beechy , always ready to champion [[her]154-beechy brother]372-her brother , and not as yet very clear as to [her]154-beechy own sex . [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s reprisals were checked by the discovery that [[the landlady]3160-the landlady ’s gold - fish aquarium]3856-the landlady ’s gold - fish aquarium , which usually stood in [the larger and colder public dining - room]3857-the larger and colder public dining - room , had been brought in and placed on a stand before the window . [She]133-zinnie tiptoed off to inspect [this forbidden Paradise]3858-this forbidden paradise while [Boyne]145-boyne got to [his]145-boyne feet and picked up the electric wire . “[1910-nasty rotters] Where ’s the battery ? Are [your]1912-your rails straight ? Now , then , [Bun]135-bun , are [you]1912-your ready ? ” [He]145-boyne turned to [Zinnie]133-zinnie . “[135-bun] To see _ [me]0-i _ , did [you]0-i say ? What on [earth]2464-earth for ? Did [she]1914-she tell [you]0-i ? ” “[1914-she] Tell [Zinnie]133-zinnie ! So likely ! ” ejaculated [Blanca]128-blanca with a shrug . [She]128-blanca turned to [Boyne]145-boyne , drawing [her]128-blanca lids together with [her]128-blanca pretty cat - like smile . “[1914-she] _ Félicitations , [cher ami]1915-cher ami . Elle était plutôt bien , [la dame]1916-la dame , vous savez . _ ” “[1916-la dame] Oh , shucks — zif [we]1917-we did n’t all of [us]1917-we talk French ! ” commented [Zinnie]133-zinnie , still watchfully circling about [the aquarium]3859-the aquarium . The door opened , and [a maid]771-a maid came in with a card which [she]771-a maid handed hesitatingly to [Boyne]145-boyne . The name on it was : _ [Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte _ , and underneath was written : “[145-boyne] begs [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne to see [her]1914-she on important business . ” [Boyne]145-boyne crammed the card into [his]145-boyne pocket without speaking , conscious that the eyes of [all the children]3133-all the children were upon [him]145-boyne . “[145-boyne] It ’s [the lady]503-the lady , it ’s [the lady]503-the lady , [I]0-i know it is ! ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie piped . “[503-the lady] [I]0-i heard [her]503-the lady say [she]503-the lady was coming back to see [Martin]193-martin . [She]503-the lady ’s come all the way from [Rome]66-rome to see [him]145-boyne . ” [Blanca]128-blanca , at [his]145-boyne side , had slid an insinuating hand in [his]145-boyne . “[503-the lady] From [Rome]66-rome ? Oh , [Martin]193-martin , who is it ? May n’t [I]0-i come with [you]193-martin , at any rate as far as the door ? It ’s nothing important — [I’ll]0-i be back in a few minutes . ” [He]145-boyne thanked [his]145-boyne stars that [the lady]503-the lady had sent in [her]503-the lady card instead of confiding [her]503-the lady name to [the maid]825-the maid . [He]145-boyne could not imagine what [[his]145-boyne noble visitor]3864-his noble visitor wanted of [him]145-boyne , but the very sight of the name had let loose all [his]145-boyne fears . As [he]145-boyne left [the room]1180-the room [he]145-boyne turned and sent a last glance toward [the group sprawling around the engine , which had after all refused to start]3866-the group sprawling around the engine , which had after all refused to start — orange curls mixed with brown and dusky , sunburnt legs kicking high , voices mixed in breathless controversy . How healthy and jolly [they]3866-the group sprawling around the engine , which had after all refused to start all looked ! And how good [they]3866-the group sprawling around the engine , which had after all refused to start smelt , with that mixed smell of woollen garments , and soap , and the fruity fragrance of [young bodies]3867-young bodies tumbled about together . As [Boyne]145-boyne looked back at [them]3866-the group sprawling around the engine , which had after all refused to start [he]145-boyne thought how funny and dear [they]3866-the group sprawling around the engine , which had after all refused to start were , and how different [the world]307-the world might have been if [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars had freed [herself]162-rose sellars when [he]145-boyne and [she]162-rose sellars were still young .... [A lady with a slim straight back]3869-a lady with a slim straight back was standing in [the sitting - room]1172-the sitting - room , attentively examining the stuffed eagle above the stove . [She]3869-a lady with a slim straight back turned at [Boyne]145-boyne ’s entrance and revealed a small oval face , somewhat pale , with excessively earnest gray eyes , and a well - modelled nose and brow . It puzzled [him]145-boyne to discover why an assemblage of such agreeable features did not produce an effect of beauty ; but a second glance suggested that it was because [[their]3866-the group sprawling around the engine , which had after all refused to start owner]3871-their owner had never thought about being beautiful . That [she]3869-a lady with a slim straight back had graver preoccupations was immediately evident from the tone of [her]3869-a lady with a slim straight back slow and carefully - modulated speech . “[0-i] [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne ? ” [she]3869-a lady with a slim straight back asked , as though [she]3869-a lady with a slim straight back feared [he]145-boyne might deny [his]145-boyne identity , and was immediately prepared , if [he]145-boyne did , to disprove the denial ; and on [his]145-boyne saying that [he]145-boyne was , [she]3869-a lady with a slim straight back continued , with a touch of nervousness : “[145-boyne] [I]0-i have come all the way from [Rome]66-rome to see [[my]0-i children]2493-my children . ” “[145-boyne] [[Your]145-boyne children]1923-your children — ? ” [Boyne]145-boyne echoed in astonishment ; and [she]3869-a lady with a slim straight back corrected [herself]3869-a lady with a slim straight back with a slight blush . “[549-the prince] [I]0-i should say [the Prince]549-the prince ’s . Or [[my]0-i step - children]1925-my step - children . But [I]0-i hate the word , for [I]0-i feel about [them]1923-your children already as if [they]1923-your children were [my]0-i own . ” [Boyne]145-boyne pushed an armchair forward , and [she]3869-a lady with a slim straight back sat down , crossing [her]3869-a lady with a slim straight back feet neatly , and satisfying [herself]3869-a lady with a slim straight back that the skirt which [Zinnie]133-zinnie described as long was so adjusted as not to reveal too much of the pretty legs above [her]3869-a lady with a slim straight back slender ankles . “[0-i] [They]1923-your children _ are _ [here]2434-here — [Astorre]151-astorre and [Beatrice]150-beatrice ? ” [Boyne]145-boyne heard [her]3869-a lady with a slim straight back with dismay , but kept up a brave exterior . “[150-beatrice] [Here]2434-here ? Oh , yes — certainly . [Mr.]1928-mr. and [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater sent [all the children]3133-all the children [here]2434-here a few weeks ago — for the climate . ” [Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte met this with a smile of faint incredulity . “[120-mrs. wheater] In [your]1931-you charge , [I]0-i understand ? Yes . But of course [you]1931-you must know that [Mr.]1932-mr. and [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater have really no business whatever to send [[my]0-i husband]2839-my husband ’s children [here]2434-here , or anywhere else . ” [She]0-i paused a moment , and added : “[120-mrs. wheater] And [I]0-i have come to take [them]3133-all the children [home]290-home . ” “[0-i] Oh , [Princess]1936-princess — ” [Boyne]145-boyne exclaimed . [She]0-i raised [her]0-i handsome eyebrows slightly , and said : “[1936-princess] [You]1931-you seem surprised . ” “[1931-you] Well — yes . At any rate , [I]0-i ’m awfully sorry . ” “[0-i] Sorry ? Do n’t [you]1931-you think that [children]2617-children ought to be in [[their]2617-children own [home]290-home]1938-their own home , with [[their]2617-children own parents]1940-their own parents ? ” “[1931-you] Well , that depends . ” “[1931-you] Depends ! How can it ever — ? ” [She]0-i crimsoned suddenly , and then grew even paler than before . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t suppose [you]1931-you intend to insinuate — ? ” [She]0-i broke off , and [he]145-boyne saw that [her]0-i eyes had filled with tears . “[1931-you] For , of course , that [I]0-i wo n’t tolerate for a single instant , ” [she]0-i added a little breathlessly , as though throwing [herself]0-i on [his]145-boyne mercy in a conflict [she]0-i felt to be unequal if it should turn on [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte ’s merits as [a father]1822-a father . [Boyne]145-boyne felt so sorry for [her]0-i that [he]145-boyne answered : “[0-i] [I]0-i was n’t thinking of insinuating anything . [I]0-i only meant that [this little group of [children]2617-children]1941-this little group of children have always been together , and it has made [them]1941-this little group of children so fond of [each other]396-each other that [they]1941-this little group of children really regard [themselves]1941-this little group of children as [one family]1944-one family . It seems a pity , it seems cruel .... ” “[152-prince buondelmonte] Cruel ? ” [she]0-i interrupted . “[152-prince buondelmonte] The real cruelty has been to deprive the poor little things for so long of [a father]1822-a father ’s influence , to take advantage of ... of [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte ’s misfortunes , [his]152-prince buondelmonte undeserved misfortunes , to keep [[his]152-prince buondelmonte children]1251-his children without [a real home]1947-a real home , without family associations , without ... without any guiding principle .... ” [She]0-i leaned forward , [her]0-i grave almost terrified eyes on [Boyne]145-boyne . “[1251-his children] What guidance have [they]1251-his children had ? What moral training ? What religious education ? Have [you]0-i or [[your]0-i friends]1948-your friends ever thought that ? It ’s a big responsibility [you]0-i ’ve assumed . Have [you]0-i never thought [you]0-i might some day be asked to account for the use [you]0-i ’ve made of it ? ” [Boyne]145-boyne heard [her]0-i with a growing wonder . [She]0-i spoke slowly but fluently , not as if repeating a lesson learned by rote , but as though [she]0-i were sustaining a thesis with the ease of [a practised orator]3873-a practised orator . There was something didactic — perhaps forensic , rather — in [her]0-i glib command of [her]0-i subject . [He]145-boyne saw that [she]0-i was trembling with nervousness , yet that [her]0-i nerves would never control [her]0-i ; and [his]145-boyne heart sank . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m afraid [I]0-i ca n’t answer all [your]0-i questions , ” [he]145-boyne said , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve only been with [the children]505-the children for a few weeks . [Mr.]1950-mr. and [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater asked [me]0-i to keep an eye on [them]505-the children during the ... the settling of certain family matters ; but [I]0-i can assure [you]0-i that since [I]0-i ’ve known [them]505-the children [they]505-the children ’ve always been in an atmosphere of the greatest kindness and affection ; and [I]0-i ’m inclined to think that ’s the most important thing of all . ” [Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte listened attentively , [her]0-i brows drawn together in a cautious frown . “[0-i] Of course [I]0-i ’m not prepared to admit that unreservedly . [I]0-i mean , the kindness of [salaried assistants]1951-salaried assistants or [...]1952-... or of [inexperienced persons]1953-inexperienced persons may do as much harm as good . Games , for instance , should be quite as carefully supervised as studies ... but [I]0-i know how little importance [Europe]24-europe still attaches to these supremely vital questions . ” No adequate answer occurred to [Boyne]145-boyne , and [she]0-i rose from [her]0-i seat with an impatient gesture . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know that there is any use in continuing a discussion which would not , in any case , affect [my]0-i final decision , or [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte ’s — ” “[152-prince buondelmonte] Oh , do n’t say that ! ” [Boyne]145-boyne exclaimed . “[152-prince buondelmonte] Do n’t — ? ” “[152-prince buondelmonte] Not if it means [you]0-i wo n’t listen to any plea — won’t first consider what it ’s going to be to [these children]3343-these children to be suddenly uprooted .... ” [She]0-i interrupted : “[152-prince buondelmonte] It was not [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte who first uprooted [them]3343-these children . [Boyne]145-boyne sat speechless , wondering how much [the granddaughter of [Dr. Judson Tring]258-dr. judson tring]3877-the granddaughter of dr. judson tring believed of what [she]0-i was saying , and to what extent [her]0-i astounding version of the case was the result of patient schooling on [[her]0-i husband]411-her husband ’s part . [He]145-boyne concluded that [she]0-i was incapable of deliberate deception , and fully convinced of the truth of [her]0-i assertions ; and [he]145-boyne knew this would make it all the harder to reason with [her]0-i . For a few moments [the two]395-the two faced [each other]396-each other without speaking ; then [Boyne]145-boyne said : “[120-mrs. wheater] But surely the fact that [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte did leave [[his]152-prince buondelmonte children]1251-his children with [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ought to be considered . Now all that is changed . Since [our]1972-our marriage [we]1972-our have fortunately been able to buy back [the Buondelmonte palace in [Rome]66-rome]1973-the buondelmonte palace in rome , and [I]0-i am as anxious as [he]152-prince buondelmonte is that [[his]152-prince buondelmonte children]1251-his children should come and live with [us]1972-our [there]2439-there . ” [Boyne]145-boyne stood up impatiently . The talk was assuming more and more the tone of a legal debate ; conducted on such lines there seemed no reason for its ever ending . If [one]2514-one accepted [[the Princess]3874-the princess ’s premises]3884-the princess ’s premises — and [Boyne]145-boyne had no way of disproving them — it was difficult to question [her]3874-the princess conclusions . All [he]145-boyne could do was to plead [his]145-boyne lack of authority . [He]145-boyne reminded [[his]145-boyne visitor]3885-his visitor that [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater , to whom , for whatever reason , [[their]1251-his children father]555-their father had confided [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]154-beechy , had , in [her]3874-the princess turn , passed [them]1251-his children over to [[their]1251-his children present guardians]3887-their present guardians , who were therefore answerable to [her]3874-the princess , and [her]3874-the princess only . [The Princess]3874-the princess ’s lips parted nervously on the first syllable of a new protest ; but [Boyne]145-boyne interrupted : “[1936-princess] [Princess]1936-princess ! It ’s really so simple — [I]0-i mean the legal part . If [[your]1936-princess husband]2845-your husband has a right to [[his]2845-your husband children]1251-his children , [no one]2415-no one can prevent [his]2845-your husband getting [them]1251-his children . The real issue seems to [me]0-i quite different . It concerns only [the children]505-the children [themselves]505-the children . [They]505-the children ’re so desperately anxious not to be separated ; [they]505-the children ’re so happy together . Of course none of that is [my]0-i doing . [It]1981-it ’s [[their]505-the children eldest step - sister]1982-their eldest step - sister — or whatever [you]0-i like to call [her]1981-it — [[Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s eldest daughter]1983-mrs. wheater ’s eldest daughter , [Judith]127-judith , who has kept the six of [them]505-the children together through all the ups and downs of [[their]505-the children parents]507-their parents ’ matrimonial troubles . Before [you]0-i decide — ” [The Princess]3874-the princess lifted an imperative hand . “[0-i] [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne — [I’m]1985-i’m sorry . [I]0-i can see that [you]145-boyne ’re very fond of [the children]505-the children . But fondness is not everything ... it may even be a source of moral danger . [I]0-i ’m afraid [we]1987-we should n’t altogether agree as to the choice of [the persons [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater has left in charge of [them]505-the children]1988-the persons mrs. wheater has left in charge of them — not even as to [[her]120-mrs. wheater own daughter]1989-her own daughter . The soul of [a child]435-a child — ” “[435-a child] Yes , ” [Boyne]145-boyne acquiesced ; “[435-a child] that ’s the very thing [I]0-i ’m pleading for . If [you]145-boyne could see [them]505-the children together .... ” “[145-boyne] Oh , but [I]0-i intend to , ” [she]0-i responded briskly . [You]145-boyne do n’t suppose [I]0-i came from [Rome]66-rome for any other reason ? But [you]145-boyne need n’t be afraid of [my]0-i kidnapping [them]505-the children . ” [Her]0-i eyes became severe again . “[145-boyne] [I]0-i hope it wo n’t have to come to that ; but of course [I]0-i intend to see [[my]0-i husband]2839-my husband ’s children . ” “[145-boyne] Oh , all right , ” [Boyne]145-boyne agreed . [He]145-boyne was beginning to divine , under [her]0-i hard mechanical manner , something young and untried , something [one]2514-one might still reach and appeal to ; and [he]145-boyne reflected that the sight of [the children]505-the children would perhaps prove to be the simplest way of reaching it . “[145-boyne] [The children]505-the children are playing in [the other room]1993-the other room , ” [he]145-boyne said . “[505-the children] Shall [I]0-i go and get [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]154-beechy , or do [you]145-boyne prefer to see [them]505-the children first with [the others]2515-the others ? ” [The Princess]3874-the princess said , yes , [she]3874-the princess thought [she]3874-the princess would like to see [them]505-the children all together at [their]505-the children games . “[145-boyne] Games have such a profound psychological significance , ” [she]3874-the princess explained with a smile . “[145-boyne] Well , [I]0-i ’m glad [you]145-boyne ’re going to take [them]505-the children by surprise . It ’s always the best way with [children]2617-children . [You]145-boyne ’ll see what [jolly little beggars]1996-jolly little beggars [they]2617-children are ; how [they]2617-children all understand [each other]396-each other ; how well [they]2617-children get on together .... [I]0-i ’m counting on the sight to plead [our]1998-our cause . ” [He]145-boyne led [her]3874-the princess down [the passage]3893-the passage and threw open the door of [[the children]505-the children ’s dining - room]3848-the children ’s dining - room . On the threshold [they]1998-our were met by a burst of angry voices . Everything in [the room]1180-the room was noise and confusion , and the opening of the door remained unheeded . In all [his]145-boyne experience of [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters , [Boyne]145-boyne had never before seen [them]130-the wheaters engaged in so fierce a conflict : it seemed incredible that [the participants]3897-the participants should be only four . [Some]3898-some were screaming , some vituperating , [some]3898-some doing both , and butting at [each other]396-each other , head down , at the same time . The floor was strewn with the wreckage of battle , but the agitated movements of [the combatants]3901-the combatants made the origin of the dispute hard to discover . “[214-god] [God]214-god , ” [Boyne]145-boyne ejaculated , stepping back . [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s voice rose furiously above the others . “[214-god] It was n’t [me’t]1999-me’t upset [the ’ quarium]2000-the ’ quarium , [I]0-i swear it was n’t , [Blanca]128-blanca — and [those two wops]2001-those two wops know it just as well as [I]0-i do .... ” [Bun]135-bun squealed back : “[0-i] It was [you]0-i that tried to bathe [Chip]123-chip ’s rabbit in it , [[you]0-i dirty little lying sneak]2002-you dirty little lying sneak , [you]0-i ! ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i did n’t , neither ; but [Nanny]156-nanny do n’t never give [him]123-chip enough to drink , ’ n so [I]0-i just ran up and brought [him]123-chip down while [Chip]123-chip was asleep , ’ n if [Beechy]154-beechy had n’t gone and butted in — ” “[154-beechy] [[You]0-i rotten little liar]2003-you rotten little liar , [you]0-i , [you]0-i know [you]0-i were trying to find out if rabbits can swim . ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i was n’t , either . [Blanca]128-blanca , reluctantly torn from [her]128-blanca study of “[241-the tatler] [The Tatler]241-the tatler , ” had risen from the stove - corner and was distributing slaps and shakes with a practised hand . [Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte , pale and erect , stood in the doorway and returned [her]128-blanca gaze . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall think just what [I]0-i expected to , ” [she]128-blanca said coldly . [She]128-blanca turned to [Boyne]145-boyne , and continued in a trembling voice : “[0-i] It is just as [I]0-i was saying : nothing in [a child]435-a child ’s education should be left to chance . XXVII “[0-i] Take away [[my]0-i children]2493-my children ?
