All [I]0-i do is just to try to look after [them]505-the children . ” Something in [her]3874-the princess accent seemed to touch [the Princess]3874-the princess , who seated [herself]3874-the princess in the chair on which [she]3874-the princess had been leaning , made sure that [her]3874-the princess skirts did not expose more than a decent extent of ankle , and began to speak in a friendlier tone . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sure [you]193-martin ’re perfectly devoted to [them]505-the children — that all [you]193-martin want is what ’s best for [them]505-the children . ” [Judith]127-judith paused a moment . “[193-martin] That depends on what [you]0-i mean by best . [The other]548-the other hesitated , and [she]3874-the princess pressed on : “[0-i] Because [nobody]2418-nobody can possibly love [them]505-the children as much as [Martin]193-martin and [Miss Scope]147-miss scope and [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i see . [Boyne]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith sat late in [the little sitting - room]1130-the little sitting - room , asking [themselves]505-the children that , after [the Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte had gone . It had been [Boyne]145-boyne ’s idea — and almost [his]145-boyne only contribution to the fiery dialogue between [the two]395-the two — that [the Princess]3874-the princess should be invited to return in the evening and share [the children]505-the children ’s supper . The proposal , seconded by [Judith]127-judith after a swift glance at [Boyne]145-boyne , seemed to surprise [[their]505-the children visitor]3928-their visitor , and to disarm [her]3874-the princess growing hostility . The encounter with [Judith]127-judith had not tended to soften [her]127-judith feelings , and for a moment it looked as if things were taking a dangerous turn ; but [Boyne]145-boyne had intervened with the suggestion that [the Princess]3874-the princess , having seen [the children]505-the children at [their]505-the children worst , should be given a chance to meet [them]505-the children in pleasanter circumstances . [He]145-boyne added that [he]145-boyne would be glad of another talk with [her]3874-the princess ; and as [she]3874-the princess did not leave till the next day , and was staying at [an hotel near [his]145-boyne own]3931-an hotel near his own , [he]145-boyne asked if [he]145-boyne might walk back there with [her]3874-the princess , and fetch [her]3874-the princess down again for supper . [She]3874-the princess accepted both suggestions , and after a mollified farewell to [Judith]127-judith , started up [the hill]3071-the hill with [Boyne]145-boyne . [He]145-boyne saw that [she]3874-the princess was still inwardly agitated , and clutching desperately at what remained of [her]3874-the princess resolution ; and [he]145-boyne put in a pacifying word in excuse of [Judith]127-judith ’s irritability , and assured [the Princess]3874-the princess that [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters would make no difficulty in recognising [the Prince]549-the prince ’s legal right to [[his]145-boyne children]1251-his children . The real question , [he]145-boyne went on , was surely quite different ; was one of delicacy , of good taste , if [you]3936-you chose to call it so . [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater had taken in [Beechy]154-beechy and [Bun]135-bun when [[their]1251-his children father]555-their father was not able to ; [she]120-mrs. wheater had given [them]1251-his children the same advantages as [[her]120-mrs. wheater own children]3938-her own children ( [the Princess]3874-the princess , at this , sounded an ironic murmur ) , and had shown [them]1251-his children the same affection ; though all [she]120-mrs. wheater had done , [Boyne]145-boyne hastened to add , was as nothing to the patient unflagging devotion of [[their]1251-his children step - sister]3940-their step - sister — who technically was n’t even [a step - sister]3941-a step - sister . On that theme [Boyne]145-boyne did not have to choose [his]145-boyne words . [They]3942-they poured out with a vehemence surprising even to [himself]145-boyne . [The Princess]3874-the princess , [he]145-boyne supposed — whatever [her]3874-the princess educational theories were — would agree that the first thing [young children]3944-young children needed was to be loved enough ; above all , [children]2617-children exposed as [they]2617-children were in [the Wheater world]1024-the wheater world , where every new divorce and remarriage thrust [them]2617-children again into unfamiliar surroundings . Through all these changes , [Boyne]145-boyne pointed out , [Judith]127-judith had clung to [[her]127-judith little flock]3947-her little flock , loving [them]3947-her little flock , and teaching [them]3947-her little flock to love [each other]396-each other ; [she]127-judith had even inspired [governesses]403-governesses and [nurses]2666-nurses with [her]127-judith own passionate fidelity , so that in a welter of change [the group]848-the group had remained together , protected and happy . If only , [Boyne]145-boyne pleaded , [they]848-the group could be left as [they]848-the group were for a few years longer ; perhaps if [they]848-the group could it would be found , when [they]848-the group finally rejoined [[their]848-the group respective families]3952-their respective families , that under [Judith]127-judith ’s care [they]848-the group had been better prepared for life than if [[their]848-the group parents]507-their parents had insisted on separating [them]848-the group . [The Princess]3874-the princess listened attentively to [his]145-boyne arguments , but said little in reply ; [Boyne]145-boyne suspected that [she]3874-the princess had been taught not to commit [herself]3874-the princess unless [she]3874-the princess was on familiar ground , and apparently [she]3874-the princess was unfamiliar with the kind of plea [he]145-boyne made . The sentiments [he]145-boyne appealed to seemed to have a sort of romantic interest for [her]3874-the princess , as feudal ruins might have for [an intelligent traveller]3955-an intelligent traveller ; but [he]145-boyne saw that there were no words for them in [her]3874-the princess vocabulary . When [they]848-the group went back to the _ Pension Rosenglüh _ for supper [the children]505-the children , headed by [Terry]198-terry and [Blanca]128-blanca , presented a picture of such roseate harmony that [the Princess]3874-the princess was evidently struck . To complete the impression , [Chip]123-chip , who was always brought down at this hour to say goodnight , walked in led by [Nanny]156-nanny , placed a confiding palm in [the strange lady]3958-the strange lady ’s , said “[193-martin] Howoodoo , ” and wound [his]123-chip fingers in [her]3874-the princess hair , which [he]123-chip pronounced to be “[123-chip] [ike Oody’s”—for Chip]123-chip was beginning to generalise and to co - ordinate , though [[his]123-chip educators]3959-his educators could not have put a name to the process , any more than [the Princess]3874-the princess could to the instinctive motions of the heart . Supper , on the whole , was a success . [The children]505-the children were unusually well - behaved ; even [Zinnie]133-zinnie subdued [herself]133-zinnie to the prevailing tone . [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]154-beechy , seated one on each side of [[their]505-the children new step - mother]3962-their new step - mother , and visibly awed by [her]3962-their new step - mother proximity , demeaned [themselves]505-the children with a restraint which [the Princess]3874-the princess made several timid attempts to break down . It was evident that what [she]3962-their new step - mother had said about the prohibition of fire - arms still rankled in [Bun]135-bun , and [both children]3964-both children were prim and non - committal , as [they]3964-both children always were — to a degree unknown to [the others]2515-the others — once [their]3964-both children distrust was aroused . [The Princess]3874-the princess , to conceal [her]3874-the princess embarrassment , discoursed volubly about the historic interest of [the ancestral palace]3967-the ancestral palace which [[her]3874-the princess husband]411-her husband had succeeded in repurchasing , and promised [Bun]135-bun that [one of [[its]3967-the ancestral palace spacious apartments]3970-its spacious apartments]3969-one of its spacious apartments should be fitted up as [a modern playroom]3971-a modern playroom , in which [he]411-her husband would learn to replace [his]411-her husband artless antics by the newest feats in scientific gymnastics . [Bun]135-bun ’s eyes glittered ; but after a reflective silence [he]411-her husband shook [his]411-her husband head . “[2046-we] [We]2046-we could n’t , ” [he]411-her husband said , “[2046-we] not ’ f [we]2046-we wanted to the most awful way ; ’cos [we]2046-we ’ve all sworen a noath on [Scopy]132-scopy ’s book that [we]2046-we would n’t . ” This solemn self - reminder caused [Beechy]154-beechy ’s eyes to fill , and [Zinnie]133-zinnie to cry out : “[2046-we] [We]2046-we ’d be damned black - hearted [villains]2047-villains if [we]2046-we did ! ” [The Princess]3874-the princess looked distressed . “[2047-villains] What do [you]2048-you mean by swearing an oath , [Astorre]151-astorre ? ” [she]3874-the princess asked , pronouncing the words as if they were explosives and must be handled with caution . “[2048-you] [I]0-i mean a nawful oath , ” [Bun]135-bun explained , with an effort at greater accuracy . “[0-i] But [I]0-i ca n’t bear to hear [children]2617-children talk about swearing — or about [villains]2047-villains either , ” [[his]2048-you step - mother]3973-his step - mother continued , turning with a reproachful smile to [Zinnie]133-zinnie , who promptly rejoined : “[0-i] Then [you]2048-you ’d better not ever have any of [your]2048-you own ” ; which caused [the Princess]3874-the princess to blush and lower [her]3874-the princess grave eyes . To hide [her]3874-the princess constraint [she]3874-the princess addressed a question to [the company in general]3975-the company in general . “[0-i] What is this book that [[you]2051-you [children]2617-children]3189-you children speak of as [Miss Scope]147-miss scope ’s ? The choice of books is so imp — ” [None of [the younger children]1114-the younger children]3976-none of the younger children could pronounce the name of the book , and [they]3976-none of the younger children therefore preserved a respectful silence ; but [Terry]198-terry interrupted with a laugh : “[0-i] Oh , it ’s the book that [Scopy]132-scopy cures [us]2054-us all out of . It ’s called the ‘ Cyclopædia of Nursery Remedies ’ . ” [The Princess]3874-the princess received this with a dubious frown . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t remember a book of that name being used in [our]2054-us courses at [Lohengrin]93-lohengrin ; is it a recent publication ? ” [Miss Scope]147-miss scope sat rigid and majestic at the opposite table - end . Thus directly challenged , [she]0-i replied reassuringly : “[0-i] Dear [me]0-i , no ; it ’s been thoroughly tested . [[My]0-i mother]3270-my mother and all [[my]0-i aunts]2056-my aunts used it in [[their]2057-their families]2058-their families . [I]0-i believe even [[my]0-i grandmother]2059-my grandmother — ” “[2059-my grandmother] Even [[your]0-i grandmother]2789-your grandmother ? But then the book must be completely obsolete — and probably very dangerous . ” [Miss Scope]147-miss scope smiled undauntedly . “[2059-my grandmother] Oh , [I]0-i think not . [[My]0-i mother]3270-my mother always found it most reliable . [We]2054-us were fourteen in [the family]289-the family , ten miles from [the railway]2063-the railway , in [Lancashire]94-lancashire , and [she]3270-my mother brought [us]2054-us through all [our]2054-us illnesses on it . In [a family of that size]2064-a family of that size one could n’t always be sending for [the doctor]1137-the doctor .... ” This gave [[her]147-miss scope interlocutor]3876-her interlocutor ’s dismay a new turn . “[0-i] Fourteen in [[your]0-i family]2066-your family ? [You]0-i do n’t mean to say [[your]0-i mother]2712-your mother had [fourteen children]2068-fourteen children ? ” [Miss Scope]147-miss scope replied with undisguised pride that that was what [she]147-miss scope did mean ; and [the Princess]3874-the princess laid down [her]3874-the princess fork with the air of one about to spring up and do battle against such deplorable abuses . “[0-i] It ’s incredible ... ” [she]0-i began ; then broke off to add in a lower tone : “[0-i] But [I]0-i suppose that at that time — ” [her]0-i glance at [Miss Scope]147-miss scope ’s white head seemed to say that the whole business was an old unhappy far - off thing , and [she]0-i resumed more hopefully : “[0-i] In [the United States]95-the united states such matters will soon be regulated by legislation .... ” [She]0-i met [Miss Scope]147-miss scope ’s horrified stare , and glanced nervously about the table , as if realising that the subject , even at [Lohengrin]93-lohengrin , might hardly be considered suitable for [juvenile ears]3981-juvenile ears . To relieve [her]0-i embarrassment [she]0-i leaned across [Bun]135-bun and addressed [herself]0-i once more to [Zinnie]133-zinnie . “[2069-you] [You]2069-you must be [[Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench ’s little girl]2070-lady wrench ’s little girl , are n’t [you]2069-you , [[my]0-i dear]2807-my dear ? Only think , [I]0-i saw [[your]2069-you mother]2712-your mother the other day in [Venice]8-venice , ” [she]0-i said , in an affable attempt to change the conversation . [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s face sparkled with curiosity . “[0-i] Oh , did [you]2069-you see [her]2712-your mother , truly ? What did [she]2712-your mother have on , do [you]2069-you remember ? ” “[2712-your mother] Have on — ? ” [The Princess]3874-the princess hesitated , with a puzzled look , and [Judith]127-judith intervened : “[2712-your mother] [Zinnie]133-zinnie has a passion for pretty clothes . ” “[133-zinnie] [I]0-i think _ [yours]2069-you _ are awfully pretty , ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie insidiously put in , addressing [the Princess]3874-the princess ; and added : “[133-zinnie] Are [you]2069-you sure [[my]0-i mother]3270-my mother did n’t give [you]2069-you any presents to give [us]2074-us ? ” “[133-zinnie] [Zinnie]133-zinnie ! ” came reprovingly from [Miss Scope]147-miss scope . [The Princess]3874-the princess shook [her]3874-the princess head . “[133-zinnie] No ; [she]3270-my mother did n’t give [me]0-i any presents . Perhaps [she]3270-my mother thinks [you]2069-you ought to come and get them . But [she]3270-my mother gave [me]0-i a message for [you]2069-you when [she]3270-my mother heard that [I]0-i was coming here — [she]3270-my mother told [me]0-i to tell [you]2069-you how dreadfully [she]3270-my mother wanted to see [[her]3270-my mother little girl]2075-her little girl again . ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie grew scarlet with excitement and gratification ; such notice lifted [her]133-zinnie at once above [the other children]2552-the other children . But an afterthought soon damped [her]133-zinnie pride . “[3270-my mother] If [she]3270-my mother really feels like that [I]0-i ’d of thought [she]3270-my mother ’d of sent [me]0-i a present , ” [she]133-zinnie objected doubtfully . “[3270-my mother] Presents are n’t everything . And it ’s not very nice to associate [the people [you]2069-you love]2076-the people you love with the thought of what [they]2076-the people you love may be going to give [you]2069-you . Besides , ” continued [the Princess]3874-the princess illogically , “[2712-your mother] if [[your]2069-you mother]2712-your mother is so generous , think how many presents [you]2069-you ’d get if [you]2069-you were always with [her]3270-my mother . ” This seemed to plunge [Zinnie]133-zinnie into fresh perplexity . “[3270-my mother] Always with [her]3270-my mother ? How could [I]0-i be ? [She]3270-my mother does n’t want to ’ dopt [the lot of [us]2079-us]2492-the lot of us , does [she]3270-my mother ? ’Cos [you]2069-you see [we]2079-us ’ve all sweared — ” “[2069-you] [You]2069-you must n’t say swear , ” said [the Princess]257-the princess buondelmonte . “[2069-you] Swore , ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie corrected [herself]133-zinnie . “[0-i] [I]0-i mean , not use such words , ” [the Princess]3874-the princess explained . “[0-i] But [we]2079-us _ did _ , ” said [Zinnie]133-zinnie , “[2079-us] on [Scopy]132-scopy ’s book ; so [she]3270-my mother ’d have to ’ dopt [us]2079-us all , with [Judy]127-judith . Do [you]0-i s’pose [she]3270-my mother would ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know about that ; perhaps it might be difficult . But why should n’t [she]3270-my mother want to have [[her]3270-my mother own little daughter]2080-her own little daughter with [her]3270-my mother ? ” [The Princess]3874-the princess again leaned over , and laid a persuasive hand on [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s . “[3270-my mother] Do n’t [you]0-i want [me]0-i to take [you]0-i back to [Venice]8-venice , to [[your]0-i own real mother]2081-your own real mother , when [I]0-i go to - morrow ? ” There was a pause of suspense . [Boyne]145-boyne signed to [Judith]127-judith to keep silent , and [the children]505-the children , taking the cue , remained with spoons above [their]505-the children pudding , and eyes agape , while this perfidious proposal was submitted . [Zinnie]133-zinnie , from crimson , had grown almost pale ; the orange spirals of [her]133-zinnie bushy head seemed to droop with [her]133-zinnie drooping lips . [Her]133-zinnie head sank on [her]133-zinnie neck , and [she]133-zinnie twisted about in its crease of plumpness the necklace [[her]133-zinnie mother]382-her mother had given [her]133-zinnie . “[0-i] What kind of presents ’d [you]0-i s’pose they ’d be ? ” [she]0-i questioned back with caution . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i do n’t know , [dear]2469-dear . But [you]2469-dear ought n’t to think about that . [You]2469-dear ought to think only of [[your]2469-dear mother]2712-your mother , and [her]2712-your mother wanting so much to have [you]2469-dear . [You]2469-dear must give [me]0-i an answer to take back to [her]2712-your mother . Sha n’t [I]0-i tell [her]2712-your mother [you]2469-dear want to go to [her]2712-your mother , [Zinnie]133-zinnie ? ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie hung [her]133-zinnie head still lower . If it had been possible for [a Wheater child]3991-a wheater child to be shy , [she]133-zinnie would have appeared so ; but in reality [she]133-zinnie was only struggling with a problem beyond [her]133-zinnie powers . At last [she]133-zinnie raised [her]133-zinnie head , and looked firmly at [the Princess]3874-the princess . “[0-i] [I]0-i should like to consult [[my]0-i lawyer]2084-my lawyer first , ” [she]133-zinnie said . [Boyne]145-boyne burst out laughing , and [the Princess]3874-the princess nervously joined [him]145-boyne , perhaps to cover the appearance of defeat . Having so obviously failed to inspire [the children]505-the children with confidence , [she]0-i once more addressed [herself]0-i to [Miss Scope]147-miss scope . “[0-i] [I]0-i should be so much interested in talking over [your]2085-you educational system with [you]2085-you . [I]0-i suppose [you]2085-you ’ve entirely eliminated enforced obedience , as [we]2086-we have at [Lohengrin]93-lohengrin ? ” “[2085-you] Enforced — ? ” [Miss Scope]147-miss scope gave an incredulous gasp , and [her]0-i charges , evidently struck by the question , again remained with suspended spoons , and eyes eagerly fixed on [the Princess]3874-the princess . [Miss Scope]147-miss scope gave a curt laugh . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve never known [children]2617-children to obey unless [they]2617-children were forced to . If [you]2085-you know a way to make [them]2617-children , [I]0-i shall be glad to learn it , ” [she]0-i said drily . This seemed to cause [the Princess]3874-the princess more disappointment than surprise . “[2085-you] Ah , that ’s just what [we]2086-we wo n’t do ; _ make [them]2617-children _ . [We]2086-we leave [them]2617-children as free as air , and simply suggest to [them]2617-children to co - operate . At [Lohengrin]93-lohengrin co - operation has superseded every other method . [We]2086-we teach even [[our]2086-we little two - year - olds]2088-our little two - year - olds voluntary co - operation . [We]2086-we think the idea of obedience is debasing . ” [She]0-i turned with a smile to [[her]0-i step - son]3997-her step - son . “[2086-we] When [Astorre]151-astorre and [Beatrice]150-beatrice come to live with [me]0-i the first thing [I]0-i shall do is to make [them]2617-children both co - operate . ” [Bun]135-bun received this unsmilingly , and [Beechy]154-beechy burst into passionate weeping and flung [her]154-beechy arms jealously about [[her]154-beechy brother]372-her brother . “[0-i] No — no , [you]2089-you [bad wicked woman]2090-bad wicked woman , [you]2089-you must n’t ! [You]2089-you sha n’t operate on [Bun]135-bun , only on [me]0-i — if [you]2089-you _ must _ ! ” [she]0-i added in a final wail , [her]0-i desperate eyes entreating [[her]154-beechy step - mother]3999-her step - mother . “[2089-you] But , [[my]0-i dear]2807-my dear , [I]0-i do n’t understand , ” [the Princess]3874-the princess murmured ; and [Judith]127-judith hurriedly explained that [Blanca]128-blanca had been operated upon for appendicitis the previous year , and that the use of the word in connection with [her]128-blanca illness had had an intimidating effect on [the younger children]1114-the younger children , and especially on [Beechy]154-beechy . “[0-i] But this is all wrong ... dreadfully wrong ... ” [the Princess]3874-the princess said with a baffled sigh . [No one]2415-no one found an answer , and supper being over , [Judith]127-judith proposed that [they]1114-the younger children should return to [the sitting - room]1172-the sitting - room . [The children]505-the children followed , marshalled by [Miss Scope]147-miss scope , and [the Princess]3874-the princess again tried to engage [them]505-the children in talk ; but [she]3874-the princess could not break down the barrier of mistrust which had been set up . Finally [she]3874-the princess suggested that [they]1114-the younger children should all play a game together — a quiet writing game [she]3874-the princess thought would be interesting . A table was cleared , and paper and pencils found with some difficulty , and distributed among [the children]505-the children , [the youngest of whom]4008-the youngest of whom were lifted up onto sofa - cushions to make [their]505-the children seats high enough for collaboration . [The Princess]3874-the princess explained that the game [they]1114-the younger children were going to play was called “[0-i] Ambition , ” and that it had been introduced into [the Vocational Department of Juvenile Psychology at [Lohengrin]93-lohengrin]4010-the vocational department of juvenile psychology at lohengrin in order to direct [children]2617-children ’s minds as early as possible to the choice of a career . First of all , [she]3874-the princess continued , [each]4012-each was to write down what [he]4013-he or [she]4014-she would most like to be or to do ; then [they]1114-the younger children were to fold the papers , and [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne was to shake them up in [his]145-boyne hat , and read them out in turn , and as [he]145-boyne read [the children]505-the children were to try to guess who had made each choice . The game did not start with as much _ élan _ as [its organiser]4016-its organiser had perhaps hoped . [The children]505-the children were still oppressed by [her]3874-the princess presence , and all of [them]505-the children but [Terry]198-terry hated writing , and were unused to abstract speculations on the future ; moreover , [they]505-the children probably felt that if [they]505-the children were to state with sincerity what [they]505-the children wanted to be [their]505-the children aspirations would be received with the friendly ridicule which [grown ups]4018-grown ups manifest when [children]2617-children express [their]2617-children real views . All this made for delay and hesitation , and it was only [Terry]198-terry ’s persuasion , and the fear of disobeying [the tall authoritative lady who had suddenly invaded [their]505-the children lives]4020-the tall authoritative lady who had suddenly invaded their lives , which finally set [their]505-the children pencils going . [Boyne]145-boyne received the papers , shook them up conscientiously , and began to read them out . “[0-i] [Al If Boy]171-boy — oh , [a _ lift - boy]2092-a _ lift - boy _ ; yes—. ” [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s burning blush revealed [her]133-zinnie as [the author of this ambition]4021-the author of this ambition , and [Boyne]145-boyne read on : “[4022-an ambassadoress”—blanca] [An Ambassadoress”—Blanca]4022-an ambassadoress”—blanca , of course ; and the added vowel certainly gave the word a new stateliness . “[2093-a great poet] [A great Poet]2093-a great poet , or [the best Writer of Detective Stories]2094-the best writer of detective stories , ” in [Terry]198-terry ’s concise hand , showed [him]145-boyne torn between a first plunge into [Conan Doyle]260-conan doyle , and rapturous communion with “[2093-a great poet] The Oxford Book of English Verse . ” [Boyne]145-boyne read on : “[2093-a great poet] Never brush [meye]2095-meye tethe , ” laboriously printed out by [Beechy]154-beechy ; “[261-a crow bat”—an] [A Crow Bat”—an]261-a crow bat”—an aspiration obviously to be ascribed to [Bun]135-bun : “[4023-a noble character ” ( bless scopy] [A noble character ” ( bless Scopy]4023-a noble character ” ( bless scopy ! As if [she]135-bun was n’t one already — ) ; and lastly , in [Judith]127-judith ’s rambling script : “[2096-an exploarer] [An exploarer]2096-an exploarer . ” At the reading of that , something darted through [Boyne]145-boyne like a whirr of wings . The ambitions expressed did not long serve to disguise [the choosers]4024-the choosers , and there was a prompt chorus of attributions as [Boyne]145-boyne read out one slip after the other . [The Princess]3874-the princess had apparently hoped that something more striking would result . [She]3874-the princess said the game usually promoted discussion , and [she]3874-the princess hoped the next stage in it would lead to freer self - expression . [The children]505-the children , [she]3874-the princess explained , were now to say in turn why — that is , on what grounds — [they]505-the children wanted to be this or that . But an awestruck silence met [her]3874-the princess invitation to debate , and [Beechy]154-beechy again began to show signs of emotion . [The Princess]3874-the princess seemed much distressed , but was assured by [Miss Scope]147-miss scope that this breach of manners was due only to over - excitement , and the strain of sitting up later than usual — [she]3874-the princess hoped [the Princess]3874-the princess would excuse [her]3874-the princess , but really [the children]505-the children had better go to bed . At this suggestion all the faces round the table lit up except [Zinnie]133-zinnie ’s , which was clouded by a pout . [She]3874-the princess slipped down from [her]3874-the princess cushions with [the others]2515-the others , but when [her]3874-the princess turn came to file by [the Princess]3874-the princess for goodnight , [she]3874-the princess held up the march - past to ask : “[2096-an exploarer] N’arn’t there going to be any prizes after that game ? ” [She]3874-the princess was swept off in [[Miss Scope]147-miss scope ’s clutch]4032-miss scope ’s clutch , and [the Princess]3874-the princess , after a timid attempt at endearment , imperfectly responded to , when [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]154-beechy took leave , sat down for a talk with [Boyne]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith . Much as [she]3874-the princess had evidently seen to disapprove of in the bringing - up of [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters [she]3874-the princess was in a less aggressive mood than in the afternoon ; something [she]3874-the princess had been unprepared for , and had only half understood , in the relation of [the children]505-the children to [each other]396-each other and to [[their]505-the children elders]4037-their elders , seemed imperceptibly to have shaken [her]3874-the princess convictions . Though [she]3874-the princess continued to repeat the same phrases , it was with less emphasis ; and [she]3874-the princess listened more patiently to [Boyne]145-boyne ’s arguments , and to [Judith]127-judith ’s entreaties . [Judith]127-judith was presently called away to say goodnight to [the children]505-the children , and as soon as [the Princess]3874-the princess and [Boyne]145-boyne were alone , [the former]4040-the former began abruptly : “[2097-you] But [you]2097-you must listen to [me]0-i , [Mr. Boyne]145-boyne ; [you]2097-you must understand [me]0-i . It ’s not only that [I]0-i can not conscientiously approve of the way in which [Beatrice]150-beatrice and [Astorre]151-astorre are being brought up : it is that [I]0-i need [them]2098-them [myself]0-i — [I]0-i need them for [[my]0-i husband]2839-my husband . ” [She]0-i coloured at the avowal , and went on hastily : “[2839-my husband] If [he]2839-my husband is to begin a new life — and [he]2839-my husband _ has _ begun it already — [his]2839-my husband first step ought to be to take back [[his]2839-my husband children]1251-his children . [You]2097-you must see that .... [You]2097-you must see how [I]0-i am situated .... ” [Her]0-i voice broke , and [Boyne]145-boyne suddenly felt the same pity for [her]0-i as when [she]0-i had shown [her]0-i fear that [he]145-boyne might be hinting a criticism of [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte ’s past . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll do what [I]0-i can — only trust [me]0-i , ” [he]145-boyne stammered . [Judith]127-judith came back , and [the Princess , still a little rigid from the effort at self - control]4041-the princess , still a little rigid from the effort at self - control , began at once to thank [her]0-i for [her]0-i kindness , and to say that [she]0-i was afraid it was time to go . [She]0-i would tell [Prince Buondelmonte]152-prince buondelmonte , [she]0-i added , with an effort at cordiality , that [the children]505-the children seemed very well ( _ “[0-i] physically _ well , ” [she]0-i explained ) , and [she]0-i would give [him]145-boyne the assurance — [she]0-i hoped [she]0-i might?—that some sort of understanding as to [their]505-the children future would soon be reached . Victory or defeat ? [Judith]127-judith and [Boyne]145-boyne , sitting late , asked [each other]396-each other which it was , but found no answer . XXVIII All the next day the rain continued . It was one of those steady business - like rains which seem , in [mountain places]4044-mountain places , not so much a caprice of the weather as the drop - curtain punctually let down by Nature between one season and the next . Behind [its]4045-its closely woven screen [one]2514-one had the sense of some tremendous annual scene - shifting , the upheaval and overturning of everything in sight , from the clouds bursting in snow on the cliff - tops to the mattresses and blankets being beaten and aired in [the hotel]1085-the hotel windows . These images were doubtless born of [Boyne]145-boyne ’s own mood . When [he]145-boyne opened [his]145-boyne shutters on the morning after the Princess Buondelmonte ’s apparition it seemed to [him]145-boyne as if [she]0-i [herself]0-i had hung that cold gray mist before the window . [He]145-boyne was afraid of everything now — of what the post might bring , of what [his]145-boyne own common - sense might dictate to [him]145-boyne , above all , of seeing [Judith]127-judith again , and having [his]145-boyne apprehensions doubled by [hers]127-judith . The worst of it was that , even should all [[their]505-the children tormentors]4048-their tormentors agree to leave [them]505-the children in peace , [they]505-the children could not — more particularly on [Terry]198-terry ’s account — delay on that height through the coming weeks of storm and rain . Moreover , [all [the hotels]3173-the hotels and _ pensions _ , which would reopen later for the season of winter sports]4049-all the hotels and _ pensions _ , which would reopen later for the season of winter sports , were preparing to close for [their]505-the children yearly cleaning and renovating . After the middle of October there would be no demand for accommodation till the arrival of [the Christmas lugers]4051-the christmas lugers and [ski - ers]4052-ski - ers . If it proved possible to keep [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters together any longer the best plan would probably be to transport [them]788-the little wheaters to [Riva]96-riva or [Meran]97-meran till winter and fine weather were established together in [the mountains]588-the mountains . [Boyne]145-boyne turned over these things with the nervous minuteness with which [one]2514-one makes plans for [some one who is dying , and will never survive to see them carried out]4056-some one who is dying , and will never survive to see them carried out . It seemed to give [him]145-boyne faith in the future , a sense of factitious security , as it sometimes does , beside a deathbed , to think : “[0-i] To - morrow [I]0-i ’ll see what [the doctor]1137-the doctor says about a warmer climate . ” [Judith]127-judith and [Miss Scope]147-miss scope shared [his]145-boyne idea about [Meran]97-meran or [Riva]96-riva , and for some time had been talking vaguely of going down to look for [rooms]4057-rooms . But the ever - recurring difficulty of persuading [a boarding - house keeper]4058-a boarding - house keeper to lodge [seven children]2948-seven children made [them]2948-seven children decide that it would be best to try to hire [an inexpensive villa]4060-an inexpensive villa . The episode of the gold - fish and the rabbit had not endeared [them]2948-seven children to [[their]2948-seven children present landlady]4061-their present landlady , and [they]2948-seven children felt the hopelessness of trying to ingratiate [themselves]2948-seven children with [another]4062-another , in [a place where [they]2948-seven children were unknown , and where the autumn season would be at its height]4063-a place where they were unknown , and where the autumn season would be at its height . It had therefore been decided that [Judith]127-judith , [Miss Scope]147-miss scope and [Boyne]145-boyne should motor to [Meran]97-meran that very week to look over the ground . But on reflection [Boyne]145-boyne hesitated to leave [the children]505-the children alone with [[their]505-the children nurses]4065-their nurses , even for so short an absence . With [Joyce]129-joyce in [Paris]42-paris , once more reorganising [her]129-joyce life , and [the Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte returning to [Rome]66-rome unsatisfied , danger threatened on all sides . Any one of these cross - blasts might dash to earth the frail nest which had resisted the summer ’s breezes ; and [Boyne]145-boyne , heavy - hearted , set out to call another council at the _ Pension Rosenglüh _ . As [he]145-boyne left [the hotel]1085-the hotel a telegram was handed to [him]145-boyne . [He]145-boyne glanced first at the signature — [Sarah Mervin]262-sarah mervin — then read what went before . “[1137-the doctor] [I]0-i will gladly receive [own dear grandchildren]2102-own dear grandchildren subject to [parents]2650-parents ’ final settlement of affairs fear can not assume responsibility [step - children]2104-step - children letter follows ” .... “[2105-a lawyer] [A lawyer]2105-a lawyer ’s cable , ” [Boyne]145-boyne growled as [he]145-boyne pocketed it . “[2105-a lawyer] That ’s the reason it ’s taken so long to compose . ” Fresh bitterness filled [him]145-boyne as [he]145-boyne saw one more prop withdrawn from under the crazy structure of [his]145-boyne hopes . “[3398-these people] [These people]3398-these people , ” [he]145-boyne reflected , “[3398-these people] all act on impulse where [their]3398-these people own wants are concerned , and call in [a lawyer]2105-a lawyer when it ’s a question of [anybody else]3315-anybody else ’s . ” But in [his]145-boyne heart [he]145-boyne was not much surprised . [Mrs. Mervin]254-mrs. mervin was no longer young , and it is natural for [ageing people]4067-ageing people to shrink from responsibilities . Besides , [she]254-mrs. mervin might well plead that it was no business of [hers]254-mrs. mervin to take in children [she]254-mrs. mervin had never seen , and whose parents were eager , and financially able , to care for [them]3398-these people . On second thoughts , it really did not need [Judith]127-judith ’s bald hint as to the allowance [[her]127-judith grandmother]4068-her grandmother received from [Cliffe Wheater]120-mrs. wheater to account for [the poor lady]4069-the poor lady ’s attitude . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t see what else [she]2109-she could have done , ” [the impartial Boyne]4070-the impartial boyne was obliged to admit in the course of [his]145-boyne interminable argument with the other , [the passionate and unreasonable one]4071-the passionate and unreasonable one . What a Utopia [he]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith had been dreaming ! [He]145-boyne wondered now how [he]145-boyne could have lent [himself]145-boyne to such pure folly .... Well , the dream was over , and [his]145-boyne was the grim business of making [her]127-judith see it .... Heavily [he]145-boyne went down [the hill]3071-the hill through the rain . At [the _ pension _]880-the _ pension _ [Judith]127-judith was watching for [him]145-boyne from the window . [She]127-judith opened the door and led [him]145-boyne into [the sitting - room]1172-the sitting - room , where a sulky fire smouldered , puffing out acrid smoke . [The landlady]3160-the landlady said it was always like that — the stove always smoked on the first day of the autumn rains , unless there was a little wind to make a draught . And there was not a breath today ; the only way was to leave a window open , [Judith]127-judith explained as [she]127-judith turned to [Boyne]145-boyne . [Her]127-judith face was colourless and anxious ; [he]145-boyne could see that [she]127-judith had been treading the wheel of the same problems as [himself]145-boyne . The sight made [him]145-boyne resolve to try and hide [his]145-boyne own apprehensions a little longer . “[0-i] Well , [old Judy]127-judith — here [we]2110-we are , after all ; and not a breach in the walls yet ! ” “[127-judith] [You]127-judith mean [she]127-judith ’s gone — [the Princess]3874-the princess ? ” [He]145-boyne nodded . “[3874-the princess] [I]0-i saw [her]127-judith off to [Rome]66-rome an hour ago . ” [Her]127-judith eyes brightened , as they always did at [his]145-boyne challenge ; but it was only a passing animation . “[127-judith] And [you]0-i have n’t had any telegram ? ” [she]127-judith questioned . The question took [him]145-boyne unprepared . “[0-i] [I]0-i — why , have [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes . From [mother]2490-mother . Here . ” [She]127-judith produced the paper and thrust it feverishly into [his]145-boyne hand . [Boyne]145-boyne ’s anger rose — evidently ; [he]145-boyne thought , [old Mrs. Mervin]254-mrs. mervin had waited to communicate with [[her]254-mrs. mervin daughter]383-her daughter before answering [him]145-boyne . What cowardice , what treachery ! [He]145-boyne pictured [all these grown up powers and principalities]4077-all these grown up powers and principalities leagued together against the handful of babes [he]145-boyne commanded , and the bitterness of surrender entered into [him]145-boyne . It was not that [any of [these parents]4079-these parents]4078-any of these parents really wanted [[their]4078-any of these parents children]704-their children . If [they]4078-any of these parents had , the break up of [Judith]127-judith ’s dream , though tragic , would have been too natural to struggle against . But it was simply that the poor little things had become a bone of contention , that the taking or keeping possession of them was a matter of pride or of expediency , like fighting for a goal in some exciting game , or clinging to all one ’s points in an acrimoniously - disputed law - suit . [Boyne]145-boyne unfolded [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s telegram , and read : “[2490-mother] [You]2113-you must come to [Paris]42-paris immediately bringing [Chip]123-chip [I]0-i must see [you]2113-you at once do not disobey [me]0-i stop telegraph Hotel Nouveau Luxe [Mother]195-mother . ” The vague phrasing made it impossible to guess whether the message were the result of a cable from [Mrs. Mervin]254-mrs. mervin , or simply embodied a new whim of [Joyce]129-joyce ’s . [Boyne]145-boyne , on the whole , inclined to the latter view , and felt half ready to exonerate [Mrs. Mervin]254-mrs. mervin . After all , perhaps [she]254-mrs. mervin had kept faith with [him]145-boyne , and [her]254-mrs. mervin message was only the result of [her]254-mrs. mervin own scruples . [He]145-boyne tossed the telegram onto the table with a shrug . “[195-mother] Is that all ? [You]2113-you ’ve heard nothing else ? ” Yes ; it appeared [she]254-mrs. mervin had . [Nanny]156-nanny , the day before , had received a letter from [[Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s maid]4081-mrs. wheater ’s maid [Marguerite]263-marguerite , [an experienced person who wielded a facile but rambling pen]4082-an experienced person who wielded a facile but rambling pen . This letter [Judith]127-judith had coaxed from [Nanny]156-nanny , unknown to [Miss Scope]147-miss scope ; for [Miss Scope]147-miss scope , even in the extremest emergencies , would not admit the possibility of [her]147-miss scope charges using , as a means of information , what [the Princess]3874-the princess would have called “[1951-salaried assistants] [salaried assistants]1951-salaried assistants . ” [Marguerite]263-marguerite ’s news , if vague , was ample . It appeared that [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater had met in Venice a gentleman a good deal older than [herself]2115-her , whose name [the maid could not even approximately spell]4084-the maid could not even approximately spell , but who was quite different from any of [the other gentlemen in [[her]2115-her mistress]4086-her mistress ’s circle]4085-the other gentlemen in her mistress ’s circle . “[1951-salaried assistants] Different — different how ? ” “[2115-her] [She]2115-her says [he]2116-he ’s made [a different woman of mother]2117-a different woman of mother , ” [Judith]127-judith explained . “[2115-her] [He]2116-he ’s made [her]2115-her chuck [Gerald]175-gerald , to begin with . ” “[2115-her] But , for [God]214-god ’s sake , why ? [I]0-i thought [she]2115-her was chucking [[your]0-i father]2435-your father on account of [Gerald]175-gerald . ” [Judith]127-judith went into this with the lucid impartiality [she]127-judith always applied to the analysis of [[her]127-judith parents]527-her parents ’ foibles . [She]127-judith reminded [Boyne]145-boyne that [Joyce]129-joyce never stuck long to one thing , and that [she]2115-her had decided to marry [Gerald]175-gerald chiefly in order to annoy [[her]2115-her husband]411-her husband , and to have an excuse for detaining [the young tutor at [the Lido]57-the lido]4089-the young tutor at the lido when [the children]505-the children left . “[2115-her] [He]2435-your father ’s rather [a Lido man]2119-a lido man , [Gerald]175-gerald is , ” [Judith]127-judith commented , “[175-gerald] and it made [all the other women]2120-all the other women so furious . That ’s always rather fun , [you]2121-you know . ” But , after all , [she]127-judith pursued , [[her]127-judith mother]382-her mother had much more sense than [[her]127-judith poor father]4092-her poor father , who was always the prey of [women like [Zinnia Lacrosse]143-zinnia or [Sybil Lullmer]219-sybil lullmer]4093-women like zinnia lacrosse or sybil lullmer . “[2121-you] [She]2122-she does pull [herself]2122-she together sometimes — especially since that awful time with [Buondelmonte]151-astorre . And so , when [she]2122-she met [this other gentleman , who is so much older , and very religious , and enormously rich]2123-this other gentleman , who is so much older , and very religious , and enormously rich , and who only wants to influence [her]2122-she for good , [Marguerite]263-marguerite says it made [her]2122-she feel how dreadfully [she]2122-she ’d wasted [her]2122-she life , and what [a different woman [she]2122-she might have been if [she]2122-she ’d known [him]2123-this other gentleman , who is so much older , and very religious , and enormously rich years before . [You]2125-you see , [he]2123-this other gentleman , who is so much older , and very religious , and enormously rich does n’t want to marry [her]2122-she , but only to be [[her]2122-she friend]2126-her friend and [adviser]2127-adviser]2124-a different woman she might have been if she ’d known him years before . you see , he does n’t want to marry her , but only to be her friend and adviser . [He]2123-this other gentleman , who is so much older , and very religious , and enormously rich thinks [she]2122-she ’s been married often enough . And so , in order not to leave [Gerald]175-gerald at a loose end , [she]2122-she ’s kept [him]2123-this other gentleman , who is so much older , and very religious , and enormously rich on as [secretary]2128-secretary till [he]2123-this other gentleman , who is so much older , and very religious , and enormously rich can get another job , and [she]2122-she and [Gerald]175-gerald and [the other gentleman]2129-the other gentleman have gone to [Paris]42-paris together to see what had better be done . And [the gentleman]2130-the gentleman says [she]2122-she ought to have [us]2131-us all with [her]2122-she ; and [he]2130-the gentleman feels awfully fond of [us]2131-us already , and knows [mother]2490-mother will be ever so much happier if [we]2131-us ’re with [her]2122-she .... ” “[2130-the gentleman] Oh , [[my]0-i God]2133-my god — then it ’s all up with [us]2131-us , ” [Boyne]145-boyne groaned . [Judith]127-judith made no answer , and [he]145-boyne went on : “[2130-the gentleman] It only remains now to hear from [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench and [the Princess]3874-the princess ! ” “[3874-the princess] Or [Grandma Mervin]216-grandma mervin — there ’s still [grandma]1869-grandma , ” [Judith]127-judith rejoined , half hopefully . [Boyne]145-boyne hesitated a moment ; then [he]145-boyne said to [himself]145-boyne that there was no use in any farther postponement . “[1869-grandma] No ; [I]0-i ’ve heard from [her]2122-she , ” [he]145-boyne said . [Judith]127-judith ’s eyes were again illuminated . “[0-i] [You]0-i have ? Oh , [Martin]193-martin ! If [she]2122-she ’d only take [us]2131-us all , perhaps it would satisfy [mother]2490-mother and [the new gentleman]2137-the new gentleman . Oh , [Martin]193-martin , [she]2122-she does n’t say no ? ” Silently — for no words came to [him]145-boyne — [he]145-boyne gave [her]127-judith the cable , and walked away to the window to be out of sight of [her]127-judith face . For a while [he]145-boyne stood watching the gray curtain of failure that hung there between [him]145-boyne and [his]145-boyne golden weeks ; then [he]145-boyne pulled [himself]145-boyne together and turned back . “[127-judith] [Judy]127-judith — ” [She]127-judith handed [him]145-boyne the cable . “[127-judith] After all , [you]127-judith expected it , did n’t [you]127-judith ? ” [he]145-boyne said . [She]127-judith nodded . “[127-judith] It does n’t make so much difference , anyhow , ” [he]145-boyne continued , in an unconvinced voice , “[127-judith] if [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]154-beechy have to go .... ” [She]127-judith pondered on this for a few moments without answering . Then , with one of [her]127-judith sudden changes of tone : “[193-martin] [Martin]193-martin , ” [she]127-judith broke out impetuously , “[127-judith] do [you]193-martin suppose [she]127-judith was right , after all — [I]0-i mean [the Princess]3874-the princess — about [our]2139-we being so dreadfully behind the times ? Do [you]193-martin suppose , if [we]2139-we did all the things [she]127-judith suggested : if [we]2139-we got [new teachers]2140-new teachers and new books , and [[somebody]2453-somebody for [Bun]135-bun ’s gymnastics]2142-somebody for bun ’s gymnastics , it would make any difference — do [you]193-martin think it would ? ” Every line of [her]127-judith face , from lifted eyebrows to parted lips , was a passionate demand for [his]4094-his assent . “[127-judith] After all , [you]193-martin know — perhaps [she]127-judith was right about some things : that stupid old book of Scopy ’s , for instance . Of course [we]2139-we all know [poor darling Scopy]132-scopy ’s a back number . And about [Bun]135-bun ’s gymnastics too . Do [you]193-martin suppose if [we]2139-we took [a villa at [Meran]97-meran]2143-a villa at meran [we]2139-we could afford to fit up [a room like the one [she]127-judith described]2144-a room like the one she described , and get [an instructor]2145-an instructor — didn’t [she]127-judith call [him]2145-an instructor [an instructor]2145-an instructor ? And then there ’s fencing and riding — [I]0-i dare say [she]127-judith was right about that too ! But after all — ” [she]127-judith paused , and [her]127-judith eyes looked as the rain did when the sun was trying to break through it . “[127-judith] After all , [Martin]193-martin , ” [she]127-judith began again , “[127-judith] the main thing is that [the children]505-the children are so well , is n’t it ? Look at [our]2139-we record — see what the summer has done ! [You]193-martin would n’t know [Terry]198-terry , would [you]193-martin , if [you]193-martin were to see [him]198-terry now for the first time after meeting [us]2139-we on [the boat]2148-the boat at [Algiers]1-algiers ? And [Chip]123-chip — isn’t [Chip]123-chip a miracle ? [Every one]885-every one stops [Nanny]156-nanny in [the street]2150-the street to admire [him]123-chip , and [they]885-every one always think [he]123-chip must be three years old . [He]123-chip was just beginning to walk alone when [he]123-chip came [here]2434-here — now [he]123-chip runs like [a hare]2152-a hare ! [Nanny]156-nanny gets worn out chasing [him]123-chip . And the tricks [he]123-chip ’s learnt to do ! [He]123-chip can imitate [everybody]561-everybody ; [I]0-i believe [he]123-chip ’s going to be [a movie star]2740-a movie star . Have [you]2155-you seen [him]123-chip do the lion , with [Bun]135-bun as lion - tamer ? Or [the old man at [the market]2157-the market]2156-the old man at the market , all doubled up with sciatica , who leans on a stick , and holds one hand behind [his]123-chip back ? But it ’s a wonder ! Oh , [Martin]193-martin , wait , and [I]0-i ’ll fetch [him]123-chip down now to do [the old man for [you]193-martin]2158-the old man for you — shall [I]0-i ? ” Once again [her]0-i grown up cares had vanished in the childish pride of recounting [Chip]123-chip ’s achievements . Would it always be like this , [Boyne]145-boyne wondered , or would life gradually close the gates of [the fairyland]4095-the fairyland which was still so close to [her]0-i ? [He]123-chip would have given most of [his]123-chip chances of happiness to help [her]0-i keep open that communication with [her]0-i childhood . And what if [he]123-chip were [the one being who could do it]4096-the one being who could do it ? The question wound itself through [his]123-chip thoughts like a persuasive hand insinuating itself into [his]123-chip . This heart - break of separation that was upon [her]0-i — what if [he]123-chip alone had the power to ease it ? [He]123-chip stood looking down at [her]0-i perplexedly . “[127-judith] [Judy]127-judith — [Chip]123-chip ’s [a great man]2159-a great man , and [I]0-i ’d love to see [him]123-chip do [the old gentleman with the sciatica]2160-the old gentleman with the sciatica . But first .... ” “[0-i] Yes — first ? ” [she]0-i palpitated . But under [his]123-chip gaze [her]0-i radiance gradually faded , and [her]0-i lips began to tremble a little . “[0-i] Ah , then [you]0-i do n’t think ... there ’s any hope for [us]2161-we ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]0-i ’ve got to go to [Paris]42-paris and see [[your]0-i mother]2712-your mother . ” “[2712-your mother] And take [Chip]123-chip ? [I]0-i ’ll never take [Chip]123-chip ! [I]0-i wo n’t ! ” “[0-i] But listen , [dear—.]2163-dear—. ” [He]123-chip sat down , and drew [her]0-i to the sofa beside [him]123-chip , speaking as [he]123-chip might have to [a child on a holiday who was fighting the summons back to [school]2671-school]4097-a child on a holiday who was fighting the summons back to school . “[2163-dear—.] Listen , [Judy]127-judith . [We]2161-we ’ve done [our]2161-we best ; [we]2161-we all have . But [the children]505-the children are not [yours]2165-you or [mine]2166-mine . [They]505-the children belong to [[their]505-the children parents]507-their parents , after all . ” How dry and flat [his]123-chip phrases sounded , compared with the words [he]123-chip longed to say to [her]127-judith ! [She]127-judith drew back into the corner of the sofa . “[2168-that buondelmonte woman] [That Buondelmonte woman]2168-that buondelmonte woman ’s got at [you]2165-you — [she]2168-that buondelmonte woman ’s talked [you]2165-you over ! [I]0-i knew [she]2168-that buondelmonte woman would . ” [She]127-judith was grown up again now , measuring [him]123-chip with angry suspicious eyes , and flinging out [her]127-judith accusations in [[her]127-judith mother]382-her mother ’s shrillest voice . “[2168-that buondelmonte woman] Why , [child]2459-child , what nonsense ! [You]2165-you said just now that perhaps [the Princess]3874-the princess was right .... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never did ! [I]0-i said , perhaps [we]2171-their ought to get a new Cyclopædia for Scopy , and have [Bun]135-bun taught scientific gymnastics ; and now [you]2165-you say .... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i say that fate ’s too much for [us]2171-their . It did n’t need [the Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte to teach [me]0-i that . ” [She]127-judith made no answer , and [they]2171-their sat in silence in [their]2171-their respective corners of the sofa , each gazing desperately into a future of which nothing could be divined except that it was the end of [their]2171-their hopes . Suddenly [Judith]127-judith flung [herself]127-judith face down against the knobby cushions and broke into weeping . [Boyne]145-boyne , for a few minutes , remained numb and helpless ; then [he]145-boyne moved closer , and bending over drew [her]127-judith into [his]145-boyne arms . [She]127-judith seemed hardly aware of [his]145-boyne nearness ; [she]127-judith simply went on crying , with hard uneven sobs , pressing [her]127-judith face against [his]145-boyne shoulder as if it were the sofa - cushion . [He]145-boyne held [her]127-judith in silence , not venturing to speak , or even to brush back [her]127-judith tumbled hair , while [he]145-boyne pictured , with the acuity of [his]145-boyne older and less articulate grief , what must be passing before [her]127-judith as the fibres of [her]127-judith heart were torn away . “[257-the princess buondelmonte] It ’s too cruel — it ’s too beastly cruel , ” [he]145-boyne thought , wincing at the ugly details which must enter into [her]127-judith vision of the future , details [he]145-boyne could only guess at , while [she]127-judith saw them with all the precision of experience . Yes , it was too cruel ; but what could [he]145-boyne or [she]127-judith do ? [He]145-boyne continued to hold [her]127-judith in silence , listening to the beat of the rain on the half - open window , and smelling the cold grave - yard smell of the autumn earth , while [her]127-judith sobs ran through [him]145-boyne in shocks of anguish . Gradually [her]127-judith weeping subsided , and [Boyne]145-boyne took courage to lift [his]145-boyne hand and pass it once or twice over [her]127-judith hair . [She]127-judith lay in [his]145-boyne hold as quietly as a frightened bird , and presently [he]145-boyne bent [his]145-boyne head and whispered : “[264-judy—.] [Judy—.]264-judy—. ” Why not ? [he]145-boyne thought ; [his]145-boyne heart was beating with reckless bounds . [He]145-boyne was free , after all , if it came to that ; free to chuck [his]145-boyne life away on any madness ; and madness this was , [he]145-boyne knew . Well , [he]145-boyne ’d had enough of reason for the rest of [his]145-boyne days ; and [a man]308-a man is only as old as [he]145-boyne feels .... [He]145-boyne bent so close that [his]145-boyne lips brushed [her]127-judith ear . “[127-judith] [Judy]127-judith , [darling]3107-darling , listen .... Perhaps after all there ’s a way—. ” In a flash [she]127-judith was out of [his]145-boyne arms , and ecstatically facing [him]145-boyne . “[127-judith] A way — a way of keeping [us]2173-us all together ? ” Ah , how hard [her]127-judith questions were to answer ! [Boyne]145-boyne drew [her]127-judith down again beside [him]145-boyne . Crying was a laborious and disfiguring business to [her]127-judith , and [her]127-judith face was so drawn and tear - stained that [she]127-judith looked almost old ; but its misery was shot through with hope . If [he]145-boyne could have kept [her]127-judith there , not speaking , only answering [her]127-judith with endearments , how easy , how exquisite it would have been ! But [her]127-judith face was tense with expectation , and [he]145-boyne had to find words , for [he]145-boyne knew that [his]145-boyne silence would have no meaning for [her]127-judith . “[127-judith] [Judith]127-judith — ” [he]145-boyne began ; but [she]127-judith interrupted : “[127-judith] Call [me]0-i [Judy]127-judith , or [I]0-i shall think it ’s more bad news . ” [He]145-boyne made no answer , and [she]127-judith flung [herself]127-judith against [him]145-boyne with a cry of alarm . “[193-martin] [Martin]193-martin ! [Martin]193-martin ! [You]193-martin ’re not going to desert [us]2174-us too ? ” [He]145-boyne held [her]127-judith hands , but [his]145-boyne own had begun to tremble . “[193-martin] [Darling]3107-darling , [I]0-i ’ll never desert [you]3107-darling ; [I]0-i ’ll stay with [you]3107-darling always if [you]3107-darling ’ll have [me]0-i ; if things go wrong [I]0-i ’ll always be there to look after [you]3107-darling and defend [you]3107-darling ; no matter what happens , [we]2174-us ’ll never be separated any more .... ” [He]145-boyne broke off , [his]145-boyne voice failing before the sudden sunrise in [her]3107-darling eyes . “[193-martin] Oh , [Martin]193-martin — ” [She]3107-darling lifted [his]145-boyne hands one by one to [her]3107-darling wet cheeks , and held them there in silent bliss . “[193-martin] Then [you]193-martin do n’t belong any longer to [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars ? ” “[163-mrs. sellars] [I]0-i do n’t belong to any one but [you]3107-darling — for as long as ever [you]3107-darling ’ll have [me]0-i .... ” [Her]3107-darling eyes still bathed [him]145-boyne in their radiance . “[0-i] [[My]0-i darling]2176-my darling , [[my]0-i darling]2176-my darling . ” [She]3107-darling leaned close as [she]3107-darling said it , and [he]145-boyne dared not move , in [his]145-boyne new awe of [her]3107-darling nearness — so subtly had [she]3107-darling changed from [the child of [his]145-boyne familiar endearments]4101-the child of his familiar endearments to [the woman [he]145-boyne passionately longed for]4102-the woman he passionately longed for .... “[0-i] [Darling]3107-darling , ” [she]3107-darling said again ; then , with a face in which the bridal light seemed already kindled , “[3107-darling] Oh , [Martin]193-martin , do [you]193-martin really mean [you]193-martin ’re going to adopt [us]2179-us all , and [we]2179-us ’re all going to stay with [you]193-martin forever ? ” XXIX [Boyne]145-boyne felt like [a man who has blundered along in the dark to the edge of a precipice]4103-a man who has blundered along in the dark to the edge of a precipice . [He]145-boyne trembled inwardly with the effort of recovery , and the shock of finding [himself]145-boyne flung back into [his]145-boyne old world . [Judith]127-judith , in a rush of gratitude , had thrown [her]127-judith arms about [him]145-boyne ; and [he]145-boyne shrank from [her]127-judith touch , from the warm smell of [her]127-judith hair , from everything about [her]127-judith which [he]145-boyne had to think back into terms of childhood and comradeship , while every vein in [his]145-boyne body still ached for [her]127-judith . There was nothing [he]145-boyne would have dreaded as much as [her]127-judith detecting the least trace of what [he]145-boyne was feeling . [His]145-boyne first care must be to hide the break in [their]4104-their perfect communion — the fact that for a moment [she]127-judith had been for [him]145-boyne [the woman [she]127-judith would some day be for [another man]3492-another man , in a future [he]145-boyne could never share]4105-the woman she would some day be for another man , in a future he could never share . [He]145-boyne undid [her]127-judith hands and walked away to the window . When [he]145-boyne turned to [her]127-judith again [he]145-boyne had struggled back to some sort of composure . “[193-martin] [Judy]127-judith , [child]2459-child , [I]0-i wish [you]2459-child would n’t take such terrible life - leases on the future . ” [He]145-boyne tried to smile as [he]145-boyne said it . “[2459-child] [I]0-i ’m always afraid it will bring [us]2181-us bad luck . [We]2181-us ’d much better live from hand to mouth . [I]0-i ’m ready to promise all that [a reasonable man]2182-a reasonable man can — that [I]0-i ’ll put up another big fight for [you]2459-child , and that [I]0-i do n’t despair of winning it . At any rate , [I]0-i ’ll be there ; [I]0-i ’ll stand by [you]2459-child ; [I]0-i wo n’t desert [you]2459-child .... ” [He]145-boyne broke off , reading in [her]2459-child unsatisfied eyes the hopelessness of piling up vague assurances .... “[0-i] Yes , ” [she]2459-child assented , in a voice grown as small and colourless as [her]2459-child face . [He]145-boyne stood before [her]2459-child miserably . “[0-i] [You]2459-child do understand , [dear]2469-dear , do n’t [you]2459-child ? ” “[2459-child] [I]0-i ’m not sure .... ” [She]2459-child hesitated . “[0-i] A little while ago [I]0-i thought [I]0-i did . ” [His]145-boyne nerves began to twitch again . Could [he]145-boyne bear to go into the question with [her]2459-child once more — and what would be the use if [he]145-boyne did ? The immediate future must somehow or other be dealt with ; but the last few minutes had deprived [him]145-boyne of all will and energy . [He]145-boyne had the desolate sense of [her]2459-child knowing that [he]145-boyne had failed [her]2459-child , and yet not being able to guess why . “[0-i] Of course [I]0-i ’ll do what [I]0-i can , ” [he]145-boyne repeated . [She]2459-child remained silent , constrained by [his]145-boyne constraint ; and [he]145-boyne saw the disappointment in [her]2459-child eyes . “[0-i] [You]0-i do n’t believe [me]0-i ? ” Still [she]2459-child looked at [him]145-boyne perplexedly . “[0-i] But [you]0-i said .... [I]0-i thought [you]0-i said just now that [you]0-i ’d found a way of keeping [us]2184-us all together . No matter what happened ; [you]0-i had a plan , [you]0-i said . ” [His]145-boyne senseless irritation grew upon [him]145-boyne . Could such total simplicity be unfeigned ? Could [she]2459-child have such a power of awaking passion without any inkling of its meaning ? [He]145-boyne hated [himself]145-boyne for doubting it . In time — a short time , perhaps — [her]2459-child rich nature would come to its ripeness ; but as yet the only full - grown faculties in it were [her]2459-child love for [[her]2459-child brothers]1117-her brothers and [sisters]1118-sisters , and [her]2459-child faith in [the few people who had shown [her]2459-child kindness in [a world]4110-a world unkindly]4109-the few people who had shown her kindness in a world unkindly . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry , ” [she]2459-child continued , after pausing for an answer which did not come . “[0-i] [I]0-i must have misunderstood [you]0-i , [I]0-i suppose . ” [Boyne]145-boyne gave a nervous laugh . “[0-i] [You]0-i did , most thoroughly . ” “[0-i] And — [you]0-i wo n’t tell [me]0-i what [you]0-i really meant ? ” [He]145-boyne stood motionless , [his]145-boyne hands in [his]145-boyne pockets , staring down at the knots in the wooden floor , as [he]145-boyne had stared at them on the day when [she]2459-child had owned to having taken [[her]2459-child father]2542-her father ’s money — but in a mental perturbation how much deeper ! A few minutes before , it had seemed like profanation to brush [her]2459-child with the thought of [his]145-boyne love ; now , faced by [her]2459-child despair , by [her]2459-child sense of being left alone to fight [her]2459-child battles , [he]145-boyne asked [himself]145-boyne whether it might not be fairer , even kinder , to speak . At the thought [his]145-boyne heart again began to beat excitedly . Perhaps [he]145-boyne had been too impetuous , too inarticulate . What if , after all , a word from [him]145-boyne could wake the sleeping music ? The difficulty was to find a beginning . What would have been so simple if [kisses]4112-kisses could have told it , seemed tortuous or brutal when put in words . [He]145-boyne shrank not so much from the possibility of hurting [her]2459-child as from the sudden fear of [her]2459-child hurting [him]145-boyne beyond endurance . “[0-i] [Judith]127-judith , ” [he]145-boyne began , “[0-i] how old are [you]127-judith ? ” “[127-judith] [I]0-i shall be sixteen in three months — no , in five months , really , ” [she]2459-child said , with an obvious effort at truthfulness . “[0-i] As near as that ! Well , sixteen is an age , ” [he]145-boyne laughed . [She]2459-child continued to fix [her]2459-child bewildered eyes on [him]145-boyne , as if seeking a clue . “[0-i] But [I]0-i look a lot older , do n’t [I]0-i ? ” [she]2459-child added hopefully . “[0-i] Older ? There are times when [you]0-i look so old that [you]0-i frighten [me]0-i . ” [He]145-boyne remembered then that [she]2459-child had spoken to [him]145-boyne with perfect simplicity of [Gerald Ormerod]175-gerald ’s desire to marry [her]2459-child , as of the most natural thing in [the world]307-the world ; and [his]145-boyne own scruples began to seem absurd . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m always forgetting what a liberal education [she]0-i ’s had , ” [he]145-boyne thought with a touch of self - derision . [He]145-boyne cleared [his]145-boyne throat , and continued : “[0-i] So grown up that [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i ’ll soon be thinking of getting married . ” The word was out now ; it went sounding on and on inside of [his]145-boyne head while [he]145-boyne awaited [her]2459-child answer . When [she]2459-child spoke it was with an air of indifference and disappointment . “[0-i] What ’s the use of saying that ? How can [I]0-i ever marry , with all [the children]505-the children to look after ? ” It was clear that [she]2459-child regarded the subject as irrelevant ; [her]2459-child tone seemed to remind [him]145-boyne that [he]145-boyne and [she]2459-child had long since dealt with and disposed of it . “[0-i] [You]0-i might as well tell [me]0-i that [I]0-i ought to be educated , ” [she]2459-child grumbled . [He]145-boyne pressed on : “[0-i] But it might turn out ... [you]0-i might find .... ” [He]145-boyne had to pause to steady [his]145-boyne voice . “[0-i] If [we]2186-we ca n’t prevent [the children]505-the children being taken away from [you]0-i , [you]0-i ’ll be awfully lonely .... ” “[0-i] Taken away from [me]0-i ? ” At the word [her]2459-child listlessness vanished . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i suppose [I]0-i ’ll let [them]505-the children be taken like that ? Without fighting to the very last minute ? Let [Syb Lullmer]221-syb lullmer get hold of [Chip]123-chip — and [Bun]135-bun and [Beechy]154-beechy go to [that Buondelmonte man]2188-that buondelmonte man ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know . It ’s hateful . But supposing the very worst happens — oughtn’t [you]0-i to face that now ? ” [He]2188-that buondelmonte man cleared [his]2188-that buondelmonte man throat again . “[0-i] If things went wrong , and [you]0-i were very lonely , and [a fellow]2420-a fellow asked [you]0-i to marry [him]2420-a fellow — ” “[2420-a fellow] Who asked [me]0-i ? ” [He]2188-that buondelmonte man laughed again . “[0-i] If [I]0-i did . ” For a moment [she]2459-child looked at [him]2188-that buondelmonte man perplexedly ; then [her]2459-child eyes cleared , and for the first time [she]2459-child joined in [his]2188-that buondelmonte man laugh . [Hers]2459-child seemed to bubble up , fresh and limpid , from the very depths of [her]2459-child little girlhood . “[0-i] Well , that would be funny ! ” [she]2459-child said . There was a bottomless silence . “[0-i] Yes — wouldn’t it ? ” [Boyne]145-boyne grinned . [He]145-boyne stared at [her]2459-child without speaking ; then , like [a blind man]4114-a blind man feeling [his]145-boyne way , [he]145-boyne picked up [his]145-boyne hat and mackintosh , said : “[0-i] Where ’s [my]0-i umbrella ? Oh , outside — ” and walked out stiffly into [the passage]3893-the passage . On the doorstep , still aware of [her]2459-child nearness , [he]145-boyne added a little dizzily : “[0-i] No , please — [I]0-i want a long tramp alone first .... [I]0-i ’ll come in again this afternoon to settle what [we]2190-we ’d better do about [Paris]42-paris .... ” [He]145-boyne felt [her]2459-child little disconsolate figure standing alone behind [him]145-boyne in the rain , and hurried away as if to put [himself]145-boyne out of its reach forever . XXX It was still raining when [the Wheater colony]4116-the wheater colony left [Cortina]34-cortina ; it was raining when [the train]2658-the train in which [Boyne]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith were travelling reached [Paris]42-paris . During the days intervening between the receipt of [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s telegram and the clattering halt of [the express]4118-the express in [the gare de [Lyon]98-lyon]4119-the gare de lyon , [Boyne]145-boyne could not remember that the rain had ever stopped . But [he]145-boyne had not had time to do much remembering — not even of the havoc within [himself]145-boyne . After the struggle necessary to convince [Judith]127-judith that [she]127-judith must go to [Paris]42-paris and take [Chip]123-chip with [her]127-judith — since disobedience to [[her]127-judith mother]382-her mother ’s summons might put [them]4121-them irretrievably in the wrong — [he]145-boyne had first had to help [her]127-judith decide what should be done with [the other children]2552-the other children . Once brought round to [his]145-boyne view , [she]127-judith had immediately risen to the emergency , as [she]127-judith always did when practical matters were at stake . [She]127-judith and [Boyne]145-boyne were agreed that it would be imprudent to leave [the children]505-the children at [Cortina]34-cortina , where [the Princess]3874-the princess , or even [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench , might take advantage of [their]505-the children absence to effect a raid on [the _ pension _]880-the _ pension _ . It took a three days ’ hunt to find [a villa in [a remote suburb of [Riva]96-riva where [they]505-the children could be temporarily installed without much risk of being run down by [an outraged parent]4128-an outraged parent]4127-a remote suburb of riva where they could be temporarily installed without much risk of being run down by an outraged parent]4126-a villa in a remote suburb of riva where they could be temporarily installed without much risk of being run down by an outraged parent . [Boyne]145-boyne put [the _ Rosenglüh _ landlady]4129-the _ rosenglüh _ landlady off the scent by giving [her]127-judith the address of [[Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s [Paris]42-paris banker]4130-mrs. wheater ’s paris banker , and letting it be understood that [Judith]127-judith was off to [Paris]42-paris to prepare for [the children]505-the children ’s arrival ; and [Blanca and Terry]265-terry , still deep in [Conan Doyle]260-conan doyle , gleefully contributed misleading details . The excitement of departure , and the business of establishing [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters in [[their]505-the children new quarters]4132-their new quarters , left no time , between [Boyne]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith , for less pressing questions ; and [Boyne]145-boyne saw that , once [their]505-the children plan was settled , [Judith]127-judith was almost as much amused as [the twins]3578-the twins by [its]4134-its secret and adventurous side . “[0-i] It will take [a Dr. Watson]266-a dr. watson to nose [them]2191-them out , wo n’t it ? ” [she]127-judith chuckled , as [she]127-judith and [Boyne]145-boyne , with [Chip]123-chip and [Susan]212-susan , scrambled into [the [Paris]42-paris express at [Verona]99-verona]4135-the paris express at verona . It was not till [they]505-the children were in [the train]2658-the train that [Boyne]145-boyne saw the cloud of apprehension descend on [her]127-judith again . But then fatigue intervened , and [she]127-judith fell asleep against [his]145-boyne shoulder as peacefully as [Chip]123-chip , who was curled up opposite with [his]123-chip head in [Susan]212-susan ’s lap . As [they]505-the children sat there , [Boyne]145-boyne remembered how , on the day of [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s picnic , [he]145-boyne had watched [her]127-judith sleeping by [the waterfall]4137-the waterfall , a red glow in [her]127-judith cheeks , velvet shadows under [her]127-judith lashes . Now [her]127-judith face was pinched and sallow , the lids were swollen with goodbye tears ; [she]127-judith seemed farther from [him]145-boyne than [she]127-judith had ever been , yet more in need of [him]145-boyne ; and at the thought something new and tranquillizing entered into [him]145-boyne . [He]145-boyne had caught a glimpse of a joy [he]145-boyne would never reach , and [he]145-boyne knew that [his]145-boyne eyes would always dazzle with it ; but the obligation of giving [Judith]127-judith the help [she]127-judith needed kept [his]145-boyne pain in that deep part of the soul where the great renunciations lie . In [Paris]42-paris [he]145-boyne left [[his]145-boyne companions]1363-his companions at the door of [the _ Nouveau Luxe _]4139-the _ nouveau luxe _ , where [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater was established , drove to [[his]145-boyne own modest hotel]1034-his own modest hotel on [the left bank]4141-the left bank , and turned in for a hard tussle of thinking . [He]145-boyne could no longer put off dealing with [his]145-boyne own case , for [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars was still in [Paris]42-paris . [He]145-boyne had not meant to let [her]163-mrs. sellars know of [his]145-boyne arrival till the next day ; [he]145-boyne needed the interval to get the fatigue and confusion out of [his]145-boyne brain . But meanwhile [he]145-boyne must map out some kind of a working plan ; must clear up [his]145-boyne own mind , and consider how to make it clear to [her]163-mrs. sellars . And after an unprofitable attempt at rest and sleep , and a weary tramp in the rain through [the dusky glittering streets]4142-the dusky glittering streets , [he]145-boyne suddenly decided on immediate action , and turned into a telephone booth to call up [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars . [She]163-mrs. sellars was at [home]290-home and answered immediately . [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia was resting , [she]163-mrs. sellars said ; if [he]145-boyne would come at once [they]4144-they could talk without fear of interruption . [He]145-boyne caught the tremor of joy in [her]163-mrs. sellars voice when [he]145-boyne spoke [her]163-mrs. sellars name — but how like [her]163-mrs. sellars , how perfect of [her]163-mrs. sellars , to ask no questions , to waste no time in exclamations ; just quietly and simply to say “[266-a dr. watson] Come ” ! The healing touch of [her]163-mrs. sellars reasonableness again came to [his]145-boyne rescue . [He]145-boyne would have liked to find [her]163-mrs. sellars close at hand , on the very threshold of the telephone booth ; at the rate at which [his]145-boyne thoughts were spinning [he]145-boyne knew [he]145-boyne would have to go over the whole affair again in [his]145-boyne transit to [[her]163-mrs. sellars hotel]4145-her hotel . But there was no remedy for that ; [he]145-boyne could only trust to [her]163-mrs. sellars lucidity to help [him]145-boyne out . [[Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia ’s apartment]4146-aunt julia ’s apartment was in [a hotel of the [rue de Rivoli]100-rue de rivoli , with a row of windows overhanging the silvery reaches of [the Tuileries gardens]4148-the tuileries gardens]4147-a hotel of the rue de rivoli , with a row of windows overhanging the silvery reaches of the tuileries gardens and the vista of domes and towers beyond . [The room]1180-the room was large , airy , full of flowers . A fire burned on the hearth ; [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ’s touch was everywhere . And a moment later [she]163-mrs. sellars stood there before [him]145-boyne , incredibly slim and young - looking in [her]163-mrs. sellars dark dress and close little hat . Slightly paler , perhaps , and thinner — but as [she]163-mrs. sellars moved forward with [her]163-mrs. sellars easy step the impression vanished . [He]145-boyne felt only [her]163-mrs. sellars mastery of life and of [herself]163-mrs. sellars , and thought how much less [she]163-mrs. sellars needed [him]145-boyne than did [the dishevelled child [he]145-boyne had just left]4150-the dishevelled child he had just left . The thought widened the distance between [them]4151-them , and brought [Judith]127-judith abruptly closer . “[266-a dr. watson] Well , here [I]0-i am , ” [he]145-boyne said—“and[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve failed ! ” [He]145-boyne had prepared a dozen opening phrases — but the sudden intrusion of [Judith]127-judith ’s face dashed them all from [his]145-boyne lips . [He]145-boyne was returning to ask forgiveness of [the woman to whom [he]145-boyne still considered [himself]145-boyne engaged]4152-the woman to whom he still considered himself engaged , and [his]145-boyne first word , after an absence prolonged and unaccountable , was to remind [her]127-judith of the cause of [their]4151-them breach . [He]145-boyne saw the narrowing of [her]127-judith lips , and then [her]127-judith victorious smile . “[2469-dear] [Dear]2469-dear ! Tell [me]0-i about it — [I]0-i want to hear everything , ” [she]127-judith said , holding out [her]127-judith hand . But [he]145-boyne was still struggling in the coil of [his]145-boyne blunder . “[0-i] Oh , never mind — all that ’s really got nothing to do with it , ” [he]145-boyne stammered . [She]127-judith freed [her]127-judith hand , and turned on the electric switch of the nearest lamp . As [she]127-judith bent to it [he]145-boyne saw that the locks escaping on [each temple]4153-each temple were streaked with gray . The sight seemed to lengthen the days of [their]4154-their separation into months and years . [He]145-boyne felt like [a stranger]4155-a stranger coming back to [her]127-judith . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’ve forgiven [me]0-i ? ” [he]145-boyne began . Sit down over there — so . ” [She]127-judith pointed to an armchair , sat down [herself]127-judith , and took off [her]127-judith hat .
