But it was varnished over by [her]127-judith undaunted smile . “[0-i] Let [us]2193-we go back to where [you]0-i began . [I]0-i want to hear all about [the children]505-the children . ” [She]127-judith leaned [her]127-judith head thoughtfully on [her]127-judith hand , in the attitude [he]4156-he had loved in [the little sitting - room at [Cortina]34-cortina]4157-the little sitting - room at cortina . “[0-i] [I]0-i feel like [a ghost]2196-a ghost — ” [he]4156-he said . “[2196-a ghost] No ; for [I]0-i should be a little afraid of [you]0-i if [you]0-i were [a ghost]2196-a ghost ; and now — ” “[2196-a ghost] Well — now .... ” [He]4156-he looked about [the pleasant firelit room]4158-the pleasant firelit room , saw [her]127-judith work - basket in its usual place near the hearth , [her]127-judith books heaped up on a table , and a familiar litter of papers on a desk in the window . “[2196-a ghost] A ghost , ” [he]4156-he repeated . And now [I]0-i — ” [He]4156-he got up , walked across [the room]1180-the room , glanced half - curiously at the titles of some of the books , and came back and leaned against the mantelpiece . What [he]4156-he really wanted was not to tell [her]127-judith anything , but to get up again , and resume [his]4156-he inarticulate wanderings about [the room]1180-the room . [He]4156-he had better try to do what [she]127-judith had asked [him]4156-he . “[0-i] About [the children]505-the children — well , the break up was bound to come . [You]0-i were right about it , of course . But [I]0-i was so sorry for the poor little devils that [I]0-i tried to blind [myself]0-i .... ” [His]4156-he tongue was loosened , and [he]4156-he found it easier to go on . After all , [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars was right ; the story of [the children]505-the children must be disposed of first . After that [he]4156-he might see more clearly into [his]4156-he own case and [hers]127-judith . [He]4156-he went on with [his]4156-he halting narrative , and [she]127-judith listened in silence — that rare silence of [hers]127-judith which was all alertness and sympathy . [She]127-judith smiled a little over the Princess Buondelmonte ’s invasion , and sighed and frowned when [he]4156-he mentioned that [Lady Wrench]183-lady wrench was also impending . [I]0-i do n’t know . Well , [she]120-mrs. wheater had the good sense to ask [him]200-mr. dobree to take charge of things for [her]120-mrs. wheater , and though [he]200-mr. dobree does n’t often accept new cases nowadays [he]200-mr. dobree was so sorry for [the children]505-the children — and for [her]120-mrs. wheater too , [he]200-mr. dobree says — that [he]200-mr. dobree agreed to look after [her]120-mrs. wheater interests . And [he]200-mr. dobree tells [me]0-i that if [she]120-mrs. wheater follows [his]200-mr. dobree advice , and keeps out of new entanglements , [he]200-mr. dobree thinks [she]120-mrs. wheater can divorce [Mr. Wheater]126-mr. wheater on [her]120-mrs. wheater own terms , and in that case of course [the courts]2209-the courts will give [her]120-mrs. wheater all [the children]505-the children . Is n’t that the very best news [I]0-i could give [you]0-i ? ” [He]200-mr. dobree tried to answer , but again found [himself]200-mr. dobree benumbed . [Her]120-mrs. wheater eyes continued to challenge [him]200-mr. dobree . “[0-i] It ’s more than [you]200-mr. dobree hoped ? ” [she]120-mrs. wheater smiled . “[0-i] It ’s not in the least what [I]0-i expected . ” [She]120-mrs. wheater waited for [him]200-mr. dobree to continue , but [he]200-mr. dobree was silent again , and [she]120-mrs. wheater questioned suddenly : “[200-mr. dobree] What _ did _ [you]200-mr. dobree expect ? ” [He]200-mr. dobree looked at [her]120-mrs. wheater with a confused stare , as if [her]120-mrs. wheater face had become that of [a stranger]4155-a stranger , as familiar faces do in a dream . “[200-mr. dobree] [Dobree]200-mr. dobree , ” [he]200-mr. dobree said—“this[200-mr. dobree] [Dobree]200-mr. dobree .... ” [She]120-mrs. wheater kindled . “[200-mr. dobree] [You]200-mr. dobree ’re very unfair to [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , [Martin]193-martin ; [you]200-mr. dobree always have been . [He]200-mr. dobree ’s not only [a great lawyer , whose advice [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater is lucky to have]2211-a great lawyer , whose advice mrs. wheater is lucky to have , but [a kind and wise friend]2212-a kind and wise friend ... and [a good man]2213-a good man , ” [she]120-mrs. wheater added . “[2213-a good man] Yes , ” [he]200-mr. dobree said , hardly hearing [her]120-mrs. wheater . All the torture of [his]200-mr. dobree hour of madness about [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree had returned to [him]200-mr. dobree . [He]200-mr. dobree would have liked to leap up on the instant , and go and find [him]200-mr. dobree , and fight it out with [his]200-mr. dobree fists .... “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t think , ” [she]120-mrs. wheater continued nervously , “[0-i] what more [you]193-martin could have hoped .... ” [He]200-mr. dobree made a weary gesture . “[0-i] God knows ! But what does it matter ? ” “[0-i] Matter ? Does n’t it matter to [you]193-martin that [the children]505-the children should be safe — be provided for ? That in this new crash [they]505-the children should remain with [[their]505-the children mother]386-their mother , and not be tossed about again from pillar to post ? If [you]193-martin did n’t want that , what did [you]193-martin want ? ” “[193-martin] [I]0-i wanted — somehow — to get [them]505-the children all out of this hell . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i believe [you]193-martin exaggerate . [You]193-martin say [the new Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte seems well - meaning , and kind in [her]257-the princess buondelmonte way ; and as for [Zinnie]133-zinnie — [I]0-i suppose [Zinnie]133-zinnie is the one of the party the best able to take care of [herself]133-zinnie . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose so , ” [he]200-mr. dobree acceded . “[0-i] Well , then—. ” [She]0-i paused , and then repeated , with a sharper stress : “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t yet see what [you]193-martin want . ” [He]200-mr. dobree looked about [him]200-mr. dobree with the same estranged stare with which [his]200-mr. dobree eyes had rested on [her]0-i face . Something clear and impenetrable as a pane of crystal seemed to cut [him]200-mr. dobree off from [her]0-i , and from all that surrounded [her]0-i . [He]200-mr. dobree had been to [the country from which [travellers]3752-travellers return with [another soul]4166-another soul]4164-the country from which travellers return with another soul . “[0-i] What [I]0-i want ... ? ” Ah , [he]200-mr. dobree knew that well enough ! What [he]200-mr. dobree wanted , at the moment , was just some opiate to dull the dogged ache of body and soul — to close [his]200-mr. dobree ears against that laugh of [Judith]127-judith ’s , and all [his]200-mr. dobree senses to [her]0-i nearness . [He]200-mr. dobree was caught body and soul — that was it ; and real loving was not the delicate distraction , the food for dreams , [he]200-mr. dobree had imagined it when [he]200-mr. dobree thought [himself]200-mr. dobree in love with [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars ; it was this perpetual obsession , this clinging nearness , this breaking on the rack of every bone , and tearing apart of every fibre . And [his]200-mr. dobree apprenticeship to it was just beginning .... Well , there was one thing certain ; it was that [he]200-mr. dobree must get away , as soon as [he]200-mr. dobree could , from [the friendly room]4167-the friendly room and [Rose]162-rose sellars ’s forgiving presence . [He]200-mr. dobree tried to blunder into some sort of explanation . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t suppose [I]0-i ’ve any business to be [here]2434-here , ” [he]200-mr. dobree began abruptly . [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars was silent ; but it was not one of [her]163-mrs. sellars speaking silences . It was like a great emptiness slowly widening between [them]4168-them . For a moment [he]200-mr. dobree thought [she]163-mrs. sellars meant to force on [him]200-mr. dobree the task of bridging it over ; then [he]200-mr. dobree saw that [she]163-mrs. sellars was struggling with a pain as benumbing as [his]200-mr. dobree own . [She]163-mrs. sellars could not think of anything to say any more than [he]200-mr. dobree could , and [her]163-mrs. sellars helplessness moved [him]200-mr. dobree , and brought [her]163-mrs. sellars nearer . “[2220-she] [She]2220-she wants to end it decently , as [I]0-i do , ” [he]200-mr. dobree thought ; but [his]200-mr. dobree pity for [her]163-mrs. sellars did not help [him]200-mr. dobree to find words . At length [he]200-mr. dobree got up and held out [his]200-mr. dobree hand . “[2220-she] [You]2220-she ’re [the best friend [I]0-i ’ve ever had]2221-the best friend i ’ve ever had — and the dearest . But [I]0-i ’m going off on a big job somewhere ; [I]0-i must . At [the other end of the world]2538-the other end of the world . For a time — ” “[0-i] Yes , ” [she]163-mrs. sellars assented , very low . [She]163-mrs. sellars did not take the hand [he]200-mr. dobree held out — perhaps did not even see it . When [two people]4169-two people part who have loved [each other]396-each other it is as if what happens between [them]4169-two people befell in a great emptiness — as if the tearing asunder of the flesh must turn at last into a disembodied anguish . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’ve forgotten [your]0-i umbrella , ” [she]163-mrs. sellars said , as [he]200-mr. dobree reached the door . [He]200-mr. dobree gave a little laugh as [he]200-mr. dobree came back to get it . XXXI The next day [Boyne]145-boyne lunched at [the _ Nouveau Luxe _]4139-the _ nouveau luxe _ alone with [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater and [Judith]127-judith . [He]145-boyne had wondered if it would occur to [Joyce]129-joyce that it might be preferable to lunch [upstairs]3110-upstairs , in [[her]129-joyce own rooms]4173-her own rooms ; but it had not ; and [his]145-boyne mind was too dulled with pain for [him]145-boyne to care much for [his]145-boyne surroundings . [No crowd]4174-no crowd could make [him]145-boyne feel farther away from [Judith]127-judith than the unseeing look in [her]127-judith own eyes . [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater was dressed with a Quaker - like austerity which made [her]127-judith look younger and handsomer than when [he]145-boyne had last seen [her]127-judith , in [the rakish apparel of [the Lido]57-the lido]4175-the rakish apparel of the lido . [She]127-judith had acquired another new voice , as [she]127-judith did with each new phase ; this time it was subdued and somewhat melancholy , but less studied than the fluty tones [she]127-judith had affected in [Venice]8-venice . Altogether , [Boyne]145-boyne had to admit that [she]127-judith had improved — that [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s influence had achieved what [others]820-others had failed to do . After lunch [they]4177-they went [upstairs]3110-upstairs , and [Joyce]129-joyce proposed to [Judith]127-judith that , as the rain had stopped , [she]127-judith should take [Chipstone]142-chipstone and [Susan]212-susan to [the Bois de Boulogne]4179-the bois de boulogne . [She]127-judith [herself]127-judith wanted to have a quiet talk with [dear [Martin]193-martin]4180-dear martin — [Judith]127-judith could send [the motor]4181-the motor back to pick [her]127-judith up at four ; no , at half - past three . [She]127-judith had promised to go to a wonderful loan exhibition of Incunabula with [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree .... [Judith]127-judith nodded and disappeared , with a faint smile at [Boyne]145-boyne . [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree had opened [her]129-joyce eyes to so many marvels , [Joyce]129-joyce continued when [they]4182-they were alone . [Incunabula]101-incunabula , for instance — would [Boyne]145-boyne believe that [she]129-joyce had never before heard of [their]101-incunabula existence ? [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree had thought [she]129-joyce must be joking when [she]129-joyce asked [him]200-mr. dobree what [they]101-incunabula were . But [Martin]193-martin knew how much chance [she]129-joyce had had of cultivating [herself]129-joyce in [[Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater ’s society]4183-cliffe ’s society .... Yes , and [she]129-joyce was beginning to collect books — first editions — and to form a real library . Did n’t [he]200-mr. dobree think it would be a splendid thing for [the children]505-the children — especially for [Terry]265-terry ? [She]129-joyce blushed to think that while [the family]289-the family travelled over [Europe]24-europe in [steam - yachts]4186-steam - yachts and [Blue Trains]102-blue trains and [Rolls - Royces]4187-rolls - royces , [poor [Terry]265-terry]4188-poor terry had had to feed on the rubbish [Scopy]132-scopy could pick up for [him]265-terry in [hotel libraries]4189-hotel libraries , or the _ cabinets de lecture _ of [frowsy watering - places]4190-frowsy watering - places . [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree had been horrified when [he]200-mr. dobree found that [Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater , with all [his]265-terry millions , had never owned [a library]4191-a library ! But then [he]200-mr. dobree did n’t know [Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater . [Joyce]129-joyce went on to unfold [her]129-joyce plans for the future . [She]129-joyce spoke , as usual , as if they were fixed and immutable in every detail . [She]129-joyce had decided to buy [a place in [the country]3426-the country]4192-a place in the country — near either [Paris]42-paris or [Dinard]103-dinard , [she]129-joyce was n’t sure which . Probably [Dinard]103-dinard on account of [Terry]265-terry ’s health . The climate was mild ; and it was said that there were educational advantages . If [the sea]589-the sea was too strong for [him]200-mr. dobree [she]129-joyce could find [a house]4195-a house [somewhere inland]4196-somewhere inland . But [they]4197-they must be near [a town]4198-a town on account of [the children]505-the children ’s education , and yet not in it because of the demoralising influences , and the lack of good air . In a few days [she]129-joyce was going down to look about [her]129-joyce at [Dinard]103-dinard .... [Boyne]145-boyne knew , [she]129-joyce supposed , that [she]129-joyce had begun divorce proceedings ? Of course [she]129-joyce ought to have done it long ago — but in [that _ milieu _ one]4200-that _ milieu _ one ’s moral sense got absolutely blunted . Evidence — ? Heavens ! [She]129-joyce already had more than enough to make [her]129-joyce own terms . Horrors and horrors .... There was no doubt , [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree said , that [the courts]2209-the courts would give [her]129-joyce the custody of [all the children]3133-all the children . And from now on [they]3133-all the children would be the sole object of [her]129-joyce life . Did n’t [Boyne]145-boyne agree that , at [her]129-joyce age , there could n’t be a more perfect conclusion ? Oh , yes , [she]129-joyce knew — [she]129-joyce looked younger than [she]129-joyce really was ... but there were gray streaks in [her]129-joyce hair already ; had n’t [he]200-mr. dobree noticed ? And [she]129-joyce was n’t going to dye it ; not [she]129-joyce ! [She]129-joyce was going to let [herself]129-joyce turn [frankly]4203-frankly into [an _ old woman]4204-an _ old woman _ . [She]129-joyce did n’t mind the idea a bit . [She]133-zinnie was rather a handful , [Zinnie]133-zinnie was ; [no one]2415-no one but [Judy]127-judith could control [her]133-zinnie . Still , grieved as [Joyce]129-joyce would be to give up the “[0-i] steps , ” poor little souls , [she]129-joyce was too much used to human ingratitude not to foresee that [they]4221-they might be taken from [her]129-joyce at any moment . But [[her]129-joyce own children]3938-her own children — no ! Never again . Of [that Boyne]4223-that boyne might be assured . [She]129-joyce had learned [her]129-joyce lesson , [her]129-joyce eyes had been opened to [her]129-joyce own folly and imprudence ; and [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree had absolutely promised [her]129-joyce — oh , by the way , was n’t [Martin]193-martin going to stay and see [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , who would be turning up at any minute now to take [her]129-joyce to see the Incunabula ? [She]129-joyce thought [he]200-mr. dobree and [Martin]193-martin had met at [Cortina]34-cortina , had n’t [they]4224-they ? [He]145-boyne got [himself]145-boyne out of [the room]1180-the room in a confusion of excuses .... All day [he]145-boyne wandered through [the streets]4228-the streets , inconsolably . [His]145-boyne will - power seemed paralysed . [He]145-boyne was determined to get away from [Paris]42-paris at once , to go to [New York]13-new york first , in quest of a job , and then to whatever end of [the world]307-the world the job should call [him]145-boyne . When [he]145-boyne grew too tired to walk farther [he]145-boyne turned in at [a post - office]4233-a post - office , and wrote a cable which [he]145-boyne had been revolving for some hours . Luckily [he]145-boyne had not been able to , and [he]145-boyne cabled : “[0-i] Should like for [myself]0-i the job [you]2223-you wrote about . Can [I]0-i have it ? Can start at once . [Cable bankers]2224-cable bankers . ” This message despatched , [he]145-boyne turned to the telephone booth , rang up the _ Nouveau Luxe _ , and asked to speak to [Miss Wheater]140-miss wheater . Interminable minutes passed after [he]145-boyne had put in [his]145-boyne call ; [[Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s maid]4081-mrs. wheater ’s maid was found first , who did n’t know where [Judith]127-judith was , or how to find [her]127-judith ; then [Susan]212-susan , who said [Judith]127-judith had come back , and gone out again , and that all [she]212-susan knew was that [the ladies]4237-the ladies were going to dine out that evening with [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , and go to [the theatre]4238-the theatre . [He]145-boyne jumped into [a taxi]4241-a taxi , secured a table in a remote corner of [the tea - room]4242-the tea - room , and met [her]127-judith on the threshold a moment later . It was already long after six , and [the rooms]2584-the rooms were emptying ; in a few minutes [they]4244-they would have [the place]601-the place to [themselves]4244-they . [Judith]127-judith , a little flushed with the haste of [her]127-judith arrival , looked gracefully grown up in [her]127-judith dark coat edged with fur , a pretty antelope bag in [her]127-judith gloved hand . [The bareheaded girl of the Dolomites]4246-the bareheaded girl of the dolomites , in sports ’ frock and russet shoes , had been replaced by [a demure young woman who seemed to [Boyne]145-boyne almost [a stranger]4155-a stranger]4247-a demure young woman who seemed to boyne almost a stranger . “[193-martin] [Martin]193-martin ! [He]145-boyne said [he]145-boyne was , for a few days at any rate ; the mere sound of [her]127-judith voice , the look in [her]127-judith eyes , had nearly dissolved [his]145-boyne plans again , and [his]145-boyne own voice was unsteady . Yes — oh , yes , [he]145-boyne said — very probably . “[193-martin] Because , [you]193-martin know , [the children’ll]2225-the children’ll be [here]2434-here by that time , ” [she]127-judith announced ; and , turning [her]127-judith attention to the trays presented : “[2225-the children’ll] Oh , both , [I]0-i think — yes , [I]0-i ’ll take both . ” “[505-the children] [The children]505-the children ? ” “[505-the children] Yes ; [mother]2490-mother ’s just settled it . [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree wrote the wire for [her]2490-mother . If [Nanny]156-nanny gets it in time [they]505-the children ’re to start to - morrow . [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree thinks [we]2229-we may be able to keep the steps too — [he]200-mr. dobree ’s going to write [himself]200-mr. dobree to [Buondelmonte]151-astorre . And [he]200-mr. dobree does n’t believe [the Wrenches]208-the wrenches will ever bother [us]2229-we about [Zinnie]133-zinnie ... at least not at present . [He]200-mr. dobree ’s found out a lot of things about [Lord Wrench]185-lord wrench , and [he]200-mr. dobree thinks [Zinnia’ll]267-zinnia’ll have [her]267-zinnia’ll hands full with [him]200-mr. dobree , without tackling [Zinnie]133-zinnie too . ” [She]2490-mother spoke serenely , almost lightly , as if all [her]2490-mother anxieties had been dispelled . Could it be that the mere change of scene , the few hours spent with [[her]2490-mother mother]382-her mother , had so completely reassured [her]2490-mother ? [She]2490-mother , who had always measured [Joyce]129-joyce with such precocious insight , was it possible that [she]2490-mother was deluded by [her]2490-mother now ? Or had [she]2490-mother too succumbed to [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ’s mysterious influence ? [Boyne]145-boyne looked at [her]2490-mother careless face and wondered . “[200-mr. dobree] But [this Dobree]200-mr. dobree — [you]200-mr. dobree did n’t fancy [him]200-mr. dobree much at [Cortina]34-cortina ? What makes [you]200-mr. dobree believe in [him]200-mr. dobree now ? ” [She]2490-mother seemed a little puzzled , and wrinkled [her]2490-mother brows in the effort to find a reason . “[200-mr. dobree] [I]0-i do n’t know . [He]200-mr. dobree ’s funny looking , of course ; and rather pompous . And [I]0-i do like [you]200-mr. dobree heaps better , [Martin]193-martin . But [he]200-mr. dobree ’s been most awfully good about [the children]505-the children , and [he]200-mr. dobree can make [mother]2490-mother do whatever [he]200-mr. dobree tells [her]2490-mother . And [she]2490-mother says [he]200-mr. dobree ’s [a great lawyer]2232-a great lawyer , and [[his]200-mr. dobree clients]2233-his clients almost always win [their]2233-his clients cases . Oh , [Martin]193-martin , would n’t it be heavenly if [he]200-mr. dobree could really keep [us]2234-us together , steps and all ? [He]200-mr. dobree ’s sworn to [me]0-i that [he]200-mr. dobree will . ” [She]2490-mother turned [her]2490-mother radiant eyes on [Boyne]145-boyne . “[200-mr. dobree] Anyhow , [the children]505-the children will be [here]2434-here the day after to - morrow , and that will be splendid , wo n’t it ? [You]193-martin must get back from [London]78-london as soon as ever [you]193-martin can , and take [us]2234-us all off somewhere for the day , just as if [we]2234-us were still at [Cortina]34-cortina . ” Yes , of course [he]145-boyne would , [Boyne]145-boyne said ; on [Scopy]132-scopy ’s book [he]145-boyne would . [She]2490-mother lit up at that , asking where [they]505-the children ’d better go , and finally settling that , if the rain ever held up , a day at [Versailles]104-versailles would be jollier than anything .... But it must be soon , [she]2490-mother reminded [him]145-boyne ; because in a few days [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater was going to carry [them]505-the children all off to [Dinard]103-dinard . Yes , [she]2490-mother pursued , [she]2490-mother really did feel that [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , just in a few weeks , had gained more influence over [[her]2490-mother mother]382-her mother than [any one else]1619-any one else ever had . [Judith]127-judith had had a long talk with [him]145-boyne that morning , and [he]145-boyne had told [her]2490-mother frankly that [he]145-boyne was doing it all out of interest in [the children]505-the children , and because [he]145-boyne wanted to help [her]2490-mother — wasn’t that dear of [him]145-boyne ? Anyhow , [they]505-the children were all going to stand together , [grown ups]4018-grown ups and [children]2617-children , and put up a last big fight . ( “[193-martin] On [Scopy]132-scopy ’s book , ” [Boyne]145-boyne interpolated with a strained smile . ) And [they]505-the children were to have [a big house in [the country]3426-the country]4255-a big house in the country , with lots of dogs and horses , [she]2490-mother continued . And [the children]505-the children were never to go to [hotels]3439-hotels any more . And [Terry]265-terry was to have [a really first - rate tutor]4259-a really first - rate tutor , and be sent to [school]2671-school in [Switzerland]48-switzerland as soon as [he]265-terry was strong enough ; in another year , perhaps . [Boyne]145-boyne sat watching [her]2490-mother with insatiable eyes . [She]2490-mother looked so efficient , so experienced — yet what could be surer proof of [her]2490-mother childishness than this suddenly revived faith in the future ? [He]145-boyne saw that whoever would promise to keep [the children]505-the children together would gain a momentary hold over [her]2490-mother — as [he]145-boyne once had , alas ! And [he]145-boyne saw also that the mere change of scene , the excitement of the flight from [Cortina]34-cortina , the encouragement which [[her]2490-mother mother]382-her mother ’s new attitude gave [her]2490-mother , were so many balloons lifting [her]2490-mother up into the blue .... “[193-martin] It will be [Versailles]104-versailles , do n’t [you]2237-he think so ? ” [she]0-i began again . “[2237-he] Or , if it rains deluges , what about [the circus]2238-the circus , and a big tea afterward , somewhere where [Chip]123-chip and [Nanny]156-nanny could come too ? ” [She]0-i looked at [him]2237-he with [her]0-i hesitating smile . “[0-i] [I]0-i thought , perhaps , if [you]2237-he did n’t mind — but , no , [darling]3107-darling , ” [she]0-i broke off decisively , “[3107-darling] [we]2240-we wo n’t ask [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree ! ” “[2241-lord] [Lord]2241-lord — [I]0-i should hope not ; not if [I]0-i ’m giving the party . ” [He]2237-he found the voice and laugh [she]0-i expected , gave [her]0-i back [her]0-i banter , discussed and fixed with [her]0-i the day and hour of the party . And all the while there echoed in [his]2237-he ears , more insistently than anything [she]0-i was saying , a line or two from the chorus of Lemures , in “[268-faust] [Faust]268-faust , ” which [Rose]162-rose sellars had read aloud one evening at [Cortina]34-cortina . _ Who made [the room]1180-the room so mean and bare — Where are the chairs , the tables where ? It was lent for a moment only — _ A moment only : not a bad title for the history of [his]2237-he last few months ! A moment only ; and [he]2237-he had always known it . “[268-faust] An episode , ” [he]2237-he thought , “[2241-lord] it ’s been only an episode . One of those things that come up out of [the sea]589-the sea , on a full - moon night , playing the harp .... Yes ; but sometimes the episodes last , and the things one thought eternal wither like grass — and only the gods know which it will be ... if _ [they]2243-they _ do .... “ _ L’addition , mademoiselle ? _ [Good Lord]1660-good lord , [child]2459-child ; four _ éclairs _ ? On the day fixed for [the children]505-the children ’s picnic [Boyne]145-boyne lay half asleep on [the deck of [a South American liner]2249-a south american liner]2248-the deck of a south american liner . It was better so — a lot better . The morning after [he]145-boyne had parted from [Judith]127-judith at the door of the _ Nouveau Luxe _ the summons had come : “ Job [yours]145-boyne please sail immediately for [Rio]105-rio particulars on arrival ”[2252-the busy man] ; and [he]145-boyne had just had time to pitch [his]145-boyne things into [his]145-boyne portmanteaux , catch [the first train]3472-the first train for [London]78-london , and scramble on board [[his]145-boyne boat]2251-his boat at [Liverpool]106-liverpool . A lot better so .... [The busy man]2252-the busy man ’s way of liquidating hopeless situations . It reminded [him]145-boyne of the old times when , at the receipt of such a summons , cares and complications fell from [him]145-boyne like dust from a shaken garment . It would not be so now ; [his]145-boyne elasticity was gone . Yet already , after four days at [sea]2253-sea , [he]145-boyne was beginning to feel a vague solace in the empty present , and in the future packed with duties . No hesitating , speculating , wavering to and fro — [he]145-boyne was to be caught as soon as [he]145-boyne landed , and thrust into the stiff harness of [his]145-boyne work . And meanwhile , more and more miles of [sea]2253-sea were slipping in between [him]145-boyne and the last months , making them already seem remote and vapoury compared with the firm outline of the future . The day was mild , with a last touch of summer on the lazy waves over which they were gliding .... [He]145-boyne closed [his]145-boyne eyes and slept .... At Versailles too it was mild ; there were yellow leaves still on the beeches of the long walks ; they formed golden tunnels , with hazy blueish vistas where [the park]2255-the park melted into the blur of [the forest]946-the forest . But [the gardens]2257-the gardens were almost deserted ; it was too late in the season for [the children]505-the children chasing [their]505-the children hoops and balls down [the alleys]2259-the alleys , the groups of [nurses]2666-nurses knitting and gossiping on wooden chairs under the great stone Dianas and [Apollos]269-apollos . Funny — [he]145-boyne and [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters seemed to have [the lordly pleasure - grounds]2261-the lordly pleasure - grounds to [themselves]2262-their . The clipped walls of beech and hornbean echoed with [their]2262-their shouts and laughter . What [a handful]2263-a handful [the little Wheaters]788-the little wheaters were getting to be ! [Terry]265-terry , now , could run and jump with [the rest]2265-the rest ; and as for [Chip]123-chip , rounder than ever in a white fur coat and tasselled cap , [his]123-chip waddle was turning into a scamper .... In the sun , under a high protecting hedge , [Miss Scope]147-miss scope and [Nanny]156-nanny sat and beamed upon [[their]2262-their children]704-their children ; and [Susan]212-susan flew down the vistas after [Chip]123-chip .... [Boyne]145-boyne and [Judith]127-judith were alone . [They]2262-their had wandered away into [one of [the _ bosquets _]2268-the _ bosquets _]2267-one of the _ bosquets _ : solitary even in summer , with vacant - faced divinities niched in green , broken arcades , [toy temples deserted of [[their]2262-their gods]2270-their gods]2269-toy temples deserted of their gods . On this November day , when mist was everywhere , mist trailing through the half - bare trees , lying in a faint bloom on the lichened statues , oozing up from the layers of leaves underfoot , [the place]601-the place seemed the ghostly setting of dead days . [Boyne]145-boyne looked down at [Judith]127-judith , and even [her]127-judith face was ghostly .... “ Come , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne said with a shiver , “ let ’s get back into the sun—. ”[145-boyne] Outside of [the _ bosquet _]2272-the _ bosquet _ , down [the alley]2273-the alley , [the children]505-the children came storming toward [them]2262-their , shouting , laughing and wrangling . [Boyne]145-boyne , laughing too , caught up [the furry Chip]123-chip , and swung [him]123-chip high in air . [Bun]135-bun , to attract [his]145-boyne attention , turned a new somersault at [his]145-boyne feet , and [Zinnie]133-zinnie and [Beechy]154-beechy squealed : “ [Martin]193-martin , now ’s the time for presents ! ”[154-beechy] For , since [the Princess Buondelmonte]257-the princess buondelmonte had been so shocked by [their]505-the children cupidity , it had become a joke with [the children]505-the children to be always petitioning for presents . “ Little devils — as if [I]145-boyne could ever leave [them]505-the children ! ”[145-boyne] [Boyne]145-boyne thought . “ Tea , [sir]2430-sir ? ”[359-the steward] said [the steward]359-the steward . “ Ham sandwiches ? ”[359-the steward] XXXII [Boyne]145-boyne was coming back from [Brazil]28-brazil . [[His]145-boyne steamer]2277-his steamer was approaching [Bordeaux]107-bordeaux , moving up [the estuary of [the Gironde]108-the gironde]2278-the estuary of the gironde under a September sky as mild as the one which had roofed [his]145-boyne sleep when , nearly three years earlier , [he]145-boyne had dreamt [he]145-boyne was at [Versailles]104-versailles with [the little Wheaters]130-the wheaters . Three years of work and accomplishment lay behind [him]145-boyne . And the job was not over ; that was the best of it . A touch of fever had disabled [him]145-boyne , and [he]145-boyne was to take a few weeks ’ holiday in [Europe]24-europe , and then return to [his]145-boyne task . [His]145-boyne first idea had been to put in this interval of convalescence in [America]2-america ; to take the opportunity to look up [[his]145-boyne people]2279-his people , and see [a few old friends in [New York]13-new york]2280-a few old friends in new york . But [he]145-boyne was sure to find [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars in [New York]13-new york , or near [it]13-new york ; [he]145-boyne could hardly go [there]2439-there without being obliged to see [her]162-rose sellars . And the time for that had not yet come — if it ever would . [He]145-boyne looked at [his]145-boyne grizzled head , [his]145-boyne sallow features with brown fever - blotches under the skin , and put away the idea with a grimace . The tropics seemed fairly to have burnt [him]145-boyne out .... [Rose Sellars]162-rose sellars had been kind ; [she]162-rose sellars had been perfect , as [he]145-boyne had foreseen [she]162-rose sellars would be . [He]145-boyne knew that , after a winter on [the Nile]109-the nile with [Aunt Julia]203-aunt julia , [she]162-rose sellars had returned to [[her]162-rose sellars own house in [New York]13-new york]2282-her own house in new york ; for , once re - established [there]2439-there , [she]162-rose sellars had begun to write to [him]145-boyne again . From [her]162-rose sellars letters — which were free from all recriminations , all returning to the past — [he]145-boyne learned that [she]162-rose sellars had taken up [her]162-rose sellars old life again : the reading , the social round , the small preoccupations . But [he]145-boyne saw [her]162-rose sellars going through the old routine with transparent hands and empty eyes , as [he]145-boyne could picture the ghosts of [good women doing in the world of shadows]2284-good women doing in the world of shadows . [His]145-boyne own case was more fortunate . [His]145-boyne eyes were full of visions of work to be , [his]145-boyne hands of the strength of work done . Yet at times [he]145-boyne too felt tenuous and disembodied . Since the fever , particularly — it was always disastrous to [him]145-boyne to have to interrupt [his]145-boyne work . And [this flat soft shore]2285-this flat soft shore that gave [him]145-boyne welcome — so safe , so familiar — how it frightened [him]145-boyne ! [He]145-boyne did n’t want to come in contact with life again , and life always wooed [him]145-boyne when [he]145-boyne was not at work . It was odd , how little , of late , [he]145-boyne had thought of [the Wheaters]130-the wheaters . At first the memory of [them]130-the wheaters had been a torture , an obsession . But luckily [he]145-boyne had not given [his]145-boyne address to [Judith]127-judith , and so [she]127-judith had not been able to write ; and [Mrs. Sellars]163-mrs. sellars had never once alluded to [the children]505-the children . [His]145-boyne work in [Brazil]28-brazil lay [up country]2287-up country , far from [towns]2288-towns and [post - offices]2289-post - offices ; but bundles of American newspapers straggled in at uncertain intervals , and from one [he]145-boyne had learned that the Wheater divorce had been pronounced in [Mrs. Wheater]120-mrs. wheater ’s favour , from another , about a year later , that [Cliffe]120-mrs. wheater had married [Mrs. Lullmer]222-mrs. lullmer . There had been an end of the story ... and [Boyne]145-boyne had lived long enough to know that abrupt endings were best . As [[his]145-boyne steamer]2277-his steamer pushed [her]2277-his steamer way up [the estuary]2291-the estuary [he]145-boyne was still asking [himself]145-boyne how [he]145-boyne should employ [his]145-boyne holiday . All [his]145-boyne thoughts were with [his]145-boyne interrupted work , with [the man who had temporarily replaced [him]145-boyne , and of whose judgment and temper [he]145-boyne was not quite sure]2292-the man who had temporarily replaced him , and of whose judgment and temper he was not quite sure . [He]145-boyne could not as yet bring [himself]145-boyne to consider [his]145-boyne own plans for the coming weeks , because , till [he]145-boyne could get back to [Brazil]28-brazil , everything that might happen to [him]145-boyne seemed equally uninteresting and negligible . At dinner that evening , at [the famous _ Chapeau Rouge _ of Bordeaux]2293-the famous _ chapeau rouge _ of bordeaux , the fresh truffles cooked in white wine , and washed down with a bottle of [Château Margaux]270-château margaux insensibly altered [his]145-boyne mood . [He]145-boyne had forgotten what good food could be like . [His]145-boyne view of life was softened , and even the faces of [the people at the other tables]2294-the people at the other tables , commonplace as [they]2294-the people at the other tables were , gradually began to interest [him]145-boyne . At the steamer landing the walls were plastered over with flamboyant advertisements of [the watering - places of [the Basque coast]2296-the basque coast]2295-the watering - places of the basque coast : [Cibour]110-cibour , [Hendaye]111-hendaye , [St. Jean de Luz]271-st. jean de luz , [Biarritz]29-biarritz . [A band of gay bathers on [a white beach]2298-a white beach , under striped umbrellas , was labelled [Hendaye]111-hendaye]2297-a band of gay bathers on a white beach , under striped umbrellas , was labelled hendaye ; another , of [slim ladies silhouetted on [a terrace]2300-a terrace against [a cobalt sea]2301-a cobalt sea]2299-slim ladies silhouetted on a terrace against a cobalt sea , while [[their]2302-their partners]2303-their partners absorbed cocktails at little tables , stood for [Biarritz]29-biarritz . The scene recalled to [Boyne]145-boyne similar spectacles all [the world]307-the world over : casinos , dancing , gambling , the monotonous rattle and glare of cosmopolitan pleasure . And suddenly [he]145-boyne felt that to be in [such a crowd]2305-such a crowd was what [he]145-boyne wanted — [a crowd of [idle insignificant people]2307-idle insignificant people , not one of whom [he]145-boyne would ever care to see again]2306-a crowd of idle insignificant people , not one of whom he would ever care to see again . [He]145-boyne took [the train]2658-the train for [Biarritz]29-biarritz .... [The place]601-the place was in full season ; but [he]145-boyne found [a room in [a cheap hotel far from [the sea]589-the sea]2318-a cheap hotel far from the sea]2317-a room in a cheap hotel far from the sea , and forthwith began to mix with [the crowd]1332-the crowd . At first [his]145-boyne deep inner loneliness cut [him]145-boyne off from [them]1332-the crowd ; that [people]463-people should be leading such lives seemed too absurd and inconsequent . But gradually the glitter took [him]145-boyne , as it often had before after a long bout of hard work and isolation ; [he]145-boyne enjoyed the feeling of being lost in the throng , alone and unnoticed , with no likelihood of being singled out , like [Uncle Edward]115-uncle edward , for some agreeable adventure . Adventure ! [He]145-boyne had come to hate the very word . [His]145-boyne one taste of the thing had been too bitter . All [he]145-boyne wanted now was to be amused ; and [he]145-boyne hugged [his]145-boyne anonymity . For three days [he]145-boyne wandered about , in [cafés]2322-cafés , on terraces above [the sea]589-the sea , and in [the gaming - rooms]2324-the gaming - rooms . [He]145-boyne even made an excursion across [the Spanish border]2325-the spanish border ; but [he]145-boyne came back from [it]2326-it tired and dispirited . Solitude and scenery were not what [he]145-boyne wanted ; [he]145-boyne plunged into [the Medley]112-the medley again . On the fourth day [he]145-boyne saw the announcement : “ Gala Dinner and Dance tonight at [the _ Mirasol _ . ”[145-boyne] The _ Mirasol _]4270-the _ mirasol _ . ” the _ mirasol _ was [the newest and most fashionable hotel in [Biarritz]29-biarritz]2327-the newest and most fashionable hotel in biarritz — [the “ Palace ”[145-boyne] of the moment]2328-the “ palace ” of the moment . The idea of assisting at the gala dinner took [Boyne]145-boyne ’s fancy , and in the afternoon [he]145-boyne strolled up to [the hotel]1085-the hotel to engage a table . But [they]2330-they were all bespoken , and [he]145-boyne sat down in [the hall]711-the hall to glance over some illustrated papers . [The place]601-the place , at that hour , was nearly empty ; but presently [he]145-boyne heard a pipe of childish laughter coming from the corner where [the lift]1241-the lift was caged . [Several liveried lift - boys]2334-several liveried lift - boys were hanging about in idleness , and among [them]2334-several liveried lift - boys was [a little girl with long legs , incredibly short skirts and a fiery bush of hair]2335-a little girl with long legs , incredibly short skirts and a fiery bush of hair . [She]2335-a little girl with long legs , incredibly short skirts and a fiery bush of hair was wrestling with the smallest of [the lift - boys]2336-the lift - boys , while [the others]2515-the others looked on and grinned . Presently [a stout lady descended from a magnificent motor]2338-a stout lady descended from a magnificent motor , entered [the hotel]1085-the hotel and walked across [the hall]711-the hall to [the lift]1241-the lift . [One fat old gentleman in spats]2352-one fat old gentleman in spats produced a bag of sweets , and pinched [her]2335-a little girl with long legs , incredibly short skirts and a fiery bush of hair bare arm as [he]145-boyne gave it to [her]2335-a little girl with long legs , incredibly short skirts and a fiery bush of hair ; and [a lady in black with a little girl]2353-a lady in black with a little girl drew [the latter]379-the latter close to [her]2353-a lady in black with a little girl , and looked past [Zinnie]133-zinnie as if [she]2353-a lady in black with a little girl had not been there .... At last there came a lull in the traffic , [the attendants]2355-the attendants relapsed into lassitude , and [Zinnie]133-zinnie , after circling aimlessly about [the hall]711-the hall , slipped behind [the porter]3050-the porter ’s desk , inspected the letters in the mahogany pigeon - holes against the wall , and began to turn over the papers on the desk . Then [she]133-zinnie caught sight of [the porter]3050-the porter approaching from a distance , slid out from behind the desk , waltzed down the length of [the hall]711-the hall and back , and stopped with a yawn just in front of [Boyne]145-boyne . For a moment [she]133-zinnie did not seem to notice [him]145-boyne ; but presently [she]133-zinnie sidled up , leaned over [his]145-boyne shoulder , and said persuasively : “ May [I]133-zinnie look at the pictures with [you]145-boyne ? ”[133-zinnie] [He]145-boyne laid the paper aside and glanced up at [her]133-zinnie . [She]133-zinnie stared a moment or two , perplexedly , and then flushed to the roots of [her]133-zinnie hair . “ [Martin]193-martin — why , [I]133-zinnie believe it ’s old [Martin]193-martin ! ”[133-zinnie] “ Yes , it ’s old [Martin]193-martin — but [you]133-zinnie ’re [a new Zinnie]4271-a new zinnie , are n’t [you]133-zinnie ? ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne rejoined . [Her]133-zinnie eyes were riveted on [him]145-boyne ; [he]145-boyne saw that [she]133-zinnie was half shy , half eager to talk . [She]133-zinnie perched on the arm of [his]145-boyne chair and took [his]145-boyne neck in [her]133-zinnie embrace , as [Judith]127-judith used to . “ Well , it ’s a long time since [I]133-zinnie saw [you]145-boyne . [I]133-zinnie ’m lots older — and [you]145-boyne are too , ”[133-zinnie] [she]133-zinnie added reflectively . “ [I]133-zinnie do n’t believe [you]145-boyne ’d have known [me]133-zinnie if [I]133-zinnie had n’t spoken to [you]145-boyne , would [you]145-boyne ? ”[133-zinnie] “ Not if [you]133-zinnie had n’t had that burning bush , ”[145-boyne] [he]145-boyne said , touching [her]133-zinnie hair . [His]145-boyne voice was trembling ; [he]145-boyne could hardly see [her]133-zinnie for the blur in [his]145-boyne eyes . [I]145-boyne was never better . [He]145-boyne had really meant , while [he]145-boyne talked with [her]133-zinnie , to go back to [[his]145-boyne hotel]925-his hotel and pack up , and catch [the next train]2365-the next train for anywhere . [The place]601-the place was like a tomb to [him]145-boyne now ; under all the noise and glitter [his]145-boyne past was buried . [He]145-boyne walked away with hurried strides from [the _ Mirasol _]2367-the _ mirasol _ ; but when [he]145-boyne got back to [[his]145-boyne own hotel]2368-his own hotel [he]145-boyne sat down in [[his]145-boyne room]1810-his room and stared about [him]145-boyne without making any effort to pack . [He]145-boyne sat there for a long time — for all the rest of the afternoon — without moving . Once [he]145-boyne caught [himself]145-boyne saying aloud : “ [She]4310-she ’s got a new dress for the dance . ”[145-boyne] [He]145-boyne laughed a little at the thought , and became immersed in [his]145-boyne memories .... [Boyne]145-boyne dined at [a restaurant]2370-a restaurant — [he]145-boyne did n’t remember where — turned in at [a cinema]2371-a cinema for an hour , and then got into [his]145-boyne evening clothes , and walked up through the warm dark night to [the _ Mirasol _]2367-the _ mirasol _ . [The great building , shining with lights]2373-the great building , shining with lights , loomed above [a tranquil sea]2374-a tranquil sea ; music drifted out from it , and on the side toward [the sea]589-the sea [its]2373-the great building , shining with lights wide terrace was thronged with [ladies in bright dresses]2376-ladies in bright dresses , and [[their]2376-ladies in bright dresses partners]2303-their partners . [Boyne]145-boyne walked up among [them]2376-ladies in bright dresses ; but as [he]145-boyne reached [the terrace]2378-the terrace a drizzling rain began to fall , and laughing and crying out [the dancers]2379-the dancers all hurried back into [the hotel]1085-the hotel . [He]145-boyne stood alone on the damp flagging , and paced up and down slowly before the uncurtained windows . The dinner was over — [the restaurant]473-the restaurant was empty , and through the windows [he]145-boyne saw [the waiters]2382-the waiters preparing the tables again for supper . Farther on , [he]145-boyne passed other tall windows , giving on [a richly upholstered drawing - room]2383-a richly upholstered drawing - room where groups of [elderly people , at tables with shaded lamps]2384-elderly people , at tables with shaded lamps , were playing bridge and poker . Among [them]2376-ladies in bright dresses [he]145-boyne noticed [a stout lady in a low - necked black dress]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress . [Her]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress much - exposed back was turned to [him]145-boyne , and [he]145-boyne recognised the shape of [her]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress head , the thatch of rippled hair , silver - white now ( [she]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress had kept [her]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress resolve of not dyeing it ) , and the turn of [her]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress white arms as [she]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress handled [her]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress cards . Opposite [her]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress sat [[her]2385-a stout lady in a low - necked black dress partner]2386-her partner , also white - headed , in a perfectly cut dinner - jacket ; the lamplight seemed to linger appreciatively on [his]2386-her partner lustrous pearl studs and sleeve - links . It was [Mr. Dobree]200-mr. dobree , grown stouter too , with a reddish fold of flesh above [his]200-mr. dobree immaculate collar . [The couple]528-the couple looked placid , well fed , and perfectly satisfied with life and with [each other]396-each other . [Boyne]145-boyne continued [his]145-boyne walk , and turning an angle of [the building]2389-the building , found [himself]145-boyne facing the windows of [the ballroom]2390-the ballroom . [The terrace on that side , being away from [the sea]589-the sea]2391-the terrace on that side , being away from the sea , was but faintly lit , and the spectacle within seemed therefore more brilliantly illuminated . At first [he]145-boyne saw only a blur of light and colour ; [couples revolving slowly under the spreading chandeliers]2393-couples revolving slowly under the spreading chandeliers , others streaming in and out of the doorways , or grouped about the floor in splashes of brightness . The music rose and fell in palpitating rhythms , paused awhile , and began again in obedience to a rattle of hand - clapping . The floor was already crowded , but [Boyne]145-boyne ’s eyes roved in vain from one slender bare - armed shape to another ; then [he]145-boyne said to [himself]145-boyne : “ But it ’s nearly three years since [I]145-boyne saw [her]127-judith . [She]127-judith ’s grown up now — perhaps [I]145-boyne ’m looking at [her]127-judith without knowing [her]127-judith .... ”[145-boyne] The thought that one of those swaying figures might be [Judith]127-judith ’s , that at that very instant [she]127-judith might be gazing out at [him]145-boyne with unknown eyes , sent such a pang through [him]145-boyne that [he]145-boyne moved away again into the darkness . The rain had almost ceased , but a faint wind from [the sea]589-the sea drove the wet air against [his]145-boyne face ; [he]145-boyne might almost have fancied [he]145-boyne was crying . The pain of not seeing [her]127-judith was unendurable . It seemed to empty [his]145-boyne world .... [He]145-boyne heard voices and steps approaching behind [him]145-boyne on [the terrace]2378-the terrace , and to avoid being scrutinised [he]145-boyne mechanically turned back to the window . And there [she]127-judith was , close to [him]145-boyne on the other side of the pane , moving across the long reflections of the floor . And [he]145-boyne had imagined that [he]145-boyne might not know [her]127-judith ! [She]127-judith had just stopped dancing ; the arm of [a very tall young man with a head as glossy as [his]2396-a very tall young man with a head as glossy as his shirt - front shirt - front]2396-a very tall young man with a head as glossy as his shirt - front detached itself from [her]127-judith waist . [She]127-judith was facing [Boyne]145-boyne now — [she]127-judith was joining [a group near [his]145-boyne window]2397-a group near his window . [Two or three young girls]2398-two or three young girls greeted [her]127-judith gaily as [she]127-judith passed [them]2398-two or three young girls . The centre of [the room]1180-the room was being cleared for [a pair of [professional dancers]2401-professional dancers]2400-a pair of professional dancers , and [Judith]127-judith , waving away a gilt ballroom chair which [somebody proffered]2402-somebody proffered , remained standing , clustered about by [other slender and glossy young men]2403-other slender and glossy young men . [Boyne]145-boyne , from without , continued to gaze at [her]127-judith . [He]145-boyne had not even asked [himself]145-boyne if [she]127-judith had changed — if [she]127-judith had grown up . [He]145-boyne had totally forgotten [his]145-boyne fear that [he]145-boyne might not recognise [her]127-judith . [He]145-boyne knew now that if [she]127-judith had appeared to [him]145-boyne as [a bent old woman]2404-a bent old woman [he]145-boyne would have known [her]127-judith .... [He]145-boyne watched [her]127-judith with a passionate attentiveness . [Her]127-judith silk dress was of that peculiar carnation - pink which takes a silver glaze like the bloom on a nectarine . The rich stuff stood out from [her]127-judith in a double tier of flounces , on which , as [she]127-judith stood motionless , [her]127-judith hands seemed to float like birds on little sunlit waves . [Her]127-judith hair was moulded to [her]127-judith head in close curves like the ripples of a brown stream . Instead of being cut short in the nape it had been allowed to grow , and was twisted into a figure eight , through which was thrust an old - fashioned diamond arrow . [Her]127-judith throat and neck were bare , and so were [her]127-judith thin arms ; but a band of black velvet encircled one of [her]127-judith wrists , relieving the tender rose - and - amber of [her]127-judith dress and complexion . [Her]127-judith eyes seemed to [Boyne]145-boyne to have grown larger and more remote , but [her]127-judith mouth was round and red , as it always was when [she]127-judith was amused or happy . While [he]145-boyne watched [her]127-judith [one of [the young men behind [her]127-judith]2406-the young men behind her]2405-one of the young men behind her bent over to say something . As [she]127-judith listened [she]127-judith lifted a big black fan to [her]127-judith lips , and [her]127-judith lids closed for a second , as they did when [she]127-judith wanted to hold something sweet between them . But when [she]127-judith furled the fan [her]127-judith expression changed , and [her]127-judith face suddenly became as sad as an autumn twilight . “ _ [Judith]127-judith ! _ ”[127-judith] [Boyne]145-boyne thought ; as if [her]127-judith being [Judith]127-judith , [her]127-judith being [herself]127-judith , were impossible to believe , yet too sweet for anything else in [the world]307-the world to be true .... It was one of [her]127-judith moments of beauty — that fitful beauty which is so much more enchanting and perilous than the kind that gets up and lies down every day with [its wearer]2408-its wearer . This might be — [Boyne]145-boyne said to [himself]145-boyne — literally the only day , the only hour , in which the queer quarrelling elements that composed [her]127-judith would ever join hands in a celestial harmony . It did not matter what had brought the miracle about . Perhaps [she]127-judith was in love with [the young man who had bent over [her]127-judith]2409-the young man who had bent over her , and was going to marry [him]2409-the young man who had bent over her . Or perhaps [she]127-judith was still [a child]435-a child , pleased at [her]127-judith new dress , and half proud , half frightened in the waking consciousness of [her]127-judith beauty , and the power it exercised .... Whichever it was , [Boyne]145-boyne knew [he]145-boyne would never know . [He]145-boyne drew back into an unlit corner of [the terrace]2378-the terrace , and sat there a long time in the dark , [his]145-boyne head thrown back and [his]145-boyne hands locked behind it . Then [he]145-boyne got up and walked away into the night . Two days afterward , [the ship]318-the ship which had brought [him]145-boyne to [Europe]24-europe started on [her]318-the ship voyage back to [Brazil]28-brazil . On [[her]318-the ship deck]2413-her deck stood [Boyne]145-boyne , [a lonely man]2414-a lonely man .
